story:
Lab(Oratory) Podcast

Lab(Oratory) Podcast is a web-based radio program with the purpose of showcasing the human side of science using recorded interviews from Retired or Emeritus Status Scientists. Through these interviews we'll lift the veil on the Science Community and allow our listeners to get a better understanding of the world of science, the history of scientific discoveries, the challenges of research, and the changes the science community has gone through over the years. 

For more info head over to : LabOratory-Podcast.com

Why Lab(Oratory) Podcast?

There is a generation of scientists with stories that haven’t been told. Stories of why and how they got into the field, stories of the methods they used that are being forgotten due to technological advances, stories of others they have worked alongside, and stories of how the scientific community as well as the public have both resisted and welcomed changes to the accepted norms through the years. 

On top of this, we feel that there is a distinct disconnect between people who do scientific research for their living versus those who do not, where scientists are often portrayed as cold, unapproachable, and having a “better than thou” mindset.

We believe that sharing these stories can not only educate us into lesser known areas of science, but also remind us that we are truly part of a human community. A community that relies on each person’s input and contribution, no matter how large, small, or publicly advertised it may be. 

Who Are The Lab(Oratory) Podcasters?

RENE:  Rene is our resident scientist, and the "Lab" part of LabOratory! She studied at Carnegie Mellon University, where she did her undergrad and master's in Biological Sciences and Computational Biology. Currently she works as a Research Assistant at Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution where she studies genetics of the ocean. When not in the lab, you can find her on stage in local theater productions, baking up nerdy and delicious baked goods in her kitchen, or hanging out with horseshoe crabs on the tidal flats of Cape Cod. 

SAM: Sam is our Sound Designer extraordinaire, and the "Oratory" part of LabOratory! Originally from Pennsylvania, she has her Master's in Sound Design from CalArts and through the years has worked with a variety of theaters on some great projects, from Pippin at the A.R.T. in Cambridge to Stomp in New York City. Sam loves playing sports, yoga, and has a not-so-secret talent of creating amazing works of chalkboard art.

What We're Looking For

We are just getting started and that means we need your help! In order to get these stories out into the world we are asking for $3,000 to help to support our endeavor and follow through with initial podcasting startup costs such as web hosting, recording equipment, and editing fees.

ALSO!

We have been accepted to present our Podcast at the Ocean Sciences 2020 Conference this February and with your generous support we will be able to cover conference fees as well as presentation and travel fees and further our goals as well as our audience!

If We Do Not Reach Our Goal

ALL funds raised will still go to sharing our recordings, getting the podcast up and running, and helping us spread the word at the Ocean Sciences Conference in San Diego February of 2020!

We've Got Perks!

Support our podcast and you can look forward to perks!

From social media shoutouts to bumper stickers to handwritten thank you notes, we want to honor YOU, the generous donors!  

Go on and take a gander at the right side of your screen for the finer details. 

We appreciate everyone who donates, as every little bit helps!

Other Ways You Can Help!

If donating isn't in the cards but you want to support our endeavor feel free to spread the word! 

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools on all Social Media Platforms!
     
  • Check out our Website and Subscribe to our Mailing list at : Laboratory-Podcast.com
     
  • Check out our Instagram and like us @LabOratoryPodcast

We deeply appreciate all the help we can get in this endeavor and look forward to sharing these stories with you and the rest of the world!

story:
You understand that traditional arts journalism is in decline. Now more than ever my grassroots podcast fills a growing void.

When I launched my podcast back in 2013, I was inspired by the many creative artists by whom Ontario is blessed. I wanted to celebrate the wellsprings of creativity that have made this province and Canada itself a mecca for those who dedicate themselves to the very highest ideals in the arts.

For every Shatner, Carrey, or Bieber we lose to the mediocrity of Hollywood and American culture, a score or more remain in Canada to create world-class theatre, comedy, and music. A few, a happy few, make the reverse journey northward to put down roots here and prosper. What drives them? What do they have to teach us? I needed to know and felt compelled to share their stories.

Milton said he wrote “Paradise Lost” to “justify the ways of God to men.” Isn’t that what all art does – high and low – in that it reconciles us to the ineffable sadness of the human condition? The people I bring to you on the podcast are the artists who lead us into a deeper understanding of ourselves and the world we inhabit.

The next 100 episodes will continue the conversation with performers and creators but with a new focus on discussions that educate, inspire and empower creative people, while encouraging the benefits of a healthy and balanced lifestyle.

 

The Rationale:

Arts enthusiasts like you have heard my podcast interviews with exciting performers including Chilina Kennedy, Cyrus Lane and Mike Shara as well as innovative creators including Donna Feore (Stratford Festival), Irene Sankoff & David Hein (“Come From Away”) and Ins Choi (“Kim’s Convenience”).

 

All of these world-class artists have graciously given their time to share stories about overcoming the challenges they faced on their road to success.

 

Now you can ensure that the stories keep being told with a donation to help defer the costs associated with producing 100 new interviews.

 

Let’s be honest, I love the quote from Brecht that inspired my former title: “Do not fear death so much, but rather the inadequate life,” but it lacked a direct connection to the arts and creators. By changing the name to the “Performers Podcast,” it’s clear who these conversations are about.

 

Why Donate?

The “Performers Podcast” joins a legion of providers in the Canadian arts scene, from long-established theatre festivals to scruffy black box productions in borrowed spaces, to the growing archipelago of comedy clubs, to concert venues and church halls.

 

If you agree that the “Performers Podcast” fills a niche by sharing stories from the artists who bring these spaces to life, for as little as $20 you can signal your support of the arts journalism we are creating.

 

If you can’t donate?

If you aren’t in a position to donate, the next best thing you can do is share this project with others who may enjoy it. Email it to your aunt who sees productions at Stratford and Shaw every year.

 

Share this on your social media with a simple “Hey, my friend is working on this project I thought you’d like to know about. ”

 

Where Does the Money Go?:

 


 

 

 

As you can see, recording the podcast is only a small piece of what goes into making a podcast of this scale.

 

Our sponsors cover a small portion of the costs, but I limit the number of ads so you don't have to endure too many commercial messages.

 

FUNDRAISING Goal - $5,000

Just as theatre festivals cannot do without the growing list of small-print names that fill page after page in their programs, I cannot fulfill the “Performers Podcast” true promise without your support.

 

The goal of this campaign is modest, just $5,000. I’m told that $5,000 is the average cost of a costume at the Stratford Festival!

 

$5,000 works out to $50 an episode, but as in so much within the arts, your assistance will go a long way. You’ll help motivate creators young and old who find the interviews inspiring and life-affirming.

 

If you think that our artists deserve to be celebrated, then I hope you will join me in this ongoing endeavour.  

What Can You Get?

 

The People Behind the Scenes of the Podcast:

 

Megan Arnold

Megan is a Filipinx-Canadian multidisciplinary artist and multifaceted human being living and working in London, Ontario. Since completing the web illustrations for The Inadequate Life in 2013 and graduating from Western University's visual arts program in 2015, she has gone on to exhibit and perform across Canada and Europe.

 

Christine Gruenbauer

Christine is the newest addition to the team, using her theatre producer skills to keep everything on track. Christine is an emerging arts manager, graduating from Western university in 2017 with a diploma of Arts Management. Recently a theatre company Christine founded, Allswell Productions, produced "Dogfight."

I first met Christine at the London Fringe Festival.

 

Michelle Lecnik

Michelle wrote, played, and produced the podcast theme music. She is the driving force behind the anti-rock band Trampoline, who are in the final stages of recording their debut full length album Happy Crimes.

I first met Michelle when she was 10 years old. Her family lived next door to me.

It's been wonderful to watch Michelle blossom into a passionate, talented musician.

 

Lionel Morise

Lionel designed and developed our website and created most of the graphical elements. He is both an enthusiast and a supporter of the performing arts.

I met Lionel through the Fringe Festival and he’s designed several campaigns for my social media marketing clients.

 

Emily Stewart

Emily uses her audio editing skills to ensure everything sounds great. Emily studied Broadcast Journalism at Fanshawe College and holds a BA from Western University. Emily utilizes her skills to serve the community, most recently completing the the mini-documentary series “Histories of London.”.

I first met Emily when she did an internship on my website Stratford Festival Reviews.

 

Please donate and listen to your generosity in action.

story:
Short Summary

A honey roast is like a comedy roast, but only sweet and nice things!

Honey Roast is a podcast where every other week, guest stars “roast” a creator  that they love and are inspired by. Together, we’re bringing a little more love and hope in the world and introducing listeners to new creators through sweetness and delight.

Honey Roast was born from the idea that it feels good when love, sweetness, and kindness is directed to you, to a creator you also love, or even to someone you don’t know but now get to discover.

It’s all wholesome hopepunk, which is something we need a little bit more of in the world today.

About The Creator (Tess)

I’m Tess. I care a lot about making my communities a better, more hopeful, and more celebratory space. We’re doing so many amazing things, and I want the world to know about them.

This campaign is so important to me because YOU are important to me. Creators inspire me, make me laugh, make me cry, give me something to connect with. I want to help you make a connection. I want you to hear your favourite creators gushing about their favourite creators. I want you to be inspired and end an episode feeling the love, care, passion, and hope.

Crew Members

Our crew include Podcast Consultant Wil Williams, Indiegogo Consultant Alex Hensley, Composer Emily E. Meo, Graphic Artist Mandy Corcoran, and Sound Designer/Co-Producer Julia Schifini!

What We Need

I truly believe in creators and artists being paid fair wages, especially since I am limited by my own abilities as well as what I can personally pay. This indiegogo is largely covering the costs of getting the show off to its best start, which means paying for Graphic Design (logo, header, icon, other art assets), Website-related Costs (hosting & domain), Music Composition, Consultations, and Sound Design.

Ideally, I’d also like to pay all of the guest stars. They’ve generously donated their time, but I’d like to give back to them. And I’d like to be able to pay myself too, but more about that in the Stretch Goals.

Listen to the Trailers

You can listen to the trailer "Introducing Honey Roast" by clicking here.

You can listen to the mini -trailer "What's a Honey Roast" by clicking here.
 

What You Get: The Sweet Goodies

I truly believe in giving back to my community, and that’s not limited to the Podcasting Community! As such, I’ve centred all of the perks around supporting both me AND local Canadian bee farmers. Each honey product will be sourced from a *different* local honey farmer so that we’re supporting many different local farms!

Sweet Supporter: Credit & A Shout-Out

You’ll receive your name on honeyroastpod.com AND we’ll shout out our thanks to you on Twitter!

Party Bee: Live-Listen Pre-Launch Party

You’ll receive a link in your inbox to a live-listen pre-launch party where we’ll do a live listen of the first THREE episodes together, a few days before launch! You'll also get all lower tier perks.

Sticky Sweetheart: The Cutest Sticker

You’ll receive a cute lil’ sticker to remind you of how sweet the world can be. You'll also get all lower tier perks.

Bee Sweet: A Beeswax Bar

You’ll receive a sweet little beeswax bar; Beeswax has been used for thousands of years, let’s make it a few more! You'll also get all lower tier perks.

Sweet Tooth: Honey Caramels

You’ll receive an entire bag of sweet melt-in-your-mouth honey caramels! You'll also get all lower tier perks.

Smooth Sweetness: A Honey Dripper

You’ll receive a honey dripper for drizzling your honey perfectly on toast, in tea, or into a measuring spoon. It's the best honey accessory! You'll also get all lower tier perks.

Producer Bee: Producer

You’ll be a producer! Your name will be called out at the beginning of each episode in Season 1 as a thank you! You'll also get all lower tier perks, and maybe even a secret surprise that will be announced later in the campaign!

Honey Bee: Local Canadian Honey

You’ll receive a jar of HONEY; The only thing sweeter than a Honey Roast is actual honey! You'll also get all lower tier perks.

Luxury Sweetie: Raw Honeycomb

You’ll receive an actual raw honeycomb. Honeycomb is the rawest form of honey and is a luxurious topping or pairing for cheese, fruit, meat, and bread. You'll also get all lower tier perks.

**honey not pictured but is 100% pure raw Canadian honey and the honey dripper

Our Suppliers

Three Foragers, Drizzle, and True North Apiary

Stretch Goals

$3700

When we hit this stretch goal, every guest will receive a $75 payment for their time. Right now, each guest has generously donated their time to the show. I'd like to be able to pay them what they're worth.

$4200

When we hit this stretch goal, I get paid. In the city I live in, minimum wage is $15 per hour. I put in about 6-8 hours per episode, which means production hours add up very quickly. This stretch goals allows me to keep dedicating time and effort into making this the best possible show. And frankly, if I get paid, that money goes straight back into making the show even better, as I will then be in a position to upgrade my equipment and mini sound studio.

$4800

When we hit this stretch goal, money starts going back into the pockets of the creators we love. Each creator roasted on the show will receive a donation to their Patreon/Ko-Fi/etc - just because we love them!

$6800

Wow wow wow!! When we hit this stretch goal, I'll be able to commission a piece of art featuring all of the roasters and roastees!

Risks & Challenges

There is always a risk in any production. I am committed to being transparent to all of my supporters; whether it be about shipping delays/issues or pushing episode release deadlines.

Frankly, I don’t foresee any challenges in the episode releases. At this point, all episodes in Season 1 have been recorded and more than 50% of them have been edited and produced.

The biggest challenges will be twofold:

  1. International Shipping: I live in Canada. Recently our postal service went on strike. I’m committed to making sure supporters get their rewards, but that may mean that should the postal service strike again, supporters either have to wait longer OR I look into paying premium shipping costs for third-party shipping.
     
  2. Honey Harvest: From my understanding, honey is harvested twice per year: once in the Spring and once in the Fall. To counter this, I’ve limited the amount of physical honey product perks available so that I don’t have to worry about overcommitting what I can realistically source from local farmers. This shouldn’t affect the expected delivery date for these products, unless the weather or other unexpected environmental events affect the ability for harvest to occur.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want other special rewards and access to bonus content, consider becoming a supporter on Patreon!

If you can’t contribute financially, there are other ways you can spread the word and help out:

  • Share this campaign to your friends and family! Even if they aren't listeners, you never know who may need some sweet honey bee products.
  • Hype the show, trailer, and artwork on social media! You can follow on Twitter @HoneyRoastPod.

And that's all there is to it.

To counter this, I’ve limited the amount of physical honey product perks available so that I don’t have to worry about overcommitting what I can realistically source from local farmers. This shouldn’t affect the expected delivery date for these products, unless the weather or other unexpected environmental events affect the ability for harvest to occur.
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you want other special rewards and access to bonus content, consider becoming a supporter on Patreon!If you can’t contribute financially, there are other ways you can spread the word and help out:
Share this campaign to your friends and family! Even if they aren't listeners, you never know who may need some sweet honey bee products.
Hype the show, trailer, and artwork on social media! You can follow on Twitter @HoneyRoastPod.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
We love neighborhoods.

We love the church. 

We believe that churches embedded in walkable neighborhoods have unique opportunities to do ministry in creative ways. We started The Embedded Church Podcast as an outlet for sharing the dynamic stories of churches harnessing opportunities in their local, walkable context to reach their neighborhoods for the common good. 

We believe this work of churches is increasingly vital as we see two cultural shifts happening in our cities: 1) people are moving back to the city, looking for walkable, connected communities; 2) people are lonelier than ever. The church has a crucial role to play in connecting people to a place and to one another. Jeremiah 29:7 calls us to "seek the welfare of the city where I have sent you into exile, and pray to the Lord on its behalf, for in its welfare you will find your welfare."

We want to grow the vision.

With Season 1 under our belt, we want to keep sharing the stories that have already inspired our listeners, sparked generous gifts, and taught us the value of listening to local community needs. We are so thankful for the support and encouragement we've received from our listeners. We fully believe this podcast has the capacity to grow and encourage, resource, and ignite church leaders across our country to take active and creative steps to fight against the loneliness permeating the lives of so many people in our neighborhoods and congregations. We hope to see congregations across America become catalyzers of belonging and purpose within the neighborhoods where they meet, fostering a deep community that promotes the welfare of our churches and our cities. 

Will you join with us in this good work?

We need your help to make that happen! Our budget is small. Currently, neither Eric nor Sara Joy are compensated for their time. We are simply asking for your financial support to cover costs of audio editing and website maintenance to help us take on Season 2 (targeted for spring/summer 2020).

You can also support us in these ways -- Encourage your family and friends to listen! Share a link to the podcast on your social media! Write a review on Apple Podcasts, Google Podcasts, or wherever you listen! Send us ideas for topics and future podcast guests!

You can connect with us via email at "info at embeddedchurch.com" and follow us on Instagram @embeddedchurchpodcast.

 

*Due to the unknown implications of covid-19, deliveries of perks may be delayed. We ask for your patience and grace if we are unable to meet the target date of June 2020 for perk delivery.

story:
WHAT IT IS:

The Vanishing Act is a 12(ish) part miniseries podcast farce about a German set designer, an American con-man, a mysterious scientist, a disappearing magician, and a duck.

In 1699, at the premiere of his newest masterpiece, renowned stage magician Jean- Jacquline Lemarque caused the 2nd or 3rd greatest disappearance-related theatrical tragedy in history, and was never seen again…

In 1933, a prickly German theater artist, an American conman, and an unfortunately-named mechanical engineer globetrot from Berlin to Paris to Hollywood, encountering artistic geniuses, secret societies, and plagiarists in an attempt to unfold the mystery of Lemarque’s Vanishing Act...or at the very least avoid doing any actual work.

A farce, a historical satire, a heist, a con, a murder mystery, and a disappearing act all at once, THE VANISHING ACT finds a slew of off-color characters at odds with art, fame, magic, and history in the making.

The series will consist of 12(ish) episodes of 35-45 minutes each.

ACT I (Episodes 1-4) are available on all podcast providers.

more info at http://vanishingpod.com

 

WHO MAKES THE MAGIC HAPPEN?

CREATOR/HEAD WRITER/DIRECTOR: Ian Geers (he/him)

PRODUCER/WRITER/DIRECTOR: Lauren Grace Thompson (she/her)

SOUND DESIGNER/SOUND ENGINEER: Daniel Etti-Williams (he/him)

MUSIC DESIGNER/COMPOSER: Baldemar (he/him)

MARKETING DIRECTOR: Anna Rachel Troy (she/her)

CAST:

AUGIE ECKHART: Sarah Price (she/her)

CONRAD WEBLEY GRIFFSON: Daniel Millhouse (he/him)

LILITH VON HITZLER: Tina Muñoz Pandya (she/her)

RUDYARD T CODSWALLOP: Sam Hubbard (he/him)

LEMARQUE/GRAVEMAN/SCHWANZKOPH: Chris Vizurraga (he/him)

ANTON HIRSCHFELDER: Laurence Stepney (he/him)

BERNADETTE GLOB/RADDISON: Corrbette Pasko (she/her)

TABITHA GLOB: Maeve Devitt (she/her)

GUNTHER ZIMMER: Jacob Mundell (he/him)

HENRI PICQUART/MAURIE PICQUART JR: Robert Kauzlauric (he/him)

VICKY ST. FRANCIS/VARIOUS: Jess Ridenour (she/her)

MISHA/TOMMY/VARIOUS: Eric Eilersen (he/him)

MAXIMILLIAN BOUR/AUGUSTE DE BOUR/VARIOUS: Shawn Pfautsch (he/him)

MAXINE BOUR: Janice L. Blixt (she/her)

CHARLES DUFRENE: Miguel Long (he/him)

MRS. PICQUART: Anna Troy (she/her)

NARRATOR: Lauren Grace Thompson (she/her)

NARRATOR #2: David Blixt (he/him)

FEMBART/S.S. OFFICER #2: Michael Morrow (he/him)

DR. BAILEY/S.S. OFFICER #3: Jay Donley (he/him)

S.S. OFFICER #1: Brandon Wilders (he/him)

BELINDA/LILITH'S MOTHER: Lydia Hiller (she/her)

FRANCOIS/GOULD/VARIOUS: Daniel Etti-Williams (he/him)

AND MANY, MANY, MANY, MAYBE TOO MANY MORE. . .

All of these incredibly talented performers have put in their time, equipment, and home recording set-ups to ensure the project continues in the safest way possible. As a group of artists that all hail from the storefront theater scene we're very used to "doing what we can, with what we have" which has led to investment in new recording equipment, learning remote recording technology, and even creating blanket forts to ensure sound quality. Our goal is to always ensure the best possible show we can, in a way that allows our performers the safety and support they deserve. 

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT:

As those embedded in the storefront arts scene, we recognize how far a dollar can stretch. You can do it in so many ways! That being said, in this community time, resources, and compensation don't always align as well as we'd hope. Even in the modest compensation our team has agreed to for their involvement in The Vanishing Act, we know at the foundational level that they deserve more. Large tenants of this show are built on jokes about artists' resourcefulness and being monetarily short-shifted while contributing beautiful and insightful experiences to the world around them and basically, we'd love if this wasn't a joke! We believe in fair and honest compensation for our team's efforts and contributions, and while we're aware no crowdfunding campaign will fully be able to do that, it's, at the very least, a start. 

 

WHERE IS YOUR MONEY GOING? GOOD QUESTION!

100% of the profits made from this Indiegogo will be distributed evenly among our team. 

Don't believe us? Look at this picture!

                                               

 

How you know we're real:

Once again, check out vanishingpod.com. You think we'd go through all the trouble of making a website that involved for nothing? Don't answer that.

Want more proof? We're lucky enough to be finalists in 6 categories at The Audio Verse Awards:

 

We also have incredibly nice reviews!

"This podcast has made me smile so wide since episode one! It's a real treat of a story with characters I immediately got attached to and can't wait to learn more about! It's very well structured and manages to find a nice balance between its most humorous moments and the underlying unease of what's beginning to happen in 1930s Berlin (which is mostly thanks to Augie, who's already one of my absolute faves!) It's got some memorable, funny and relatable moments, the cast is phenomenal and it's just so good! For real, I'm smiling just thinking about it :D"

-Mimi Dove (Apple Podcasts, Italy)

"The show, while steeped in historical context, is raunchy, off-beat and genuinely hilarious. Leave behind your conceptions of "good people" as you trail behind a protagonist with limited morals, a sharp tongue, and the impulse control of a toddler. Even the background characters are gems, every interaction is just...fun!

Definitely give it a listen...provided there are no children around, or the children in question already have a colorful vocabulary and are looking to up the ante."

-ItMe9612 (Stitcher)

"The Vanishing Act blends high and low comedy brilliantly. The tone is light and witty. And it is very witty - full of Shakespeare and other literary references, a man named Mr. Schwanzkopf, and totally believable artsy characters. The premise is very original and refreshing - a 17th century magic trick gone wrong and early 20th century characters trying to figure out what happened. The performances and spectacular!"

-Christopher McClure, The Milkman of St Gaff’s

"I don't know how to describe how much I love this show. Perfectly cast, perfectly executed, and GODS I didn't know it was possibly to laugh this much!!"

-Abigail Eliza, Back Again Back Again

"It goes in a quadrangle with @Victoriocity, @middle_below, and @Oz9podcast where if you like one of them, you’ll like at least 2 others!"

-BelieverPod

"Finally got round to starting @vanishingpod (thanks @GejWatts for the nudge!) and I am having a blast! Really enjoying it so far (fun, funny, and great sound design!)"

-Jen Sugden

"Have you heard of @vanishingpod? It's a global, time-spanning adventure centered around a famous magician's Vanishing Act. Part heist, part murder mystery, part history, & part comedy, it's already off to a strong start!"

-Anonymous

"The Vanishing Act is a satire in the vein of bleak and absurd British comedy, that includes recurring portrayals of the rise of fascism and antisemitism in the 1930s, with snark aimed directly at the oppressors. This story of theater, heists, and murder is perfect for fans of Victoriocity or Clue."

-The Bello Collective

"You get even more out of it the second time through!"

-My Dad

So we're real.

story:
Why is Beach Softball Important?

The sport of softball gives so much to young ladies across the globe.  It empowers them, keeps them active and athletic, teaches them valuable life lessons, and gives them confidence that will carry over into all aspects of their lives.  Our goal is to educate those coaches who will be impacting these athletes.  We want to share our knowledge with the world to grow and improve this sport and to hopefully impact thousands of youth softball players around the world.  

"Who" is Beach Softball?

This program is lead by some of the greatest minds of the sport, spear headed by Erica Beach, 1st Team NCAA Division I All American, 5 Time Pro Athlete, and 11 years of Division I coaching experience and her team of incredible coaches from across the country.  These coaches will include NCAA Champions, Olympic Gold Medalists, National Champions, Professional Champions, and some of the top experts in the world. 

"What" is Beach Softball?

Beach Softball is an online training program for fastpitch softball coaches.  It will be a monthly subscription based program that will cover all areas of the sport, as well as instruction on how to actually coach today's athletes in a multitude of methods.  There will be video lesson plans created by some of the best and most iconic coaches in the world, as well as online tutorials, live webinars and chats, live events across the country, online lesson plans, downloadable content and documents, a strong online community, etc.  The goal is to share as much information about this sport as possible with our students (the coaches). 

 

This is YOUR chance to back something that will impact thousands of young women around the world.  Help Beach Softball make this amazing sport even better!

 

 

ABOUT ERICA BEACH

In Her Words...

I spent most of my life in the world of athletics.

I grew up in Scottsdale, Arizona, and pitched my way to 4 straight state championships in high school, while being named National Champions and receiving 1st Team All American honors.  

I went to college at Arizona State, and we went to the Women’s College World Series in 1999 and 2002. I was also honored to be named to the WCWS All-Tournament Team as a pitcher that year as well as a 1st Team All-American in 1999.

After graduating in 2003, I began playing semi-professionally in the Netherlands with the Sparks Haarlem. We won the 2003 European Cup championship, and I was named the Most Outstanding Pitcher.

What made me proud was that same year, while an assistant coach, I helped lead two high school softball programs to state tournaments.

In 2004 I began my professional softball career in the US playing in the National Pro Fastpitch league for the Arizona Heat.  In my rookie season I made the All Star team and competed vs. the USA Olympic Team.  I competed two seasons for the Arizona Heat before making my move to New England.

From 2006-2008, while playing with the New England Riptide, you might have seen me if you were watching the NPF Championships, where we won it all! 

Also in 2006, I joined the coaching staff at Ohio State. While working with the Buckeyes, the pitchers and catchers I coached earned 3 All-America selections, 7 All-Region honors and 1 Big Ten Freshman of the Year.

I then spent 7 years as the head softball coach for the University of New Mexico in Albuquerque. I’m proud to say we lead the NCAA in home runs per game and made major improvements to the program.

I have spent many years speaking at various coaches clinics and conventions around the country...including the NFCA National Coaches Convention, Ohio State High School Coaches Convention, Mary Nutter Coaching Clinics, and many more!

 

There are other ways you can help us! Here are a few...

  1. Let's get social. You can follow us on Facebook for lots of updates and the "what's happenings", but you can also follow us on Instagram, Twitter, and be sure to watch our videos on YouTube! You can LIKE and SHARE our posts and help connect our campaign with your friends to help us reach our goal. 
     
  2. Share this with your family and friends. We need to reach as many people as we can, and we can't do it alone, we need your help. If you're following us, encourage others to follow us to post and re-post our content. 
     
  3. Send us selfie pictures of you rockin' our swag. If you contribute to our campaign (thank you so much for supporting us) be sure to take a picture and send it to us. Post it on your social media and tag us, post it on our social media, and/or it e-mail it to us so we can share you rockin' out with our awesome gear across the internet! 
     
  4. Lights, camera, action! Make a short video and let us see the excitement on your face for the launch of Beach Softball! Send the video to us and we'll post it online. 

 

Every dollar counts and we'll put every cent to work to make Beach Softball the #1 resource for softball coaches to make this great sport even better! The monies raised from this campaign will go to start-up and business development costs. Here's a more detailed breakdown of how we'll use the funds we raise from this campaign: 

  1. Develop the web platform to deliver valuable resources and training material.
     
  2. Develop cutting-edge content from the top experts in the game today. 
     
  3. Deliver camps and clinics with top-notch instruction for coaches coast-to-coast. 
     
  4. Acquire equipment and tools for live events and content production. 

 

"I seriously cannot express my gratitude to you for helping with this campaign. I am truly hoping that together WE can make a huge impact to this sport.  I love nothing more than sharing my knowledge of the game and am looking forward to connecting thousands of coaches together!  Thank you so so much and I can’t wait to build this thing out.  It’s going to be EPIC!  My dream is finally going to be a reality!

Thank you again!  Beachy loves you!"

~Erica

Develop cutting-edge content from the top experts in the game today.

Acquire equipment and tools for live events and content production. 
 "I seriously cannot express my gratitude to you for helping with this campaign. I am truly hoping that together WE can make a huge impact to this sport.  I love nothing more than sharing my knowledge of the game and am looking forward to connecting thousands of coaches together!  Thank you so so much and I can’t wait to build this thing out.  It’s going to be EPIC!  My dream is finally going to be a reality!Thank you again!  Beachy loves you!"~Erica

story:
EL EQUIPO QUE NECESITAMOS

Para poder transmitir sin interrupciones desde cualquier lugar del país necesitamos un aparato que se llama LiveU Solo que básicamente agarra señal de internet de 2 SimCards + wifi + ethernet y las unifica elevando el ancho de banda facilitando la transmisión móvil con buena conexión.

Este Equipo cuesta al rededor de $1900 con un año de suscripción al servidor. 

Aparte de el equipo es necesario pagar dos planes de DATOS celulares y con lo recaudado se garantiza por un año.

story:
Welcome to New Candler...

Welcome to New Candler, cultural epicenter of the United States. Visit Trudon Circle, an art mecca turned tourist trap where you can find musicals, massive neon billboards, street performers, and pickpockets. The bodega on 12th and Salt will sell you spells on the cheap if you know how to ask, but everyone knows they’re better quality on Root and Amsterdam. But if you’re a magic user -- or, as pretty much everyone nowadays says, a muse -- you’d better be wearing a Halo so your magic doesn’t make a ruckus or hurt anyone.

Overview

VALENCE is an urban fantasy audio drama that deals with themes of abuse, trauma, queer identity, marginalization, rebellion, found family, breaking cycles, and hope. Thematically, VALENCE is a realistic drama with the energy of an espionage-heavy political thriller, an 80’s John Hughes romance, and character-heavy Noah Baumbach indies. Think The Magicians handled with realism, or Mr. Robot handled with whimsy.

After being recruited by a new government agency, a depressive magic user must stop the unethical practices of his estranged family and the country’s most successful “medical” tech startup.

Season 1 of VALENCE will feature 7 primary actors, 4 secondary actors, and various other voice actors appearing in smaller roles. The first season will consist of 12 episodes featuring full sound design to help our listeners experience the world of VALENCE. The first episode is set to launch on January 11th, 2020, with a bi-weekly release schedule until Season 1 wraps in June 2020.

Who We Are

Hug House Productions is a podcast collective made up of three friends: Anne Baird, Katie Youmans, and Wil Williams. Hug House Productions is currently producing Scoring Magic, a documentary about the process of making an audio drama, and VALENCE, that very audio drama.

Scoring Magic

Scoring Magic is a podcast documentary that follows Anne, Katie, and Wil as they make their first audio drama: VALENCE. They’ll share tips, tricks, and resources, but also what it’s like to work on a massive creative project with friends. There’s going to be exciting highs, like the moment they decided to work together–but there’s also going to be some very honest lows along the way. And all of it will lead to an audio drama they hope you’re going to love. This audio drama, that we are asking your help to bring to life.

Who's Involved

Writing: Wil Williams and Katie Youmans

Creative Consultant and Marketing Manager: Anne Baird

Sound Design and Production: Julia Schifini

Voice Actors: TBA! At every 10% reached, we'll announce another member of the cast for VALENCE! The cast announcement will be made here on Indiegogo, on the Hug House Productions social media, and our website will be updated to show who's been announced.

Perks

We have a ton of fun perks in store for you in exchange for your monetary support of Season 1 of VALENCE.

  • Cantrip: At this tier you'll be listed as a supporter on the Support page of the Hug House Productions website.
  • Charm: At this tier you'll receive the previous reward, as well as your name read out in thanks in an episode of Season 1 of VALENCE.
  • Incantation: At this tier you'll receive all previous rewards, as well as a sticker pack and a postcard from one of the main characters of Season 1 of VALENCE.
  • Invocation: At this tier you'll receive all previous rewards, as well as one (1) secret. At the end of the campaign, we'll send you an NDA and upon signing will be able to ask the creators of VALENCE any one no-limits question about Season 1 of the show and it will be answered fully and truthfully.
  • Bewitchery: At this tier you'll receive all previous rewards, as well as a custom-designed magic sound from Sound Designer Julia Schifini. At the end of the campaign, we'll ask you a few simple questions that will help her to create your magic.
  • Abracadabra: At this tier you'll receive all previous rewards, as well as being listed as a producer for Season 1 of VALENCE. You will also receive a mystery package from tech startup Halo, Inc. in the mail just in time for the launch of the season.

Where Does Your Money Go?

For Season 1 of VALENCE, we are just looking to fund enough to pay the people involved in our production!

Of our initial goal of $4,000...

  • 50% of that is going towards our Sound Designer ($2,000);
  • 45% goes to our 11 Voice Actors ($1,800);
  • and 5% accounts for Indiegogo fees ($200).

Once we reach our initial goal, our Sound Designer and Voice Actors will be paid additional percentages of any funds made so that we can pay them the money they deserve. 

If we don't reach our goal, everyone will be paid out according to the percentages above and we will continue to pay them through funds raised from our Patreon and other forms of support, which can be found on our website, until we have hit the amounts listed above for the Indiegogo.

Risks & Challenges

The beauty of having a show that is a documentary following our progress in making the show we're asking you to help fund? You see every step, and you can see exactly where your money is going, what it is helping us accomplish, and what risks there are in the process.

This is our first audio fiction show, but we have already made a lot of progress in its creation. If we do not reach our goals, we will still be creating VALENCE. This show is a labor of love on the behalf of the Hug House, and we're committed to making it happen, even if we have to pay out of pocket to do it.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that monetary support is not an option for everyone. And that's ok! There are other ways to help us out that will cost you exactly zero dollars.

You can...

  • help us spread the word! A tweet, a recommendation to a friend, a few minutes talking us up to your mysteriously rich uncle...
    • (we can be found @VALENCEpod, @ScoringMagic, and @HugHousePods on Twitter and Instagram!)
  • listen to the show! (Once it's out, that is.) We participate in RadioPublic's Paid Listen program, so if you listen to VALENCE or Scoring Magic with the RadioPublic app, we get paid. We also host our shows on Pinecast, which has a built in Tip Jar function and will be listed on the Support page of our Hug House Productions website once the show goes live.

Or if you'd like to donate on a recurring basis instead of just once in this campaign, we have a Patreon! There, you'll be able to pick out different perks not available in this campaign, including access to our patron-only Discord server where you can chat with us and with fellow listeners. Y'know. If that's your thing. 

And, before you go, thank you. We appreciate your time and hope you'll join us in New Candler for VALENCE on January 11th, 2020!

story:
Vous avez envie d’être transporté par des paroles, des histoires, des idées nouvelles? Rien de plus magique que la voix pour s’évader. D’ailleurs, on dit souvent de la radio que c’est un médium qui fait voyager. Nos créations audio vous passionneront et vous feront entrer dans le vécu de gens comme nous, comme vous, de Québécois qui vivent, créent et réfléchissent.


Une approche inédite et innovante au Québec

Nous n'avons pas à nous plier aux formats traditionnels en matière de radio; chez Magnéto, ce qui dicte la durée, ce n'est plus la grille horaire, mais le sujet et l’angle proposé. Nous sortons du studio pour aller à la rencontre des gens et des situations; pour interroger le monde et mettre en valeur la richesse créative de notre société.

La création audio que nous concevons, émancipée de plusieurs contraintes grâce au numérique, propose de vous faire réfléchir, de piquer votre curiosité et de vous surprendre... C’est le pari que fait l’équipe de Magnéto chaque fois qu’elle conçoit et réalise une production maison.

Notre approche est radicalement nouvelle.

Elle prend le temps qui s’impose pour traiter les sujets avec toute la profondeur qu’ils méritent; parler de philosophie, d’amour, ou d’un enjeu politique, ça demande du temps, parce que ce sont des sujets complexes, et Magnéto veut prendre le temps qu’il faut.

Elle valorise la parole et les savoirs d’ici. Nous sommes convaincus que nos penseurs, artistes, citoyens méritent d’être entendus ici et partout sur le globe, c’est pourquoi nous souhaitons faire résonner leur parole.

En somme, l'équipe de Magnéto s'engage à produire des créations de qualité en se donnant ses propres règles.

Notre équipe se donne donc les libertés nécessaires pour réinventer les façons de dire le monde à travers les mots et le son. Pour ensuite les faire voyager par le podcast, qui s’invite aujourd’hui dans le quotidien de tout un chacun!
 

La première boîte de production de podcasts québécois

Depuis l’automne dernier, Magnéto vous fait entendre des histoires qui ne sont généralement pas racontées de cette façon à la radio ici. Et Magnéto a aussi offert une tribune aux idées, en choisissant d’opter pour les formats longs qui permettent de pousser plus loin les réflexions, et de mener des discussions en profondeur.

Magnéto va à contresens du mouvement rapide de l’actualité. Magnéto réfléchit à l’ensemble des composantes de la création, de la voix à la musique, en passant par les ambiances sonores.

Magnéto propose de nouvelles rencontres pour ses auditeurs avec ses créations audio. Ce sont de nouvelles voix, et de nouvelles façons de dire le monde que nous amenons aux oreilles curieuses qui nous écoutent. Le micro possède des possibilités qui lui sont propres : l’absence d’image favorise la parole et l’imaginaire, et c’est sur cela que nous misons.
 

Pourquoi nous donner un coup de pouce?

Magnéto est un jeune OBNL fondé en 2016 qui produit des podcasts à la fois à titre de créateur indépendant et à titre de partenaire d’organismes culturels. Ces organismes s’intéressent à notre démarche parce qu’ils y voient une façon de mettre en lumière leurs projets, leurs initiatives, leurs idées!

Nous avons la chance de bénéficier d’un appui du Plan culturel numérique du Québec et de partenaires tels que la Maison de la Poésie, le Centre de Création O Vertigo et les Éditions Écosociété, entre autres. Nous suscitons un  grand enthousiasme chez les organismes culturels, car ils y voient une façon de mettre en lumière leurs projets, leurs initiatives, leurs idées!

À titre d'exemple, nos projets en partenariat cette année incluent entre autres la réalisation avec l'artiste Patsy Van Roost du premier parcours sonore interactif au Québec, un projet qui mettra en valeur le tissu social d'un quartier par la voix des citoyens qui l’habitent et, avec la Maison de la Poésie, la création d'une série de poèmes alliant voix et création sonore.

Ces partenariats nous permettent d'envisager une autonomie financière à partir de la fin 2017. Cette campagne donnera à Magnéto les moyens de finaliser son démarrage et de se faire davantage connaître, à travers la création d'une série de podcasts complètement avant-gardistes.

Cette campagne nous est nécessaire en raison du caractère innovant et inédit de Magnéto dans le paysage culturel québécois: il ne nous est pas toujours évident d’obtenir du financement des programmes de bourse traditionnels. La popularité du podcast est réelle et en forte croissance, mais sa nouveauté fait de ce mode d'expression une catégorie absente des programmes de soutien pour la culture. De plus, les projets de podcasts sont souvent automatiquement perçus comme des productions médiatiques, alors que chez Magnéto, un podcast est une création audio conçue avec une direction artistique.


Nos engagements

Votre générosité nous permettra de concrétiser trois objectifs :

Réaliser une série audio qui alliera les savoir-faire que nous sommes allés chercher à l’international en matière de création sonore (France, Belgique) et de storytelling (États-Unis). En tant qu’amateurs de podcasts, nous nous inspirons du meilleur tout en étant soucieux de développer notre propre personnalité à travers nos créations. La création d’une telle série implique de pouvoir rémunérer plusieurs créateurs : compositeurs, communicateurs, réalisateurs, etc. La majorité des fonds de la campagne y seront consacrés.

Consolider la communauté des fans du podcast au Québec à travers l’organisation d’une seconde édition du Radio-Live, fort du succès qu’a connu ce premier spectacle de radio sur scène à l’automne 2016, au Théâtre Aux Écuries.

Finalement, cet argent nous permettra de nous outiller et d’inventer de nouvelles façons de faire de la création audio. Ainsi, nous allons pouvoir offrir la possibilité au milieu culturel québécois de s’affirmer à travers la nouvelle vitrine que représentent les podcasts signés Magnéto. Une façon de se valoriser en étant en mesure de réaliser pour eux des podcasts qui feront rayonner ce qu’ils sont et ce qu’ils font.


Donner à Magnéto, c’est...

Faire rayonner la culture d’ici;

Bâtir une communauté d’écoute, innover en matière d’arts médiatiques et faire émerger des podcasts de calibre mondial et mettant de l’avant des voix québécoises;

Valoriser la diversité des voix au micro;

Stimuler l’avant-garde du podcast créatif québécois;

Appuyer un jeune OBNL, novateur, stimulant et créatif, qui a de nombreuses réalisations à son actif: la série Périphérie, la série Les Nuits Contraires, un manifeste publié, la série des sons de l’Avent, etc.

Et qui a de nombreux projets sur la table!
 

Donnez des ailes au podcast québécois

Nous sommes une équipe de créateurs et de compositeurs issus de différentes disciplines: sociologues, anthropologues, musicologues, philosophes, communicateurs et administrateurs.

Nous nous sommes constitués autour d’un objectif commun: celle de vous faire entendre des créations audio originales, qui vont vous surprendre et vous rendre passionnés de podcasts québécois!

Soyez de la lancée de Magnéto: vous contribuerez ainsi à l’essor de la culture du podcast au Québec, en plus de participer à ce que de nouvelles idées, des voix neuves et des histoires inédites soient portées au micro! 

Après tout, la radio est une affaire collective!

La création d’une telle série implique de pouvoir rémunérer plusieurs créateurs : compositeurs, communicateurs, réalisateurs, etc. La majorité des fonds de la campagne y seront consacrés.Consolider la communauté des fans du podcast au Québec à travers l’organisation d’une seconde édition du Radio-Live, fort du succès qu’a connu ce premier spectacle de radio sur scène à l’automne 2016, au Théâtre Aux Écuries.Finalement, cet argent nous permettra de nous outiller et d’inventer de nouvelles façons de faire de la création audio. Ainsi, nous allons pouvoir offrir la possibilité au milieu culturel québécois de s’affirmer à travers la nouvelle vitrine que représentent les podcasts signés Magnéto. Une façon de se valoriser en étant en mesure de réaliser pour eux des podcasts qui feront rayonner ce qu’ils sont et ce qu’ils font.
Donner à Magnéto, c’est...Faire rayonner la culture d’ici;Bâtir une communauté d’écoute, innover en matière d’arts médiatiques et faire émerger des podcasts de calibre mondial et mettant de l’avant des voix québécoises;Valoriser la diversité des voix au micro;Stimuler l’avant-garde du podcast créatif québécois;Appuyer un jeune OBNL, novateur, stimulant et créatif, qui a de nombreuses réalisations à son actif: la série Périphérie, la série Les Nuits Contraires, un manifeste publié, la série des sons de l’Avent, etc.Et qui a de nombreux projets sur la table! Donnez des ailes au podcast québécoisNous sommes une équipe de créateurs et de compositeurs issus de différentes disciplines: sociologues, anthropologues, musicologues, philosophes, communicateurs et administrateurs.Nous nous sommes constitués autour d’un objectif commun: celle de vous faire entendre des créations audio originales, qui vont vous surprendre et vous rendre passionnés de podcasts québécois!Soyez de la lancée de Magnéto: vous contribuerez ainsi à l’essor de la culture du podcast au Québec, en plus de participer à ce que de nouvelles idées, des voix neuves et des histoires inédites soient portées au micro! Après tout, la radio est une affaire collective!

story:
Ça se passe!

ecoutedonc.ca est le blogue de référence pour ne rien manquer de la scène musicale émergente dans la Capitale-Nationale, en Mauricie et en Estrie. Couverture de spectacles et de festivals, entrevues, sorties et critique d’albums, nouvelles... tout y passe! Sa croissance a été possible grâce au dévouement de près d’une cinquantaine de collaboratrices et de collaborateurs bénévoles à la rédaction, à la photographie et bien plus; supervisé(e)s par un seul humain à l'enthousiasme hyperactif : Jacques Boivin, fondateur.

En 2017, le blogue souffle sa cinquième bougie, publie jusqu’à vingt articles par semaine et compte 10 000 vues par mois. Nous en sommes très fières et fiers, mais il n’est pas question de nous asseoir sur nos lauriers. Afin de toujours mieux nourrir son lectorat sans risquer l’essoufflement, ecoutedonc.ca doit raffiner ses outils.

L’une des premières mesures envisagées en ce sens est d’inscrire le blogue à titre d’organisme à but non lucratifs (OBNL). Ainsi, il s’assurera une meilleure pérennité, notamment de par le fait qu'il ne reposera plus uniquement sur les épaules de papa Jacques. Cette raison sociale nous permettra, à long terme, de nous distinguer parmi les médias locaux et d’obtenir le financement qui reconnait la nécessité d’un tel canal d'info.

 

Mais pour ça, on a besoin de vous maintenant

Notre besoin le plus criant se traduit par un manque de matériel. Nos photographes ont beaucoup d’équipement, mais pas pour toutes les conditions. Aussi, il arrive parfois qu’une chroniqueuse ou un chroniqueur ne puisse être accompagné(e) d’un(e) photographe. Nous souhaitons pouvoir vous fournir toujours plus d’images exceptionnelles qui ont fait notre réputation. Il en va de même pour de l’équipement vidéo et des dictaphones pour les entrevues.

Écrire pour un blogue ne veut pas dire qu'on entre partout gratuitement! Pas si jet-set, certains paient pour collaborer sur Ecoutedonc.ca. Il y a aussi les multiples dépenses liées aux spectacles à l’extérieur, comme les festivals. En outre, moins de frais de déplacement = plus de gens motivés à couvrir et donc plus d’articles variés!

Non moins pertinent – mais beige un peu, certes – cette campagne nous permettra d’avoir un fond de roulement en cas d’imprévus et d’amortir les dépenses administratives comme l’hébergement du site, par exemple.

Enfin, histoire de développer notre offre pour vous faire plaisir et de nous inscrire plus que jamais comme une référence dans la promotion de la scène émergente, nous souhaitons être porteurs d’événements spéciaux ponctuels.

C’est pourquoi nous espérons atteindre un objectif de 10 000 $!

C’est le cinquième anniversaire d’ecoutedonc.ca. Vous voulez lui faire un cadeau tout en vous gâtant? On a de super goodies en échange de vos généreux dons. Voyez par vous-mêmes dans la liste!

 

Contreparties

Ambiance Verte

 

ecoutedonc.ca-moi l'sac!

 

Déco festive

Affiches 8x12 en tirage très limité, imprimées sur papier photo de qualité, avec les images prises par nos photographes.

Autre choix d'images par ici: http://fetedonc.ca/contreparties

 

Généreux gaminet

T-shirt avec le visuel du 5e anniversaire d’ecoutedonc.ca, création du Singe Peintre.

 

Se laisser parler d'amour

T-shirt "Fermez vos gueules" inspiré d’un éditorial d’ecoutedonc.ca qui a fait jaser. Avec une magnifique illustration d’Arielle Galarneau.

 

Sac à surprises

Notre sac réutilisable + une sélection d'items surprises venus tout droit de vos labels favoris tels que: Pantoum Records, Ste-4, Slam Disques, Coyote Records, Dare to Care/Grosse Boîte et Simone Records.

 

Carte de souhait pour groupies

Affiches 16×20 d’un artiste ou d’un groupe de Québec, imprimées sur papier photo de qualité et autographiées spécialement pour vous. 

Autre choix d'images par ici: http://fetedonc.ca/contreparties

 

Demande Spéciale

3h de Djset avec DJ Cheveuxdoux ou Signature Maurice Tremblay. 

 

Star de la fête

Séance photo de portrait "express" avec Llamaryon.

 

Photo de party (de groupe)

Séance photo promotionnelle réalisée par l'un de nos collaborateurs soit: Nicolas Padovani, Catherine B., Llamaryon, Joe Weller ou Jacques Boivin. 

 

L'animation de feu

Spectacle privé de Simon Kearney ou Abrdeen.

*** Pour plus d'informations sur les contreparties vous pouvez nous contacter ou consulter ce lien : http://fetedonc.ca/contreparties

Prenez note que la livraison des contreparties n'est pas incluse dans les prix. Nous fixerons une date pour une cueillette en septembre 2017 en un lieu que - nous l'espérons - saura être accommodant pour vous; restez à l'affût! Si, néanmoins, vous préférez qu'elle vous soit acheminée par la poste, veuillez simplement ajouter 10$ à même votre don (sauf pour le macaron pour lequel les frais sont de 1$)

 

Dans l’éventualité où nous n’atteignions pas notre objectif, les fonds obtenus seront assurément utiles pour assumer, par ordre de priorité, les frais liés aux activités du cinquième anniversaire, les frais administratifs, les ressources matérielles nommées ci-haut et les frais de déplacements.

Bien entendu, il nous serait impossible de tenir cette campagne sans l'aide turbo généreuse de nos précieux partenaires :

  • Pantoum Records
  • District 7 Production
  • L'Anti Bar et spectacles
  • Coyote Records
  • Slam Disques
  • Simone Records
  • Dare to Care/Grosse Boîte
  • DJ Cheveuxdoux
  • Vanessa Bell
  • Sans oublier nos rédacteurs et photographes d'amour!

 

Qu’os’ ça donne?

Promouvoir la scène musicale émergente, c’est donner la parole à une relève créative et dynamique. C’est stimuler l’accès à une vie culturelle diversifiée et riche. C’est démontrer qu’il existe une réelle offre au-delà de l’industrie de masse.

Valoriser la scène musicale locale, c’est participer à l’évolution d’une identité, se l’approprier et la célébrer. C’est faire partie d’un mouvement.

ecoutedonc.ca croit fermement au pouvoir rassembleur de la musique sur une société. En participant à cette campagne, vous faites bien plus qu’aider à l’achat d’un objectif photo.

 

Les sous, c’est bien, mais pour aider autrement...

Mauvais timing? Le loyer passe demain? Un autre ticket de stationnement? On comprend! Mais devinez quoi? Le simple fait d’avoir lu jusqu’ici, de partager cette campagne dans votre réseau, d’aimer la page Facebook d’ecoutedonc.ca, de passer nous voir souvent, c’est déjà vraiment smatte!

Aussi, n’oubliez pas qu’on fête nos cinq ans au Cercle le 25 mai prochain! Billets en prévente ici. 

Venez en bus pour pas pogner de ticket! ;)

Overview

***

If you are interested, please express your support by following and, if you see fit, by backing the campaign! If you know others who might be interested, please send the link to them!

BACK, FOLLOW, and SHARE buttons are at the top of this page, beside the video gallery. Thanks for visiting!

story:
What Is This Thing, Anyway?

Improvisers is about an improv troupe from Chicago that mistakenly join a bloodthirsty cult, under the impression they're actually an intense comedy workshop. Our campaign is an effort to take an insanely funny story and present it to audiences everywhere. Since the entire crew comes from a background in comedy, our ultimate goal is to make listeners laugh! We love connecting with audiences through humor. It's what gets us through the hardest points in life. Help us help you laugh!

 

Who Are We?

Nick Dardes and Walker Floyd are producing majors. They're both from the small town of Beaufort, South Carolina. Since nobody knows where that is, they always have to explain it's where Forrest Gump was filmed. They now live in Los Angeles, in hopes of writing for film and television. They believe if The Simpsons could stay on for another 30 years, they'll have a good chance of joining the writers' room eventually.

Ben Trauner is a writer and improv comic from Charlotte, North Carolina. He was about to move to Los Angeles right when things started going squirrely. He has a degree in screenwriting from University of North Carolina School of the Arts.

Katie Sanderson met the gang while doing improv at UNCSA. She is a passionate filmmaker aspiring to redefine the quality of content being made at the independent level. She enjoys helping creatives bring their projects to life through effective strategy and fundraising. After graduating from the University of North Carolina School of the Arts with a BFA in producing, Katie moved to Los Angeles. She has worked for large companies and distributors including HBO Max and Netflix while producing several of her own projects. She is currently working on season 17 of Grey's Anatomy.

 

What We Need 

Our goal is to get at least $1,000 for the entire audio production. In order for us to give people a high quality audio experience, we'll be purchasing three Rode-NT-Mini USB Microphones. Since our cast is all over the world (including Canada!) the plan is to ship mics to them. The directing will then be taking place over the Squadcast software, to record all of their lines. Our other focus for the donation will be repaying our amazing cast and crew. 

 

What You Get

Since the production is so small, many of our perks are incredibly unique and personal for our contributors! For just $5 you'll get a PDF of the entire script for Improvisers! There's also going to be a hilarious and in-depth Q&A with the cast and crew.

If we don't reach our goal, the plan is to still use what contributions we do have into making sure the production is still high quality enough for our listeners.

 

The Impact

While we wait for the world to return back to normal, it's important to keep people who are trapped at home entertained. With a totally bonkers script that spoofs 1940s radio dramas, we can do that! The Improvisers team wishes to take your mind off of the pandemic for 45 minutes, and make you laugh your ass off (hypothetically).

We want contributors to feel like they're helping us bring a little joy to a hectic year.

 

Risks & Challenges

Audio productions are still an untapped area of entertainment, so the entire project is new ground for all of us. Since our cast is spread across the world, it'll be a fun challenge directing and orchestrating the actual recording process.

Our plan is to use advanced podcast software that can record and access multiple people at once. With a large chunk of time being spent for rehearsal with the actors, we hope to have a solid read through with the actors and crew.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Ask any friends and family to please spread this campaign. We promise it'll bring a smile to their face!

story:
About Whispering

Whispering is a story I've held safely in my mind for a long time. In fact, I didn't even realize it was there until I sat down to write one day! As the words poured out of me, I realized that this story was simply waiting for me to find the right medium to tell it. And that medium, lo and behold, is audio.

The story unfolded before my eyes in the form of a very detailed outline. After that came the writing and the editing. And after that, the rest of the creative team! Now, many tears and stressful months later, I would love to present Whispering: the tale of Kore's ascent to her throne as the Queen of the Underworld. Join me and the rest of the creative team for laughs and tears as you witness the Greek pantheon through a new perspective!

Who Are We?

The creative team behind Whispering consists of several key players! Dallas Wheatley is the esteemed writer and director, Emily Parish is the brilliant sound designer, Adam Raymonda composed the exceptional music, and Lio Rivera created all the stunning artwork.

In addition to the fantastic creative team, this audio drama also has a large cast of voice actors -- twelve in total -- who spent hours in front of their microphones bringing these characters to life with just their voices. 'Tis not an easy feat! Nor would this podcast possible without the dedication of every single one of these people.

How Can You Help?

Podcasts are... a lot of work. Seriously. And all that work takes time. Time is a valuable commodity these days, what with all that social media shortening our attention spans and such (that's the standard excuse, right?). Being able to fairly compensate everyone involved for their time and effort will make a huge difference in helping this audio drama come to life.

This campaign will help us make this wonderful project a reality! Your support can help us do that, since you'll be helping us pay for all these amazing things:

  • 12 Voice actors
  • 1 Producer/Director/Writer
  • 1 Sound designer
  • 1 Composer
  • 1 Graphic artist
  • Marketing
  • Publishing fees
  • Producing equipment and software
  • Merchandise for the perks/rewards

Help us beat $2000 so we can cover all our fees, order the merch for all the perks, AND pay everyone involved! 

Why Crowdfunding?

Most podcasts -- especially audio fiction podcasts -- are not made for profit. Many popular audio fiction podcasts; such as VALENCE, Hometown, CARAVAN, and Arden; have been supported through crowdfunders like Kickstarter, Indiegogo, or Patreon! Crowdfunding helps us create the best work possible, just to bring this wonderful content to your patient ears. Your support will not go unnoticed or unappreciated! Even $5 can go a long way to helping us!

What Could Possibly Go Wrong?

Uh-oh, I've asked it. Maybe if I don't say it out loud, nothing bad will happen?

Of course, life isn't like that. Bad things can, and quite often, will happen. And we want you to be completely aware of the risks for when bad things do happen. What are the risks? How will we try to avoid them? How can we fix them?

1. The show is a flop.

Yes, this is a very real risk. You could listen to the finished product of this show and think "I hated it." But that's the risk with all art! There will always be someone who doesn't like a piece of artwork, however, that does not mean that the artwork wasn't worth making.

2. We don't raise enough money.

We are dedicated to creating this show regardless of how much money we are able to raise! Every dollar we can't collect here, will be provided from our own pockets -- because every single artist and actor on this team deserves to be paid for their hard work. 

That's not too many risks, right? I certainly hope not, because we would love your support in spite of all two of those risks!

But I'm Broke :(

We get it! Sometimes, money is tight. Sometimes, money is gone. Sometimes, money just doesn't even exist as a concept for you, because you're too cool for the system, man. But don't worry! You can always help out by spreading the word! Share this on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, email, text, snail mail, letter in a bottle, or time capsule -- the more people who see this, the more likely we are to get the support we need to make this audio drama come to life.

About the Rewards

  • The God's Gratitude: our eternal love and thanks! It never expires!
  • Olympian Praise: your name appears in the credits of each episode as we praise your name to the heavens
  • Sacred Sigil: a beautiful button featuring artwork by the amazing Lio Rivera
  • Blessed Artefact: a gorgeous sticker featuring artwork by the incomparable Lio Rivera
  • Secret Chord: a secret Spotify playlist featuring music hand-picked by each cast and crew member that fits the theme of the show
  • Prophetic Dreams: early access to a supercut version of the show
  • Divine Presence: you can submit questions to the cast and crew for a recorded Q&A session that will be released after the show concludes
  • Magick Brew: 3 sample sachets each of 2 custom tea blends created for the show by Friday Afternoon Tea
  • Forbidden Fruit: a bar of pink soap, scented with pomegranate fragrance oil and laden with scrubby cranberry seeds
  • Apotropaic Blessing: a handmade wreath in the theme of the show, made by our own Hekate
story_txt:
About WhisperingWhispering is a story I've held safely in my mind for a long time. In fact, I didn't even realize it was there until I sat down to write one day! As the words poured out of me, I realized that this story was simply waiting for me to find the right medium to tell it. And that medium, lo and behold, is audio.The story unfolded before my eyes in the form of a very detailed outline. After that came the writing and the editing. And after that, the rest of the creative team! Now, many tears and stressful months later, I would love to present Whispering: the tale of Kore's ascent to her throne as the Queen of the Underworld. Join me and the rest of the creative team for laughs and tears as you witness the Greek pantheon through a new perspective!Who Are We?The creative team behind Whispering consists of several key players! Dallas Wheatley is the esteemed writer and director, Emily Parish is the brilliant sound designer, Adam Raymonda composed the exceptional music, and Lio Rivera created all the stunning artwork.In addition to the fantastic creative team, this audio drama also has a large cast of voice actors -- twelve in total -- who spent hours in front of their microphones bringing these characters to life with just their voices. 'Tis not an easy feat! Nor would this podcast possible without the dedication of every single one of these people.How Can You Help?Podcasts are... a lot of work. Seriously. And all that work takes time. Time is a valuable commodity these days, what with all that social media shortening our attention spans and such (that's the standard excuse, right?). Being able to fairly compensate everyone involved for their time and effort will make a huge difference in helping this audio drama come to life.This campaign will help us make this wonderful project a reality! Your support can help us do that, since you'll be helping us pay for all these amazing things:
12 Voice actors
1 Producer/Director/Writer
1 Sound designer
1 Composer
1 Graphic artist
Marketing
Publishing fees
Producing equipment and software
Merchandise for the perks/rewards
Help us beat $2000 so we can cover all our fees, order the merch for all the perks, AND pay everyone involved! Why Crowdfunding?Most podcasts -- especially audio fiction podcasts -- are not made for profit. Many popular audio fiction podcasts; such as VALENCE, Hometown, CARAVAN, and Arden; have been supported through crowdfunders like Kickstarter, Indiegogo, or Patreon! Crowdfunding helps us create the best work possible, just to bring this wonderful content to your patient ears. Your support will not go unnoticed or unappreciated! Even $5 can go a long way to helping us!What Could Possibly Go Wrong?Uh-oh, I've asked it. Maybe if I don't say it out loud, nothing bad will happen?Of course, life isn't like that. Bad things can, and quite often, will happen. And we want you to be completely aware of the risks for when bad things do happen. What are the risks? How will we try to avoid them? How can we fix them?1. The show is a flop.Yes, this is a very real risk. You could listen to the finished product of this show and think "I hated it." But that's the risk with all art! There will always be someone who doesn't like a piece of artwork, however, that does not mean that the artwork wasn't worth making.2. We don't raise enough money.We are dedicated to creating this show regardless of how much money we are able to raise! Every dollar we can't collect here, will be provided from our own pockets -- because every single artist and actor on this team deserves to be paid for their hard work. That's not too many risks, right? I certainly hope not, because we would love your support in spite of all two of those risks!But I'm Broke :(We get it! Sometimes, money is tight. Sometimes, money is gone. Sometimes, money just doesn't even exist as a concept for you, because you're too cool for the system, man. But don't worry! You can always help out by spreading the word! Share this on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, email, text, snail mail, letter in a bottle, or time capsule -- the more people who see this, the more likely we are to get the support we need to make this audio drama come to life.About the Rewards

The God's Gratitude: our eternal love and thanks! It never expires!

Olympian Praise: your name appears in the credits of each episode as we praise your name to the heavens

Sacred Sigil: a beautiful button featuring artwork by the amazing Lio Rivera

Blessed Artefact: a gorgeous sticker featuring artwork by the incomparable Lio Rivera

Secret Chord: a secret Spotify playlist featuring music hand-picked by each cast and crew member that fits the theme of the show

Prophetic Dreams: early access to a supercut version of the show

Divine Presence: you can submit questions to the cast and crew for a recorded Q&A session that will be released after the show concludes

Magick Brew: 3 sample sachets each of 2 custom tea blends created for the show by Friday Afternoon Tea

Forbidden Fruit: a bar of pink soap, scented with pomegranate fragrance oil and laden with scrubby cranberry seeds

Apotropaic Blessing: a handmade wreath in the theme of the show, made by our own Hekate

story:
North Murphy High is just a normal high school in a normal town in middle America. Or... it was, right up until the end of the last school year, when, well… 

Surviving the apocalypse is hard enough to begin with. So is getting through high school in one piece. Trying to do both at the same time? Ugh.

Murphy’s End is a weekly peek into the lives of the last remaining survivors as told through the morning announcements at the local high school. Because between the ongoing food shortage, the roaming packs of mutants, and that one demon who has been hanging out by the water fountain since last June, well, there’s always something important to announce.

Some of the students are thriving in the new environment, leading field trips into the unexplored wilderness that used to be their small town. Some of the students are grudgingly coping as they're forced into new roles... like doing the school’s morning announcements. And some of the students still haven't figured out why the big homecoming game isn't happening this year. 

It’s fine. It’s probably fine.

Sigh… it’s going to be a long year.

(Go Tomcats!)

 

What We Need 

We’re really excited to introduce you to the world of Murphy’s End but we need a little help with the startup expenses. We’re looking for some funds to help us cover:

Microphones $100

Website and Podcast Hosting $350

Graphic Design (podcast logo, school mascots, fonts) $300

Theme music and background music $200

Merchandise $250

If we don’t reach our goal, we’ll still be launching the podcast, it just means you might have to wait for some things - like the awesome merchandise we have planned!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t chip in there are other ways you can help. Like sharing the link to this Indiegogo, following us on social media, and helping us to get the word out about our show. You can find us the following places:

Website
Twitter
Facebook
Instagram
Tumblr
YouTube
