story:
Who are we?

It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a queer adaptation of Pride and Prejudice, full of some of the most exciting names in indie audio drama, must be in want of some funding.

Okay, okay, I won't do that the whole time.
My name is Caroline Mincks, one of the creators of {Queer} Pride and Prejudice: a loving and faithful adaptation of the beloved Jane Austen classic that happens to be very queer. We are creating a version of this story that is diverse, inclusive, and more representative of our society today, while retaining the setting and spirit of the original story.

Meet Our Cast and Crew:

Elizabeth Bennet: Jordan Cobb
Miss Darcy: Caroline Mincks
Mr. Bingley: Sawyer Greene
Caroline Bingley: Ishani Kanetkar
Louisa Bingley: Danyelle Ellet
Jane Bennet: Eleanor Grey
Mr. Bennet: Evan Tess Murray
Mrs. Bennet: Sarah Rhea Werner
Mary Bennet: Lisette Alvarez
Kitty Bennet: Chijioke B Williams
Lydia Bennet: Khalila Marie
Charlotte Lucas: Leslie Gideon
Mr. Collins: Alexander Endymion Hernández Díaz
Mr. Wickham: Alexander Doddy
Lady Catherine de Bourgh: Sena Bryer
Anne de Bourgh: Molly Burdick
Mx. Gardiner: Fox Cooper
Mrs. Gardiner: Amara Augustine
Georgiana Darcy: Elena Fernández Collins
Mx. Reynolds: Sophie Hughes
Col. Fitzwilliam: Nick Webster

Sound Designers: Tal Minear and Brad Colbroock
Composer: Trace Callahan
Head Writer: Caroline Mincks
Script Consultation: Evan Tess Murray
Direction: Caroline Mincks and Evan Tess Murray
Concept and Casting: Cassie Josephs and Caroline Mincks
 

How You Can Help

We are looking to compensate everyone involved in this production for each episode they work on, giving consideration to the time and commitment of everyone involved. Everyone will receive compensation for at least two episodes.

As you can see, this is a large group of people and a very involved process, and some people are wearing multiple hats. In order to make sure everyone is compensated fairly, we need your help. 

A contribution of any size will assist greatly in us reaching our goals, and we have some lovely perks to thank you for your generosity! Sharing this campaign and spreading the word about this exciting project will also be a huge help, and we are grateful for anything you are able to do.

Check out the perks to see what you'd like to receive in return for your donation!
 

Why {Queer} Pride and Prejudice?

Pride and Prejudice is a story that has endured for many reasons - it is funny and romantic, clever and insightful. It challenges the audience to examine their judgments and biases, and it reminds us that true love is not transactional, but transformative. Many of us grew up with this story, and lots of us found it later in life and fell in love with it. For some of us, it is one of those stories that we turn to again and again to feel comfort. 

And, I mean, come on - PRIDE is right there in the title. How could we resist?

Every single person involved in this audio drama is LGBTQIA+. By casting this way, it allowed us to create a story that shows queer relationships in a historical context, challenging strict gender roles and letting audience members experience the same kind of historical romance and happy ending that cis, straight people have gotten to see themselves in for so long.

What perks do backers get?

We have some amazing perks for everybody who donates to our campaign! 

An Excellent Boiled Potato ($5)

At this tier, you get our thanks in the form of a shout-out on Twitter.

A Turn About the Room ($10)

At this tier, you get the above reward, plus: a customized digital invitation to the ball at Netherfield featuring your name, pronouns, and preferred honorifics!

Connubial Felicity ($15)

At this tier, you get the above rewards, plus: a sticker featuring our show art!

High Respect for Your Nerves ($25)

At this tier, you get the above rewards, plus: an adorable button with our show art!

Ten Thousand a Year ($50)

At this tier, you get the above rewards, plus: a digital cookbook that contains genuine Regency-era recipes... with some commentary from the Bennet family.

My Good Opinion ($100)

At this tier, you get the previous rewards, plus: a tea party kit assembled just for you and shipped right to your door!

Incandescently Happy​ ($250)

At this tier, you get the previous rewards, plus: sponsorship credit for one episode of our show! That means that your name will be read aloud at the beginning of one of our episodes.

Where Does the Money Go?

We're trying to raise $8,500 to pay our amazing cast and crew the money they deserve for all of the hard work they're doing. The breakdown of costs goes like this:

  • Actors: $4,800
  • Sound Designer: $1,200
  • Director: $400
  • Music: $480
  • Writer: $200
  • Script Consultant: $200
  • Perks: $570
  • Indiegogo Fees: $650

What Happens if We Don't Meet Our Goal?

Asking for financial assistance can be a risk, and we acknowledge that we are asking for a tidy sum and may not reach that goal. In the event of that happening, whatever is raised will be distributed among the cast and crew at the promised rates, and the release of the show will be delayed in order to accommodate for me paying whatever is left out of pocket. It will take a significantly longer time for me to afford to pay everyone myself, which is why I'm asking for help in the first place.  

No matter what, the show will happen - in fact, recording is already underway - but your assistance will provide great financial relief and allow us to pay everyone involved in a more timely manner.

So: if you'd like to help us release this project within the desired timeline of the winter holiday season, please consider making a contribution and/or sharing this campaign far and wide!

story:
Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about our strange nugget of a show! 

Our stream tries to create a space for oddballs, dumbbells, and misfits who love video games from all genres to come together, forget their troubles for awhile and laugh like idiots. We may not have a huge community like some channels, but we have loyal followers and it doesn’t feel right to let them down by suspending the stream. We don’t want to lose the relationships we’ve built with the community or any of the progress we've made so far. So this, you fine crowd-funding, game-loving, kind-hearted people is why we now turn to you for help!

Our computer is going down... it’s lived a long, noble life, but it’s nearly a decade old and these parts just ain’t what they used to be. Basically, if the weather outside gets even a little too hot, the computer will overheat and explode and kill us all. Well, that might be an exaggeration, but it will definitely go haywire and crash every few minutes, which makes it nearly impossible for us to stream. Luckily our summer here in Edmonton has been a chilly one, but we live in constant fear of the day it gets hot again and our stream gets an early cancellation. 

We host a variety gaming show called “Grimpen & Friends” every weekday from 11am to 2pm PST on the site twitch.tv. We’ve been committed to putting on shows for 3 hours a day, 5 days a week for well over a year now. Over that time we’ve showcased hundreds of games and have grown a small community of viewers that we call The Lunar Nation. Our show covers everything from new releases to retro classics to weird games you’ve never heard of. We try to add some showmanship to the stream with things like musical intros, special segments, a chalkboard and oh yeah, a puppet. 

​

As stated above this isn’t a gaming PC. We simply need something powerful enough to run our show and stream to our Twitch channel at a reasonable rate. With that in mind we decided not to use a video card and just go for a strong CPU with a good integrated GPU. We tried to find a balance between parts that weren’t too pricey but also wouldn’t melt into a puddle as soon as we turned the computer on. We’re always open to hear suggestions on ways to get more for our money! 

$59.99 - Case: Thermaltake Core V1 Mini ITX Case

$159.99 - Processor: Intel Core™ i3-8100 Processor, 3.6GHz w/ 6MB Cache

$174.99 - Motherboard: Asus ROG STRIX B360-I GAMING w/ DDR4-2666, 7.1 Audio, Dual M.2, Gigabit LAN, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth

$64.99 - Memory: Corsair Vengeance LPX 8GB DDR4 2666MHz CL16 Dual Channel Kit (2x 4GB), Black

$54.99 - Hard Drive: Seagate 1TB BarraCuda HDD, SATA III w/ 64MB Cache

$54.99 - Power Supply: ThermalTake Smart White Series Power Supply, 500W

TOTAL - $569.94

$750 - Marketing 

If you got us this far you must be liking the burgers we're flipping, so you probably also want people to actually watch our show! Marketing is probably the biggest area we need to put more effort into, and some extra finances to put into it would go a long way towards getting Grimpen's big dumb face out into the world. 

$1100 - PlayStation 3

Wait, what? A PS3? Yes, it may be over a decade old, but it's one of the few glaring holes in our gaming console collection. You see, at one point we both had PS3s, but both of them no longer work. We'd love to be able to access our library of PS3 classics and share them on the show, along with the many strange exclusives that you can't get on any other system. 

$1700 - Gaming PC 

At this point our little humble streaming PC goes FULL BEAST MODE and becomes a gaming PC behemoth with all the bells and whistles. This would open us up to a lot of PC gaming scenarios that we wouldn't have been able to handle before, plus we could run games on high settings and make everything so very very pretty. 

$2000 - GIANT GRIMPEN 

WE WILL BUILD A GIANT 20 FOOT TALL GRIMPEN THAT WILL TOWER OVER EVERYTHING.

 

  

We’re here looking for financial support to build a simple streaming computer, and any amount you can give is extremely generous and would earn our endless gratitude. We understand not everyone has the means to help this way, but luckily there are other ways to earn our endless gratitude! Please, share this page with others through Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Reddit, or any social media platform of your choosing. With your help we can get more eyes on our campaign! 

 

We’ve put some extra effort into creating unique rewards for the insanely generous people who donate to our campaign, such as exclusive stickers, personalized chalk drawings, and guest spots on the show. The real cherry on top is your very own mini-Grimpen hand puppet! There will only be six of these available so if you’ve got some money to spend and really want to help us out, be sure to snatch one up!

Because of the nature of this project there aren’t really any major risks involved. We’ll be buying the parts online and have the money to cover shipping and taxes, or the difference if any of the parts change in price. The only real challenge is that we don’t actually have that much practice at building PCs. We’ve both done it, but a long time ago and our memories are old and stinky. However if we run into any problems we have knowledgeable friends that we can turn to, and we certainly won’t just give up before the PC is finished since our show depends on it. The entire process will be documented in the Backer Video “Grimpen and Pants build a PC” which gets unlocked at the $30 tier, so all our struggling and bumbling will be documented for your entertainment! 

 

Thank you so much for taking interest in our weird little show! We’re passionate about what we do and want to keep doing it for as long as possible, as well as grow in the twitch community and continue spreading the word about excellent games! Please consider helping, whether through a pledge or through sharing with your friends and family, every little bit is extremely appreciated!

THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR SHRIVELED HEARTS!

With your help we can get more eyes on our campaign!  We’ve put some extra effort into creating unique rewards for the insanely generous people who donate to our campaign, such as exclusive stickers, personalized chalk drawings, and guest spots on the show. The real cherry on top is your very own mini-Grimpen hand puppet! There will only be six of these available so if you’ve got some money to spend and really want to help us out, be sure to snatch one up!Because of the nature of this project there aren’t really any major risks involved. We’ll be buying the parts online and have the money to cover shipping and taxes, or the difference if any of the parts change in price. The only real challenge is that we don’t actually have that much practice at building PCs. We’ve both done it, but a long time ago and our memories are old and stinky. However if we run into any problems we have knowledgeable friends that we can turn to, and we certainly won’t just give up before the PC is finished since our show depends on it. The entire process will be documented in the Backer Video “Grimpen and Pants build a PC” which gets unlocked at the $30 tier, so all our struggling and bumbling will be documented for your entertainment!  Thank you so much for taking interest in our weird little show! We’re passionate about what we do and want to keep doing it for as long as possible, as well as grow in the twitch community and continue spreading the word about excellent games! Please consider helping, whether through a pledge or through sharing with your friends and family, every little bit is extremely appreciated!THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF OUR SHRIVELED HEARTS!

story:
Now in its second year, PodUK is the UK's only fan-focused podcasting convention, dedicated to bringing independent podcasting into the spotlight, giving creators a stage and providing a home for like-minded podcast fans to gather, make friends, and celebrate the works they love.   While many UK podcast events focus on the industry, PodUK focuses on fostering a fun, geek-friendly environment akin to that of the comic cons and vidcons of the world.  PodUK is held at Millennium Point in Birmingham, a perfect travel hub for those in and out of the UK.  It features:

- Live, recorded podcast performances 
(So far, we have The Amelia Project, Flintlocks & Fireballs and The People's Polygraph set to perform, with more to be announced - some with your help!)
- Panel discussions
- Workshops
- Meet n' Greets
- Merchandise tables

All included within the ticket price (£15 early bird, £20 general entry).  If you'd like to buy a ticket, you can do so HERE!

______________________________

The PodUK team is: 

- Jess (she/her, centre): Event manager & convention geek extraordinaire 

- Bret (they/them, left): Marketing & graphic design

- Chris (he/him, right): PodUK's AV technomancer   

Now, you likely haven't heard of us before.  We aren't big name media creators; we aren't representatives of a large media company; we're simply three friends with a whole heap of enthusiasm and drive to create the best event we can.  We do the utmost with what we have access to, and PodUK 2019 is a testament to that, but to be able to truly reach new heights with PodUK 2020, we need you.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the facts: 

1) Conventions are fun as all get-out to arrange and put on!
2) Conventions are expensive as all get-out to arrange and put on.

It's the way of the world.  Our realistic budget for PodUK comes in at around £7500, which we would be absolutely overjoyed to reach.  If we were to do a fully maxed out PodUK, we'd be looking at somewhere in the realm of £10,000+, and that's without including the PodUK wish list the three of us have waiting in the wings for years to come.  

Here's a breakdown: 

Performers - Our primary fundraising goal is to be able to give our performers the compensation they deserve.  PodUK is an entirely volunteer-run venture, but that doesn't mean we don't want to give compensation where it's due - entirely the opposite. The only thing stopping us is our current budget, but with your help, that'll become an issue of the past.  Dependent on how much we raise, we could bring performers over from other countries, pay for hotels, pay for food and more besides.

We are happy to announce that we have some special perks from some of our performing podcasts:

THE AMELIA PROJECT | FLINTLOCKS AND FIREBALLS | WORDS TO THAT EFFECT

Any money raised from those perks will go straight to the podcasters providing them!  

Venue - While a large majority of the venue hire has been covered by 2019's ticket sales, we would like to hire an extra panel room.  This would mean that we could have more podcast performances and more panels during the day, allowing for an even more varied schedule.  

Attendees - Food & drink, security, convention packs - we want to make sure our attendees get the best out of PodUK that we can give them.  With your help we can go even further to make sure it happens.

Your contribution is so incredibly important to us, and in return you can get:

Thanks! - Get your name in the PodUK show booklet as thanks for helping our convention.  

Perks from Our Performing Podcasters! - Our PodUK 2020 performers have graciously provided some fantastic perks for you all to help fund their appearances at PodUK.  A great opportunity for their fans to get involved!

Exclusive Backer Merch - Exclusive shirts, pins, and even personally written thank you cards are all up for grabs!

Sponsorship - Want to sponsor an entire piece of PodUK?  Fantastic!  Your brand will be a part of the event.

Just take a look at our perks to see all the options available.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need to get the word out as far as we can!  Tell your friends, retweet from @teampoduk or use the #PodUK2020 hashtag to spread the word.  

You can also use Indiegogo's inbuilt sharing tools to let others know about our campaign - we'd be so grateful!

We want to give independent podcasting in the UK a home, and with your help, we can truly make that happen.  Don't forget, if you just want to come along, you can purchase a ticket HERE!

story:
A Vendéglő a Világ Végén rádió 2018-ban lesz 7 éves. Ezt azzal szeretnénk megünnepelni, hogy elmegyünk Japánba, egész pontosan Kyotoba a cseresznyevirágzás idején (persze ezt nem lehet pontosan tudni, de április eleje a valószínű) és ott veszünk fel minden kint töltött napon egy adást.

Kalandok, kultúra, gasztró, anime, pálcika, zen és szamurájkard.

Egyedülálló projekt, célunk a rádió körüli közösség ünneplése, a közösségi működés és a történetmesélés határainak feszegetése.

Költségvetés:

  • 2 x 200.000 Ft = 2 repülőjegy oda/vissza
  • 100.000 Ft = szállás két főre ahol biztonságban van a felszerelés és van jó internet (AirBnB)
  • 100.000 Ft = rádiós pólók ajándékba a leglelkesebbeknek (lásd: ajándékok között)
  • 30.000 = ennyit kell adnunk az IndieGoGo-nak ha összejön a pénz

ez összesen 630 ezer forint, ami kb. 2400 dollár. Ha nem jön össze, minden pénz vissza, nincs ajándék, nincs utazás.

Ha még nem ismered a rádiót, látogass el a honlapunkra vagy a facebook oldalunkra. Hallgathatsz minket (többnyire) vasárnap esténként élőben, vagy bármikor egy podcast app segítségével.

Mindenki boldog.

story:
Sidequesting Season 2

Hi there! I'm Tal Minear and I make Sidequesting, a fantasy podcast about avoiding the main plot. Season 1 just finished (you can listen to it here), and I'd love some help funding season 2.

What's this show about, you ask? Sidequesting follows Rion, an adventurer who’s willing to help anyone out - as long as they’re not being asked to deal with the scary wizard that everyone keeps talking about. They travel from town to town, meeting new people and doing new things. Inspired by Dungeons and Dragons, Skyrim, and Lord of the Rings, Sidequesting pulls from classic tropes across fantasy stories and subverts them. Season 2 will continue this, featuring lighthearted fantasy stories with modern representation.

What needs funding, you ask? Primarily the guest actors in each episode, who I pay for their time and talent! There are also smaller costs associated with the show, such as hosting fees, stickers, business cards, etc. I'd also love to be able to pay myself a small stipend for producing Sidequesting.

Season 2 will consist of 10 episodes that will air throughout this year. This crowdfunding goal breaks down to $80 per episode, with some of that money going towards crowdfunding costs. This season is happening regardless of if this goal is met, but your support means I can write longer episodes (with more characters!), and worry less about money while doing so. Plus, you can get some rad perks and feel good about supporting indie audio fiction!

If you like:

  • Independent Audio Fiction
  • Lighthearted Stories
  • LGBTQA+ Representation
  • New Takes on Fantasy Tropes

You'll like the second season of Sidequesting!

 

What We Need

Here's a quick breakdown of where each dollar would be going, in pretty graph format.

  • Pay Guest Actors
    • This $500 would provide me $50 per episode to pay actors with. I pay my guest voice actors $1 per line, so that's 50 lines each episode where you don't have to hear my voice!
  • Hosting Fees
    • Sidequesting is hosted on Pinecast with their $5/month plan. This $60 pays for a year of hosting.
  • Sticker Cost
    • Ordering stickers costs money. I've already done this (because I LOVE stickers), but a little reimbursement on that $40 would be nice.
  • Indiegogo Fees
    • 5% of the money raised goes to Indiegogo. If the goal is reached, that's $40.
  • Episode Production
    • Once we get past $640, I (Tal) can begin to pay myself a small stipend of up to $160 for my time writing, acting, and producing the show! Production includes line editing, sound design, and final mixing, which I do by myself. A little bit of this money will also go to purchasing some fun medieval foley noises!

 

What You Get

Here's the available perks:

  • Thanks on Website
    • You'll be listed on the supporters section of our website!
  • Digital Bundle
    • This bundle includes:
      • 4 supporter exclusive episodes
        • 2 from Season 1
        • 2 from Season 2
      • Bloopers from both seasons
      • Season 2 finale playlist
      • A selection of miscellaneous behind the scenes updates from both seasons
        • Season 1's updates were: a written SFX breadown of episode 5 and audio of Tal creating a threatening ukulele noise for episode 7
        • Season 2's updates will be determined based on what interesting things happen behind the scenes
      • Access to exclusive supporter channels on the Sidequesting Discord Server. I post little updates and behind the scenes things here while I work on episodes.
    • You'll receive the Season 1 related perks when this campaign ends, and season 2 perks as they are made throughout the season
  • Stickers
    • I'll mail you three stickers of the Sidequesting cover art!
  • Cat Picture
    • I'll mail you a Polaroid picture of one of my cats (this perk also includes the three stickers)! The picture will come with a note telling you which cat is in the picture and what she's doing.
  • Secrets
    • You can ask me two questions about the new season OR I will tell you two of my favorite things happening in the new season! I have lots of exciting things planned and I really want to talk about them. You'll get a digital certificate declaring you an official holder of Sidequesting secrets.
  • Single Episode Shout Out
    • I'll give you (or your project/show) a shout out in the credits of one of Season 2's episodes! I'll also thank you on Twitter when that episode airs.
  • Name A Character
    • Name a character in Season 2! You can name them after yourself, a friend, a pet, or just a name you like. I'll also thank you on Twitter when the episode with your named character airs.
  • Thanked in Every Episode
    • You'll be thanked in the credits in every episode of season 2! I'll also mail you a personalized thank you card with your stickers and cat picture.

 

Your Impact

The impact of your contribution is pretty straightforward:

  • Support indie audio fiction and fund queer art by queer people!
    • Up to $500 - Help Tal pay guest actors!
    • Up to $640 - Help Tal pay guest actors AND pay for various fees!
    • Up to $800  - Allow Tal to make a little money for their writing/acting/sound design!
    • Past $800 - Allow Tal to pay their guest actors even more!

 

Risks & Challenges

This season is happening regardless of if this goal is reached. But here are the risks of your donation:

  • You don't like the season
    • I can't do too much about this one. I am doing my best to create episodes I am proud of, but art is subjective and there is a chance you might not like it. But if you liked season 1, I think you'll like this season!
  • You don't like the digital perks
    • I also can't do too much about this one. I am doing my best to create bonus material I am proud of, but art is subjective and there is a chance you might not like it. But if you liked season 1, I think you'll like the digital perks!
  • The season takes longer to come out than expected
    • The 10 episodes of season 2 will air sometime this year. Episodes will be spaced out approximately 2-4 weeks (though longer if something happens to me, like getting sick). If you expect this, you won't be disappointed!
  • Your digital reward arrives later than expected
    • The season 1 related digital rewards are finished and will be sent to you when this campaign closes, but the season 2 digital rewards will be created along with the season. They will be all be released within a month of episode 20 airing (and likely sooner). If you expect this, you won't be disappointed!
  • Your physical perk(s) get lost in the mail

    • I have all the physical perks in my possession already (so acquiring them is not a risk), but if your reward gets lost in the mail I'll resend it to you!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The fact that you care enough to read all the way to the bottom of this campaign means SO MUCH to me. It's okay if you can't support, your interest in the show and this crowdfunding campaign is gift enough. Here's a few other things you can do if you'd like.

  • Share this campaign on Twitter (or other social media)
  • Check out the Patreon (especially if you'd prefer a smaller, recurring contribution)
  • Tell friends about the show

story:
Short Summary

I’ve been interested in starting a podcast for a while now. I’ve always been told I’m a good story teller, and have lots of stories to tell! ? I’m looking forward to getting things rolling. I have some guests lined up to talk with me. It’ll be all things from concerts, to moving to LA, my experiences growing up, the people I’ve met and the things I’ve learned along the way. 

 

The first major hurdle is obtaining some quality equipment to make sure everything runs smoothly. Eventually I would like to add a visual component to the podcast as well, simultaneously uploading to YouTube as well as the audio platforms, but until I can afford video equipment- I’m in need of at least 2 XLR microphones, 2 over the ear headphones, a mixer, microphone stands and boom arms, pop filters, headphone amplifiers, and maybe more! I’m putting my own money into this, but am shamelessly asking for the help of family and friends so that I can get decent quality equipment. I plan to do this for the longhaul, interviewing some of my musician friends, and eventually doing celebrity interviews! With the connections I have in Toronto, and the ones I’ve made here in Los Angeles, I know this is going to be very fun, and I’m excited to get it started finally!!! 

BENEFITS & PERKS

 

BRONZE TIER - Donate $5 & You will get a shoutout during the first episode of the podcast, thanking you for your involvement in the project.

SILVER TIER - Donate $15 & You will receive everything included in Bronze Tier plus a more personalized shoutout, where maybe I talk about a memory we have together or how I know you etc.

GOLD TIER - Donate $25 & You will receive everything in Bronze and Silver Tiers. PLUS you choose the topic I discuss in a future episode of the podcast. 

ULTIMATE TIER - Donate $50 & You will receive everything included in Bronze, Silver & Gold Tiers. PLUS you can be the guest on an episode of the podcast and choose your topic of choice.

I plan to do this for the longhaul, interviewing some of my musician friends, and eventually doing celebrity interviews! With the connections I have in Toronto, and the ones I’ve made here in Los Angeles, I know this is going to be very fun, and I’m excited to get it started finally!!! BENEFITS & PERKS BRONZE TIER - Donate $5 & You will get a shoutout during the first episode of the podcast, thanking you for your involvement in the project.SILVER TIER - Donate $15 & You will receive everything included in Bronze Tier plus a more personalized shoutout, where maybe I talk about a memory we have together or how I know you etc.GOLD TIER - Donate $25 & You will receive everything in Bronze and Silver Tiers. PLUS you choose the topic I discuss in a future episode of the podcast. ULTIMATE TIER - Donate $50 & You will receive everything included in Bronze, Silver & Gold Tiers. PLUS you can be the guest on an episode of the podcast and choose your topic of choice.

story:
I Want To Play A Game...Become A Producer Today

We would like to invite you to become a Producer on our very first OFFICIAL Hollywood production.  We are going to be the first YouTube Content Creators to go inside the room where the 2004 horror movie SAW was filmed to document how it looks today as well as the other filming locations used in the movie.

Why You Should Become A Producer & What You Get

Becoming a Producer (or signing up for any Tier) puts you right in the heart of the creative process.  This documentary is made possible because of you...a fan of Horror, a fan of movies, a fan of The Grimm Life Collective.  We put blood sweat and tears into each of our videos and the filming locations for SAW will be no different.

Whichever Tier you decide to choose will unlock EXCLUSIVE...LIMITED TO THIS EVENT Grimm Life Collective Merchandise.  If you are a fan of The Grimm Life Collective then you DO NOT want to pass this up because when they are gone.  Well...then that's GAME OVER.

Other Ways You Can Help...

Your participation at any level is much appreciated.  To help us meet our goal and create a tremendous awareness, here are a few suggestions

1.  Share this Indiegogo campaign via all social media outlets...

2.  Share this Indiegogo campaign with your grandmother...

Sincerely,

Michael & Jessica Kolence - The Grimm Life Collective

story:
ME

I'm Dan Ilic. I've worked on stage, screen, radio, print, and digital across the world for the last ten years. Most recently I was the showrunner and executive producer of Tonightly with Tom Ballard on the ABC, and I host the popular Australian satire podcast A Rational Fear. Subscribe. It's very good.

WHAT'S THE BIG IDEA?

In the last 10 years, Australia has had just under 31,023  Prime Ministers. No one can remember who the current one is.

So I've created a hotline, that with the power of some code, can update automatically via Wikipedia and tell us who is the Prime Minister at that given moment?

It's just like the speaking clock — but for the Prime Minister of Australia.

It's dumb and funny — and we've built it already! 
Thanks to our friends at Twilio, you can call it now.

04888 54 280

Try it? I'll wait.

See it's great.

But the NUMBER is hard to remember.

1300 WHO THE F*** IS P.M?

This is where you come in.

I think the best 1300 number/name for this project is:  1300 WTFI PM

1300 Who The F*** Is P.M. However those numbers are really EXPENSIVE. They cost $3000 a year.  So to start off with we want $3000. Then if we get more, we plan to use that money to advertise the hotline.

$3000:  We'll buy the number/name 1300 WTFI PM|
$15000: We'll make a saucy old school late night style hotline ad and run it on TV
$23000: We'll book an infomercial on a morning TV show.
$30000: We'll pay for a full page ad in a national broadsheet newspaper.

IMPACT

You will get the satisfaction of financing some crucial Australian information infrastructure. At A Rational Fear we have a track record of making good on our crowdfunding, in 2014 we raised $50000 to make 12 weeks of satirical comedy online. Which we did to great success.

REWARDS & PERKS:

I honestly don't think anyone gives money to these things for the perks, but I'll tell you what, how about these?

$0-$50: You will get the satisfaction of knowing your donation has helped make the world a funnier place.

$50-$100: 2 free tickets to every A Rational Fear live show in 2019

$100-$500: 4 free tickets to every A Rational Fear live show in 2019

>$500: 2 free tickets to every A Rational Fear live show in 2019, and a guest interview spot on the A Rational Fear podcast for you to promote or say anything you want (within the boundaries of defamation).

story:
We suspect you knew this note was coming...

We've been holding out hope that we could perform "WiFiSciFi Live" on the date we've been looking forward to for so long. But you, our darlings, are our highest priority. And given the evolving situation with the COVID-19 virus, we can't risk your safety, or that of our audience, or of the ones you love at home. So we regret we don't have a show for you ...

... at least not right now! We are not canceling this event. We are postponing.

So, since this is your show, we want to ask you now for your suggestions about our new performance date. There are many factors that will affect the final decision, but we want to hear from you first! Write to us at wifiscifilive@gmail.com with your best idea. Heck, go wild and give us your top three!

As soon as a new date has been chosen, we'll send out an email to let you know.

If you bought a show ticket and want a refund, we can do that. Just let us know your PayPal email and we'll refund your money by April 15th.

And now for the good news!

Because we're all stuck at home and feeling twitchy, we plan some fun surprises to keep you (and, let's be honest, ourselves) entertained. Expect some digital delights in the coming months!

Thank you for your patience and for being so understanding in this admittedly wonky time.

Stay safe. Stay well. And stay tuned.

With love, Team WiFiSciFi

 

Meanwhile -- the "Virtual Perks" we offered earlier are still available -- because why not? 

And So... the List of Available Characters

We hope to raise the rest of the money we need by offering several new perks ... three of which allow you to choose from a list of characters who will say things you'd love to hear them say. We had to limit these a bit because some of our actors are busy doing other wonderful things -- but we think you'll find this an impressive selection to choose from:

  • Januae from "A Ninth World Journal"
  • Roger from "Moonbase Theta, Out"
  • Ashwini from "Moonbase Theta, Out" 
  • Michell from "Moonbase Theta, Out"
  • Alex from "Moonbase Theta, Out"
  • Tumnus from "Moonbase Theta, Out"
  • Wilder from "Moonbase Theta, Out"
  • X from "Girl in Space"
  • Cyrus from "Girl in Space"
  • Chris from "Relativity"
  • Marcus from "Relativity"
  • Prithvi from "Relativity"
  • Marta from "Relativity"
  • Nadia from "Relativity"
  • Jessie from "Oz-9"
  • The Narrator from "Oz-9"
  • Olivia from "Oz-9"
  • Madeline from "Oz-9"
  • Glenda from "Oz-9"
  • Albatross from "Oz-9"
  • Le Bichon Frise from "Oz-9"
  • Leet from "Oz-9"
  • Colin from "Oz-9"
  • Dr. von Haber Zetzer from "Oz-9"
  • Joe from "Oz-9"
  • Mr. Southers from "Oz-9"
  • Donna from "Oz-9"
  • Two-headed Bot from "Oz-9"
  • Sage from "Sage & Savant"
  • Savant from "Sage & Savant"
  • Abigail from "Sage & Savant"
  • Narrator from "Sage & Savant"

Choose the characters you'd like to hear from and let us know your choices via email at wifiscifilive@gmail.com! Then we'll get your specialized, unique scene into production...!

story:
*UPDATE*

This campaign remains active, if you want to contribute to keep raising more funds, you're welcome to do it!

If you want to buy the first ever Easy Spanish grammar digital book, choose the 25 Kilómetros perk or any higher one and you'll get the book via e-mail when we publish it (early 2019).

Any doubts, send a message an email to Juan at easyspanishvideos@gmail.com!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

---------------------------------------------

 

What is this about? 

 

  • This is a crowdfunding campaign to raise funds to do an Easy Spanish video tour through Spain:

Madrid, Barcelona, Valencia, Toledo... [backers for this crowdfunding campaign will vote which cities to visit] to produce the very first Easy Spanish episodes with the highly requested Spanish accent!


 

Why me? Why am I doing this?
 

I've lost count on how many times you've asked me to produced videos in Spain!  
As a professional video maker I know the difficulties and struggles that come with independent video production. ​The thing is that right now new collaborators can't earn money with Easy Spanish (I can barely survive myself with my current income as a full-time independent producer), meaning that even when new collaborators have the desire to make videos, they have no time to do so. That's why it has never worked out to have people as volunteers. Me, on the other hand, I'm involved 100% on this. 

So it's pretty simple to pitch you this campaign: I would like to go to Spain myself and film the whole crazy adventure of getting there, talk to the people in the streets, make many vlogs about the journey, my experience there as a Mexican and the cultural shocks that come with that and stay there for as long as I can - based on how much money this campaign raises.  It'll be an intense non-stop filming journey for the new Easy Spanish series!


 

You're making Easy Spanish happening. You decide how far this project goes.
 

I don't think I'll ever get comfortable with asking people to support me financially, but I mean, it's not really like that. Social media, Youtube and the way the world works nowadays it's amazing for young entrepreneurs, for me, instead of having a boss telling me what to do, which is so uninspiring to me, I can do things on my own and publish them available for free on Youtube, so anyone can have access to them.

The impact this project is having is starting to grow so much and the response from you - the fans, has been so overwhelmingly positive that with hard work and discipline this is actually turning into not only my full-time job but into my dream job. I cannot describe the life of a youtuber, an influencer, a digital social media content creator (however you want to call it), I can only say that is insane and it's such a beautiful job - being able to have an impact on people's lives and give them something that is feeding them such important things as multicultural perspectives and a multicultural friendly digital environment.


 

What happens if we achieve the goal?
 

  • If we raise the 100% of the campaign funding, I will be able to spend a month producing Easy Spanish in Spain!
  • If we raise 150% of the campaign funding, I will be able to spend two months producing Easy Spanish in Spain!
  • If we raise 200% of the campaign funding, I'll be able to spend three whole months producing Easy Spanish in Spain!


 

How can you back this project? What do you get in return?

 

So pretty much it's up to you on how long and how many videos you want me to produce in Spain. As a thank you for your amazing support you'll get incredible gifts in return like THE VERY FIRST EASY SPANISH GRAMMAR E-BOOK! Exclusively for backers of this campaign, that's the least I can do! 

To become a backer and make a donation just choose any of the perks from the right depending on the donation you intend to make and your interest on the gifts you'd like to receive in return. If you need assistance or you'd like to ask me for more details, send me a message here or in any of my social media profiles.


 

¡Gracias!
 

Thank you so much for reading until the end. If you have the desire and the opportunity to help me raise the funds, please don't hesitate to do so. If you are not in the position to do so, don't worry, you can also help in other ways.


 

So, what else can you do to support?
 

  • You can share this campaign with your friends, colleagues, Spanish teachers, your Spanish learning institute or just someone that is interested in the Spanish culture.
  • If you live in Spain or you know someone there with the possibility of offering me a place to stay while I'm on tour (doesn't matter where), you can contact me at easyspanishvideos@gmail.com
  • If you know any sponsors that would be interested on helping this crowdfunding and make a collaboration with Easy Spanish in Spain, in Europe or somewhere else, you can also contact me at easyspanishvideos@gmail.com 
  • If you live in a different European country and you'd like to meet me in your city to spend some time helping you improve your Spanish and be a guest on Easy Spanish and you have the possibility of paying for travel expenses, you can contact me at easyspanishvideos@gmail.com
  •  If you are a teacher/director of a language learning institute in Europe and you're interested in making a video workshop for your school and you have the possibility of paying for travel expenses, please contact me at easyspanishvideos@gmail.com


Una vez más, gracias a todos :)
Juan

If you know any sponsors that would be interested on helping this crowdfunding and make a collaboration with Easy Spanish in Spain, in Europe or somewhere else, you can also contact me at easyspanishvideos@gmail.com

story:
We've been racking our brains for a decent solution to have as many of you as possible at our Presentation of Findings Live event in London next week. Of course, aside from you buying a €50 ticket to join us there, the natural solution would be for us to do a live stream here but we don't think live streaming a panel event with lots of sides and multiple speakers from a single iPhone could do it all justice. 

So we thought about selling tickets to do something a bit slicker but that runs the risk of us not selling enough tickets to cover our costs - and we can't risk eating away at our small reserves as this is desperately needed to cover the last few bits of post-processing and research.

What to do? We need to raise €1000 to provide a decent quality livestream and have a little bit left over to put in the kitty...Then it dawned on us, why not run a micro-crowdfunder for 1 week? It's not like we haven't been crazy enough to think that would work before, eh? 

We're running this 6-day micro-crowdfunding campaign to raise €1000. Everyone that pledges €10 or more will get access to the livestream and a replay of the presentation of findings event taking place next Monday night in London with our special guests. 

***NEW PERK ALERT!***

For €20.00 you'll get access to the live stream AND be invited to join our Virtual Dig Team private Facebook group. In the group you'll be able to catch-up with every single daily live stream from the 8-week excavation, access loads of videos, photos, posts, and join our thriving community with over 1000 members!

Background

Dig Hill 80 is owned and operated by Project Whitesheet VZW, a registered charity in Brugge, Belgium.

After a successfully funded crowdfunding campaign in December 2017, Team Dig Hill 80 excavated a well-preserved German strongpoint at a ridge top known as 'Hill 80' near the village of Wijtschate in Belgium.

In April 2018 people of all ages and from all over world will meet to jointly work side by side to uncover a piece of their history (where a century before their ancestors slaughtered one another). This dig is about much more than the fallen. It is an international project which is about education, peace, reconciliation. Without jingoism.

Find out more about us on our website DigHill80.com.

story:
The Impact

Before I was comfortable with myself, when I was hiding that I was gay, it would've been comforting to hear the stories of other queer people. I believe it would have reassured me that I wasn't alone. 

Short Summary

My name is Valerie and I work as a video producer with a background in journalism. This is a passion project of mine that I have been working on for several months. I have completed 10+ interviews with people who are diverse in age, race, and experience. I'm excited to share all of these folx' amazing stories. Your contribution will make sure my product is polished before its released and will send a message to those who need to hear they're not alone. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am raising money to fund the intro song, logo, and other basic production costs to launch season one and to start season two. Any contribution is welcome but the first 50 people to donate $50 will get a magnet with the new logo on it. If you donate $100 or more you get an episode dedicated to you at the start and end of the show. Please help me spread the word! Thank you for taking the time and any contribution is greatly appreciated.
story_txt:
The Impact
Before I was comfortable with myself, when I was hiding that I was gay, it would've been comforting to hear the stories of other queer people. I believe it would have reassured me that I wasn't alone. 
Short Summary
My name is Valerie and I work as a video producer with a background in journalism. This is a passion project of mine that I have been working on for several months. I have completed 10+ interviews with people who are diverse in age, race, and experience. I'm excited to share all of these folx' amazing stories. Your contribution will make sure my product is polished before its released and will send a message to those who need to hear they're not alone. 

What We Need & What You Get
I am raising money to fund the intro song, logo, and other basic production costs to launch season one and to start season two. Any contribution is welcome but the first 50 people to donate $50 will get a magnet with the new logo on it. If you donate $100 or more you get an episode dedicated to you at the start and end of the show. Please help me spread the word! Thank you for taking the time and any contribution is greatly appreciated.

story:
Hi, my name is Steve Greene. Back in the late 1970’s-mid1980's, I was a volunteer firefighter/EMT. I did it all; from motor vehicle extrication to fully-engulfed house fires; from helping the homeless on the street to using CPR and reviving someone whose heart had stopped. Unfortunately, after 8 years I suffered an injury that ended my firefighting career and which, in 1992, led me to become partially disabled. But it never took my love of serving my community and the fire service, out of my heart. For the past 30+ years, I've always carried an emergency "jump bag" in my vehicles and have stopped at hundreds of emergencies to render aid before local fire-rescue arrives!

In 2016, after a great deal of encouragement from firefighting friends on social media, I started my podcast, "5-Alarm Task Force." With more than 60 episodes aired, I have had some of the top leaders, instructors and mentors in the fire service as my guests. One of the great dangers to firefighters today and a personal fight of mine is cancer!  I have listeners on six of the seven continents and can average over a thousand downloads per week. Why? Because firefighters have a hunger to learn. And though I can no longer help them on the fire lines, I can feed that hunger.

This is why I love and do what I do! Because, I'm the "poster boy" for the phrase: "You can take the boy out of the firehouse, but you'll never take the firehouse out of the boy," and this podcast can and will help save the lives of brave men and women who answer your call on your worst day!

Unfortunately, there's a cost to do this. I have a podcast host that has to be paid, broadband for Internet access in my home, microphones, mixers and more. I also have a new website at www.dalmatianproductions.tv, where you can listen to or download our podcasts or you can find us on iTunes, Google Play and Spotify, all at no charge! Here's an important point: I do not have any paid advertisers. So, I only use public service announcements, and that translates into no income. Plus, being partially disabled and retired, my personal income is not what it used to be.

I have received numerous requests to attend several of the regional and national conferences and that incurs travel costs. These conferences are amazing, however there are thousands of firefighters who cannot attend for various reasons. My podcasts can bring many of the speakers and instructors from those conferences, to those who are unable to attend. That service alone is priceless!

But more equipment is needed to do live podcasts and record interviews and sound bites, on-scene. I will also bring much of this material back to use on my podcasts. If I can bring information on new tactics, new technology, medical and psychological breakthroughs that will save lives to firefighters around the world, then it is imperative I continue my mission!

Here's my plan:

I want to raise $2,500.00. This is what my campaign is about:

1.     It's time for me to create some promotional items, i.e., T-shirts, mugs, caps, etc. to share with you, my supporters and my fans and which can be sold on my website to generate a modest revenue.

2.     Funding for a DSLR (Digital Single Lens Reflex) Camera with Wi-Fi capability, along with a tripod, light and microphone.

3.     Travel (air/car), hotel, entrance fees, food, etc. for several of the regional and/or national conferences in 2018-2019. No, I don't travel first class! I'm a "budget" traveler.

Since I started in 2016, I have put in all the money I can afford to. And even if this campaign doesn't raise a single dollar, I will continue to do what I can, for as long as I can! And you know what? Even if you are unable to help financially, you can still assist me by spreading the word about my campaign. Let others know about it on your social media! That would be a great help! And don't forget, Indiegogo has sharing tools to help you spread the news!

However, you can help me do more. And I ask you to please remember two important points:

1. Everything I do now with this podcast and will continue to do, no matter what happens with this campaign, is directed to help the brave men and women of the fire service. If you want references, I can provide them as well.

2. In the middle of the night, when your smoke detector awakens you, "who ya gonna call?"

Thank you and God Bless!

story:
Long Story Short...

This Indiegogo drive will cover the costs of paying everyone involved—the actors, the sound editor, and the artist. This is my first time manning the reigns on an audio drama of my own, and even though it's a short miniseries, I want it to be of amazing quality. That's where you can help!

About the Creator

Jack Pevyhouse is an award-winning writer and audio drama podcaster with a BA in English from the University of North Carolina at Pembroke. He currently works for Crossroad Stations as a scriptwriter and assistant producer for the audio drama podcast Jim Robbie and the Wanderers, and voice actor for Misadventure by Death and Otherverse. 

Initially, this idea was in the form of a poem, written during his time as a poetry candidate in the Creative Writing MFA Program at the University of North Carolina at Wilmington. He decided not to continue his studies after a year in favor of becoming even more involved in the audio drama community and producing his own audio drama instead.

Progress So Far…

We're planning on launching the first episode in late November of this year, with a new episode every two weeks until it’s complete!

As of right now, the show has been cast, and recording will begin in the last week of September!

As for a crew, I have Julia Schifini of Tides, What’s the Frequency, and the boozy mythological talk show Spirits joining the cast as the Guide, and Erin Baumann, sound editor and designer for Misadventure by Death joining us as our sound editor as well!

How the funds will be used:

Most audio dramas are a completely unpaid labor of love—however, sound editing isn’t easy, and professional editors deserve pay, and I’d hate to see Erin slave over something for free. $800 will be covering the sound editing of all 4 episodes, while $200 will cover hosting fees. I also would love to pay the voice actors and cover artist for their hard work and time, so the remaining $500 will be evenly split among the cast and artist.

Perks! Goodies! Stuff!

Given this will only be around two hours of content, physical goodies like shirts and posters will most likely come later as a part of the Crossroad Stations store. However, backers will be receiving things such as:

  • Access to behind-the-scenes updates
  • Blooper reel
  • A recording of the Guide reciting the original poem this was based on!
  • An Associate Producer’s credit!

In Closing

Thank you for your support! If you aren’t able to help financially, spreading the word will be enough! Even if we only receive half, or a quarter, or just a single dollar, this miniseries will be made!

story:
I will carry this commitment with me This Year and Beyond

This is a commitment that  all one million+ AmeriCorps members has made. There are so many of us doing amazing things that are strengthening their community, but just imagine what we could accomplish by using our entire network.  There is always so much getting in our way to make real sustainable change, but we don't need to do it alone. So let's do it together - This Year & Beyond. 

This Year & Beyond is a podcast with the lofty goal of (re)connecting AmeriCorps alums from all programs to that time we all found ourselves serving others.  Each week we will build connections with, learn about and be inspired by fellow AmeriCorps alums,  There is an amazing network of alums out there. Let's untap it. By pledging to this campaign I promise you that this is only the beginning, 

In order to keep the momentum going. I need your help. 

How will the money be used?

By donating to the podcast you will be connecting yourself and other AmeriCorps member and alums across the country by:

  • Supporting and promoting projects AmeriCorps alums are working on. 
  • Direct support of currently serving Corpsmembers. 
  • Paying AmeriCorps alum to help produce, edit and market the podcast. 
  • Covering server, bandwidth, hardware & other day-to-day costs. Right now monthly costs are around $150,  but they will increase as more people start listening to the podcast. 
  • Upgrading hardware and software to create a higher quality product and more in depth reporting on topics such as
    • Living on the AmeriCorps stipend
    • What can we do to ensure AmeriCorps is here for generations to come?
    • How can we enhance the AmeriCorps experience for all identities and lived experiences
    • Who the heck is Eli Segal anyways?

Contact

Feel free to send me an e-mail at thisyearandbeyond [at] gmail.com if you have any questions or if you just want to say hi!

Help spread the word

Please share with your AmeriFriends and Family.  There are 1,000,000 of us out there,  Imagine what we could accomplish if everyone donated $1. Make this the reason you get back in contact with your team and old co-workers. Get them excited by sharing this campaign through e-mail, facebook, twitter, phone call, text message, sky writing, or an IRL conversation!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Whoa. You made it all the way down here. Hi!

story:
Possibilities Podcast started from a desire to connect with the infinite potential of everyday, in the midst of a world that preaches narrow preordained life paths. So who better to be in conversation with than QTBIPOC visionaries, creators, space makers? Those who know intimately what it means to be on the outside and despite everything build a world worthy of themselves. 

We are taking steps towards something that was always our intention from the start - making this work financially sustainable. This has been a labour of love, created with passion, dedication, borrowed equipment and joy. All costs and contributions have been largely out of pocket. With this fundraiser we hope to be able to recoup costs, buy equipment, pay the artists that generously gave us their music, and pay ourselves for the research, production, editing, transcription, art making and publishing labour we did and will continue to do.

The journey of creating and building this podcast has been truly magical in its triumphs and its lessons. We practiced building a collaborative team with a common vision and desire to centre generative process at the heart of producing this podcast. We have interviewed folks we have admired and loved from close and afar, with deep dive conversations that make our hearts soar and we hope yours too. We produced transcripts for our (sometimes way too long) episodes to increase accessibility of our show. We created artworks for each episode as a way to honour the expansiveness we experienced while having those conversations. Most of all we have listened - to the brilliance of our guests, and to each other, ourselves and our environment. We shifted course when things didn’t feel in alignment, slowed down, re-oriented to what the moment called for us to do and followed through on our commitments. In doing that we created the possibility for us to do this work in a spiritually sustaining way, even in the midst of a pandemic. 

What We Need 

There’s a lot of pieces that come together to produce an episode of the podcast- although we can turn out episodes out of love, our dream is to properly cover the cost for our episodes!

To give you a sense, each episode at a minimum costs $2250, Here’s a breakdown of what that covers:
Researcher/Host: $600
Producer: $500 
Creative Editor: $300
Media: $200
Artwork: $150
Guest Honorarium: $200
Music: $100
Transcription: $150
Equipment: $50

Reaching our goal means we can make another season of the podcast and invest in the continued growth of the podcast.Your support matters as we continue to build and grow possibilities for us all.

Learn more about the podcast on our website: possibilitiespodcast.com

Listen to our episodes on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or anywhere you listen to podcasts.


Donate, Buy merch and Spread the word!

 

T-Shirt Details

i am an infinite possibility shirts feature small front gold text and the possibilities podcast logo fuchsia and gold on the back. Crew cut black shirts are available in various sizes (S, M, L, XL, XXL, XXXL) and are locally screenprinted. Design by @umangsagar_

w/Pick Up includes pick up in Toronto, CAN only during allocated pick up times in Dec 2020
w/Delivery includes shipping to US and CAN only (no overseas shipping at the moment) 

  • Orders made on or before Nov 30, 2020 will be shipped first week of December
  • Orders made Dec 1, 2020 onward will be shipped after the campaign for estimated delivery Jan 2021

Size Chart:

Sticker Pack Details


Packs contain 3 stickers; possibilities podcast logo, i can handle the universe, i am an infinite possibility stickers. 

Locally printed with guerilla printing, designs by @umangsagar_

w/Pick Up includes pick up in Toronto, CAN only during allocated pick up times in Dec 2020
w/Delivery includes shipping to US and CAN only (no overseas shipping at the moment) 

  • Orders made on or before Nov 30, 2020 will be shipped first week of December
  • Orders made Dec 1, 2020 onward will be shipped after the campaign for estimated delivery Jan 2021

story:
Introducing Rebelle Zine, an online publication made by and for young women and queer folks. Rebelle uses a multi-platformed approach to highlight the diverse creatives that are making their mark on the world today. Rebelle Zine consists of multimedia articles highlighting young creators, talents, entrepreneurs, and activists through social media and an interactive site.

 

Rebelle. Pronounced like the verb, “to rebel”, our zine is an act of rebellion against structures that speak over marginalized voices. Rebelle Zine takes an intersectional approach to amplify these voices. Our mission is to foster a community centered around promoting the success of women and queer folks in creative and business avenues. As a diverse group of women and nonbinary creatives, our team understands the importance of uplifting all voices, especially those that are marginalized.

 

Creatives are the heart and soul of Toronto. We’ve got some of the most talented music artists, painters, writers, filmmakers, photographers, makeup/SFX artists… the list goes on. Rebelle is a community for us all to get connected and support each other. We’d love for you to be part of it!

We seek out diverse, hard-working and talented individuals to interview and feature in our monthly issues, with a different artistic avenue as the central focus each month.

We also engage with our community through reposting work on our social media, and showcasing community submissions in our zine.

 

The Rebelle Zine team is a passionate and creative group of fourth-year RTA Media Production students from Toronto, Canada. With a common goal to highlight deserving talent and bring important topics to light, each member of the team brings their unique skills and style to Rebelle.

SERINA | GRAPHIC DESIGNER

she/her | Sagittarius

IG: @velvet.daydreams

Hi, my name is Serina and I am the graphic designer for Rebelle Zine. I enjoy being able to use my artistic abilities to create designs that are effective and meaningful. Working with Rebelle means that I get to collaborate with an awesome team, as well as help to realize our goals of showcasing the work from underrepresented groups. Aside from Rebelle, I enjoy doing anything that allows me to be creative. This includes painting, drawing, knitting, and 3D modelling. In the future I hope to be able to work on projects that I am passionate about and are meaningful to me.

 

LEILA | COMMUNICATIONS MANAGER

she/her | Gemini

IG: @leilapoupada

Hey I’m Leila, the Communications Manager for Rebelle Zine. I’ve always had a passion for creating. Ever since I was in elementary school, I always looked for creative ways to present my work and it has become a passion of mine ever since. Being able to connect and share around the world through social media has always intrigued me. Rebelle Zine uses the power of social media to create a platform and voice for underrepresented groups within the creative industries and I am honoured to have a major part in that. Outside of Rebelle Zine I’ve managed some social media business accounts but am currently working on starting up a YouTube channel and business account for myself and my partner. In the future I wish to pursue a career similar to my role on Rebelle Zine, anything to do with social media and creating is the long term goal! 

 

JENNY | WEB DESIGNER

she/her | Gemini

IG: @jenbalite

Portfolio: https://jbalite.myportfolio.com/work 

Hey, I’m Jenny. I’m the Web Designer of Rebelle Zine. I’ve always been interested in anything media related ever since I was a kid and tackled different mediums including graphic design, videography, photography, creative direction and web design. I enjoy collaborating and searching for local artists and believe that everyone deserves a place to shine, making Rebelle Zine an important project I take pride in being a part of. Outside of Rebelle Zine I’ve been working with local artists directing and editing music videos. I am also a part of a creative studio known as Underscore Studios. In the future, I wish to continue being involved in more creative projects in relation to the music and fashion industry as well as meet and work with more local artists!

 

MAEVE | PRODUCER & LEAD WRITER

they/she | Taurus

IG: @maevedelia

Hey! I’m Maeve. As soon as I heard what Rebelle was all about, I was ready to jump on board as producer to help create something impactful. I really enjoy bringing all the moving parts together to make our vision come to life. I’m also eager to write content for our zine! Writing is one of my favourite elements of media production - in fact, I have a concentration in screenwriting - and my goal is to create content that does justice to the amazing talent we’re going to feature. Outside of Rebelle, I’m an independent music artist under the name Maeve Delia. I'm also the Executive Director of Ryenamics, an award-winning competitive a cappella group from X University. I hope to continue coordinating creative projects in the future!

 

MIKU | VIDEOGRAPHER & EDITOR

she/her | Libra

IG: @miku.sakamoto

Hi hello, I’m Miku! As the videographer of Rebelle Zine, I’m beyond excited to not only share the stories of our featured creatives through my favourite medium, but also learn about the stories of our community through various art forms! I’m passionate about storytelling and education, so many of the projects I’ve worked on value these two elements. Outside of my role on the Rebelle team, I’m a media coordinator at a local Japanese school where I create educational resources. I hope to work in the post-production industry someday, and would love to ultimately pursue a career in teaching! 

 

SARAH | CREATIVE DIRECTOR

she/her | Aries

IG: @snappedbysarahmc

Portfolio: www.sarahmcintyre.myportfolio.com

Hi, I’m Sarah! I am the Creative Director & Photographer for Rebelle Zine. I’ve always been inspired by art & design, and found myself longingly watching behind-the-scenes videos for editorial shoots. One day I thought, “What’s stopping me from doing this myself?,” and so Rebelle Zine was born with the aim of highlighting underrepresented groups within the creative industries. My role on Rebelle Zine is pretty much my dream job. If I can find a way to make this my career, I may be the happiest person on this planet. Outside of Rebelle I am kind of a workaholic but I try to make time for personal photography/design/video projects and exploring the city.

 

Rebelle Zine is an independent student-run production, so we need your help to make our vision a reality! Our initial goal is to raise $2000.

Here’s a breakdown of what our budget will go toward :

 

So, why should you donate to Rebelle Zine?

Not only would you be helping a group of passionate students make our vision a reality, you'd also be supporting upcoming creatives of all kinds. You're helping a community of talented people grow their audiences, which is often something that artists rely on to support themselves and further their careers. 

Another great reason to donate is to grab some PERKS!

 

We want to give back to our generous donors! Check out the perks we have listed - depending on how much you wish to donate, you could get a shoutout on our website and/or Instagram, as well as some NEW Rebelle merch, including t-shirts, tote bags, buttons and stickers. We’ve got some pretty cute stuff (if we do say so ourselves) and we know you’d absolutely rock it. Plus, we’ll send every donor a personalized thank you note!

We'll need some time to process and package your orders, so expect to receive merchandise in November 2021.

Please note that all donors who select a perk will have their public Indiegogo display name shouted out under the Supporters section of our website (rebellezine.com). If you do not wish to receive the shoutout, or want to change the name that is displayed, send us an email at info@rebellezine.com with your request before September 30, 2021.

 

Your donations are directly supporting a whole community of talented and deserving creatives. Thank you for helping us grow as a collective, and we hope you come along with us!

If you’d like to follow along on the Rebelle journey, be sure to follow us on Instagram and TikTok at @rebellezine.

Thank you! <3
story_txt: Introducing Rebelle Zine, an online publication made by and for young women and queer folks. Rebelle uses a multi-platformed approach to highlight the diverse creatives that are making their mark on the world today. Rebelle Zine consists of multimedia articles highlighting young creators, talents, entrepreneurs, and activists through social media and an interactive site. Rebelle. Pronounced like the verb, “to rebel”, our zine is an act of rebellion against structures that speak over marginalized voices. Rebelle Zine takes an intersectional approach to amplify these voices. Our mission is to foster a community centered around promoting the success of women and queer folks in creative and business avenues. As a diverse group of women and nonbinary creatives, our team understands the importance of uplifting all voices, especially those that are marginalized. Creatives are the heart and soul of Toronto. We’ve got some of the most talented music artists, painters, writers, filmmakers, photographers, makeup/SFX artists… the list goes on. Rebelle is a community for us all to get connected and support each other. We’d love for you to be part of it!We seek out diverse, hard-working and talented individuals to interview and feature in our monthly issues, with a different artistic avenue as the central focus each month.We also engage with our community through reposting work on our social media, and showcasing community submissions in our zine. The Rebelle Zine team is a passionate and creative group of fourth-year RTA Media Production students from Toronto, Canada. With a common goal to highlight deserving talent and bring important topics to light, each member of the team brings their unique skills and style to Rebelle.SERINA | GRAPHIC DESIGNERshe/her | SagittariusIG: @velvet.daydreamsHi, my name is Serina and I am the graphic designer for Rebelle Zine. I enjoy being able to use my artistic abilities to create designs that are effective and meaningful. Working with Rebelle means that I get to collaborate with an awesome team, as well as help to realize our goals of showcasing the work from underrepresented groups. Aside from Rebelle, I enjoy doing anything that allows me to be creative. This includes painting, drawing, knitting, and 3D modelling. In the future I hope to be able to work on projects that I am passionate about and are meaningful to me. LEILA | COMMUNICATIONS MANAGERshe/her | GeminiIG: @leilapoupadaHey I’m Leila, the Communications Manager for Rebelle Zine. I’ve always had a passion for creating. Ever since I was in elementary school, I always looked for creative ways to present my work and it has become a passion of mine ever since. Being able to connect and share around the world through social media has always intrigued me. Rebelle Zine uses the power of social media to create a platform and voice for underrepresented groups within the creative industries and I am honoured to have a major part in that. Outside of Rebelle Zine I’ve managed some social media business accounts but am currently working on starting up a YouTube channel and business account for myself and my partner. In the future I wish to pursue a career similar to my role on Rebelle Zine, anything to do with social media and creating is the long term goal!  JENNY | WEB DESIGNERshe/her | GeminiIG: @jenbalitePortfolio: https://jbalite.myportfolio.com/work Hey, I’m Jenny. I’m the Web Designer of Rebelle Zine. I’ve always been interested in anything media related ever since I was a kid and tackled different mediums including graphic design, videography, photography, creative direction and web design. I enjoy collaborating and searching for local artists and believe that everyone deserves a place to shine, making Rebelle Zine an important project I take pride in being a part of. Outside of Rebelle Zine I’ve been working with local artists directing and editing music videos. I am also a part of a creative studio known as Underscore Studios. In the future, I wish to continue being involved in more creative projects in relation to the music and fashion industry as well as meet and work with more local artists! MAEVE | PRODUCER & LEAD WRITERthey/she | TaurusIG: @maevedeliaHey! I’m Maeve. As soon as I heard what Rebelle was all about, I was ready to jump on board as producer to help create something impactful. I really enjoy bringing all the moving parts together to make our vision come to life. I’m also eager to write content for our zine! Writing is one of my favourite elements of media production - in fact, I have a concentration in screenwriting - and my goal is to create content that does justice to the amazing talent we’re going to feature. story:
So who is this TRex person and what's this all about?

David Ferguson is a humorist, musician and journalist whose first blog -- back in the early 2000s -- was called 'Thesaurus Rex,' which was later shortened to TRex.

  • Ferguson has contributed to The Guardian, Salon, NBC and other outlets.
  • This campaign is to raise money to help him realize a longtime dream of having his own talk show.
  • Early episodes are posted at the podcast's Patreon page, but we need better equipment, an audio mixing board, more microphones, soundproofing and other supplies.

You can help out in two ways

Supporters can make a one-time contribution through Indiegogo or become monthly subscribers through Patreon. Top-tier subscribers will receive exclusive content including special episodes, music, access to a daily journal about the show and more!

We know there's a lot of podcasts out there, but we hope to take you on some truly amazing adventures and talk to everyone from journalists to artists to engineers and scientists. But to do this, we need your support. 

Please help spread the word and use the Share Tools included in this post. 

Thank you so much, I can't wait to talk to you all
