story:
UPDATE (2 MONTHS LATER)

A month and a half since we successfully reached our goal, a lot has happened. Ryan started things off for us with a brief visit to Prishtina, Kosovo, and then quickly hopped over the border to Skopje, Macedonia, where he was soon joined by Rebecca. We launched the podcast shortly after that (listen here:  http://lostsoulspod.podomatic.com ) and spent our days wandering the rather empty but intriguing center of Skopje, with it's massive, imperial sculptures, strange in their newness and sheer ubiquity, as well as its equally empty but impressively sprawling bazaar.


Flags, statues, neon lights and fountains adorn the central square of Skopje

We tried new foods and made new friends – or at least learned to deal with them after some initial violent encounters – by them I mean some scary but harmless cockroaches. We performed our first show at a lovely publishing house / cafe in Skopje, met lots of cool people, and then moved on to Strumica, a much smaller city, but a much more lively and charming one. People in the streets everywhere, incredible food, and one of the coolest venues we've ever performed in! An underground bar with bikes hanging from the ceiling and just a great vibe. We had a great time hanging out with our soon-to-be audience, and then the show itself was a blast and at some point we even had much of the room up on stage participating! Things got a little bit complicated, though, so we soon high-tailed it back to Skopje, and then, looking for a change of scene, we made our way to Bulgaria.


Rebecca reads poetry in Skopje while Ryan and a volunteer look on.

We've been in Bulgaria for over a month now. We've released more episodes in what's become a rather sprawling, multi-form podcast, featuring interviews, parallel universes and even a spin-off mini-series called Gruszkatown, which reviews other podcasts. While we've spent much of our time in Sofia, we've just returned from a week away including a visit to Plovdiv, a quaint, colorful historically-important city which is soon to be the European Capital of Culture. Here we enjoyed the quotidian shenanigans of many street cats and also ate a lot of Alex's fine and delicious street food.


Gruszka gets some exercise in Sofia and creates art for her show, too!

Next, we traveled to Gabrovo, a small town famous the world over for its humor, or more specifically its Museum House of Humour and Satire. Despite having been rejected from its most recent biennial, Ryan's heart was set on making this pilgrimage. His hopes were rewarded bounteously, ten-fold and with a cherry on top. Or specifically, a cat holding a cherry in one hand, and its tail in the other, having had it docked in the great Gabrovo tradition. See the museum's website for more information.


Russian Man high fives one of the famous Gabrovo cats!

Now, having returned to Sofia, we are in the midst of much preparation for multiple upcoming performances. First, we'll be in Soho for a night – but don't be fooled ! - it's not London or New York, but SOHO Sofia, a co-working space in the heart of the city's emerging arts district. Next, we'll be in residence just around the corner for a week at the Dom na Kinoto, or Cinema House, a building with a fair amount of architectural oomph. This residence involves the creation of a physical Tourist Office for Lost Souls, which will be staffed alternately by Russian Man, Ryan, Gruszka, and Rebecca, two at a time, of course, no more no less. Here we'll be subverting the traditional idea of a tourist office, and will invite locals to come to us. We'll share stories of our travels to other cities and other worlds, while they'll be asked to tell us about themselves and their own adventures here in Sofia and Bulgaria. When not busy welcoming visitors, we'll be continuing work on the many art objects being produced by the Tourist Office – including illustrations for the Lost Souls children's book, which Rebecca has been hard at work on! While the Tourist Office will be located in the upper hall of the cinema house, we'll also be putting on a performance in their “dream palace” cinema theater – to quote Roxy Music's Brian Ferry. We also hope to hold a children's puppet-making and puppeteering workshop.


Penelope the Mouse Puppet with the Ghost of Democracy in 2D

The Podcast

Almost a year has passed since Ryan Galer appointed his alter ego Russian Man the host of Cabaret Galer. The two have worked surprisingly well together on all manner of projects. Russian Man, however, has grown tired of life in France. He wants more space, more freedom to be himself. First, he tries to go to London, but he forgets his manners. Then, he considers Berlin, but rents are rising, and everyone says it's “not what it used to be.” So he casts his net wider, and it lands in the Balkans.

Russian Man feels that his current situation is relevant to other lost souls. Who knows, he might even be able to help them out with some of their own problems! What if he were to document his journey, like some kind of bard for the digital age? “A blog? Or a vlog?” he wonders, when suddenly, a little bird whispers into his ear, “Make a podcast, Russian Man, this is your destiny. Call it 'Russian Man's Tourist Office for Lost Souls,' and you will make history!”

When Ryan Galer gets wind of Russian Man's plan, he decides that there's nothing more in life he'd like to do than help him out. If only he could find him! Fortunately, his friend / fairy godmother / fellow performer Gruszka drops into town every once in a while to point him in the right direction. She even knows a thing or two about podcasts! Will Galer track Russian Man down? What if he doesn't want to be found? Follow along and soon enough, you'll find out!

Who's Russian Man?

Russian Man is the alter ego of Ryan Galer. Russian Man's original inspiration comes from the year Ryan spent in an art commune in Paris, France, which was run by an eccentric and omnipresent Russian landlord. The tenants imitated him as a form of coping. Galer took this a lot further, eventually founding his own imaginary city-state called Putingrad. Russian Man quickly rose from television host to mayor-elect. When Galer retired that project, Russian Man became the host of Cabaret Galer.

 

Who's Ryan Galer?

Ryan Galer is a multidisciplinary artist working in performance, writing, film, conceptual, and street art. Born in 1989, raised in small town New England, Galer graduated from Brown University in 2012, completing a thesis film at Rhode Island School of Design. He then moved semi-permanently to Paris, France. Galer has held shows in public parks, at metro stations and in private residences. His first art exhibition, also a piece of experimental theater, took place in his bedroom in early December 2016.

online portfolio: http://ryangaler.tumblr.com

artist page: http://facebook.com/ryangalerartist

short films: http://vimeo.com/ryangaler

comedy: http://youtube.com/rye13rjg

 

Who else?

Rebecca Larkin will be accompanying us as project manager / editorial advisor. She will also be making appearances as the performer – curator known as Gruszka. A poet, comedian, and all-around experimental performer based in Paris, Larkin most recently collaborated with Galer in “Cabaret Galer Presents : Cabaret Galer.” She particularly likes puppets and podcasts.

You can find more examples of her work here : https://www.facebook.com/rebeccalarkinart

 

Where?

I'll be flying into Prishtina, Kosovo and will swiftly move south to Skopje, Macedonia, where I'll shortly thereafter be joined by Rebecca. We'll be moving around the country, and may even take a dip into Albania, if circumstances allow it.

When?

Spring / Summer 2017. The podcast will begin “broadcasting” in May. Perks to be delivered over the course of the summer (postcards sooner!). If the project's successful enough, we hope to keep the show going, far beyond the reaches of the European continent.

Why we need your help!

We need to fly from Paris to the Balkans and back, move around the area, and mostly, house and feed ourselves for the duration of the project (roughly a month), We have to purchase travel medical insurance (required to enter Macedonia). We'll also need a small amount to pay for the cost of making and shipping the rewards.

We've chosen flexible funding because we're intent on doing the project, no matter what the circumstances. There's a certain “extreme” bare minimum we need to make, but if we reach our goal, we'll be able to produce the show at a higher quality and stay in the area longer, which means we can make more episodes ! We definitely plan to do some couchsurfing, but if we raise what we need (or more!), we'll have a bit more space to do our thing!

Finally, if you're excited about the project, but don't feel you're able to contribute monetarily, we'd still greatly appreciate if you shared the page, subscribe to the podcast (it'll be free and available to all) and keep in touch! We also might be looking for collaborators down the road, so if you're interested, drop us a line!

NOTE: I already have some performance dates penciled in for the month of May in Macedonia. I will need to be there at the beginning of May. I will begin work on the podcast when I am there, and have a small amount of money to use as a cushion while the project gets off the ground. This won't last very long, but I'm so excited about the podcast that I really want to see it grow well beyond the few weeks that I alone can afford to fund it.

Risks and Challenges

Anything can go wrong while traveling. We might get sick, we could be denied entry at a border, somebody may go on strike. My first Balkan kebab may not be as fresh and delicious as I'm expecting. The same goes with technology. Cameras break, computers crash, and tiny microchips get stolen. Files get corrupted. You get the idea. It happens, though. We'll adjust. The plan is to have enough of a plan that we can always bounce back somehow.

Otherwise, rewards can get lost or damaged in the mail. (We'll send a replacement.) World wars break out and things get delayed. (We'll keep our wits about us.)

Realistically, I've never made a podcast before, so I'm sure there'll be a certain learning curve to be dealt with. In terms of narrative, I'm not sure how it's all going to work out. There may be a sad ending. Time will tell. I've never really tried crowdfunding before, so we'll see where that goes wrong soon enough!

If you have any other ideas, please write as at : "whatcouldgowrong@russianmantouristoffice.com" (not a real address but if there's popular demand, I can make something like it!).

Thanks a lot! I look forward to speaking with and podcasting for you all very soon!

Special thanks to Jason Stoneking for having a look at the page during pre-launch and also for making and giving me the "Occupy Putingrad" t-shirt worn by Russian Man in the video and photos! Thanks to Chris Ebin Halkyard for the photo with the bird puppet!

A poet, comedian, and all-around experimental performer based in Paris, Larkin most recently collaborated with Galer in “Cabaret Galer Presents : Cabaret Galer.” She particularly likes puppets and podcasts.You can find more examples of her work here : https://www.facebook.com/rebeccalarkinart Where?I'll be flying into Prishtina, Kosovo and will swiftly move south to Skopje, Macedonia, where I'll shortly thereafter be joined by Rebecca. We'll be moving around the country, and may even take a dip into Albania, if circumstances allow it.When?Spring / Summer 2017. The podcast will begin “broadcasting” in May. Perks to be delivered over the course of the summer (postcards sooner!). If the project's successful enough, we hope to keep the show going, far beyond the reaches of the European continent.Why we need your help!We need to fly from Paris to the Balkans and back, move around the area, and mostly, house and feed ourselves for the duration of the project (roughly a month), We have to purchase travel medical insurance (required to enter Macedonia). We'll also need a small amount to pay for the cost of making and shipping the rewards.We've chosen flexible funding because we're intent on doing the project, no matter what the circumstances. There's a certain “extreme” bare minimum we need to make, but if we reach our goal, we'll be able to produce the show at a higher quality and stay in the area longer, which means we can make more episodes ! We definitely plan to do some couchsurfing, but if we raise what we need (or more!), we'll have a bit more space to do our thing!Finally, if you're excited about the project, but don't feel you're able to contribute monetarily, we'd still greatly appreciate if you shared the page, subscribe to the podcast (it'll be free and available to all) and keep in touch! We also might be looking for collaborators down the road, so if you're interested, drop us a line!NOTE: I already have some performance dates penciled in for the month of May in Macedonia. I will need to be there at the beginning of May. I will begin work on the podcast when I am there, and have a small amount of money to use as a cushion while the project gets off the ground. This won't last very long, but I'm so excited about the podcast that I really want to see it grow well beyond the few weeks that I alone can afford to fund it.Risks and ChallengesAnything can go wrong while traveling. We might get sick, we could be denied entry at a border, somebody may go on strike. My first Balkan kebab may not be as fresh and delicious as I'm expecting. The same goes with technology. Cameras break, computers crash, and tiny microchips get stolen. Files get corrupted. You get the idea. It happens, though. We'll adjust. The plan is to have enough of a plan that we can always bounce back somehow.Otherwise, rewards can get lost or damaged in the mail. (We'll send a replacement.) World wars break out and things get delayed. (We'll keep our wits about us.)Realistically, I've never made a podcast before, so I'm sure there'll be a certain learning curve to be dealt with. In terms of narrative, I'm not sure how it's all going to work out. There may be a sad ending. Time will tell. I've never really tried crowdfunding before, so we'll see where that goes wrong soon enough!If you have any other ideas, please write as at : "whatcouldgowrong@russianmantouristoffice.com" (not a real address but if there's popular demand, I can make something like it!).Thanks a lot! I look forward to speaking with and podcasting for you all very soon!Special thanks to Jason Stoneking for having a look at the page during pre-launch and also for making and giving me the "Occupy Putingrad" t-shirt worn by Russian Man in the video and photos! Thanks to Chris Ebin Halkyard for the photo with the bird puppet!

story:
JOIN ME IN RAISING FUNDS FOR THE NEW PODCAST:  WHO CARES?

I have been touring the country with my book, Caring for Red:  A Daughter’s Memoir.  Which chronicles a very personal issue - caring for my father - in the last year of his life. Writing this book helped me deal with my grief, but I also began to see how universal these issues are. And how hard they are to talk about. That's why I'm doing this podcast.

 

THE PODCAST, “Who Cares?” will create:

...a community of caregivers, providers and others to help people out of isolation – with a platform for people to share their stories through the power of audio storytelling.

...6 PILOT EPISODES

The goal of this fundraiser is to raise enough money to make a pilot series of 6 EPISODES of "Who Cares?". This pilot phase is intended to LAUNCH the podcast, create a promotional package and attract sponsors to sustain the podcast long-term.

The funds will pay for studio rental, staff, a promotional video, theme music, social  media and marketing, audio transcription and basic recording equipment.

Pilot season episodes will include:

  • From book to podcast:  I will share stories from my own experience as a caregiver and give listeners a glimpse into what to expect from "Who Cares?"
  • The challenges of 24/7 caregiving:  I'll talk to two people about the joys and challenges of caring for their partners.
  • Care workers and their quality of work:  Features Ai-jen Poo, MacArthur "genius" grantee, who directs the National Domestic Workers Alliance, and Sarita Gupta, Co-Director of Caring Across Generations and Executive Director of Jobs with Justice.
  • Home care: the challenges of providing quality home care:  Features Rick Surpin, Award-winning founder of a family of organizations in New York City committed to transforming the quality of the direct care jobs and the quality of care provided to adults with physical disabilities and senior adults.

Talking with people about their caregiving experience

"Who Cares?" is designed to appeal to the thousands of people who want and need to process their grief, need support, resources and ideas for problem-solving the day-to-day world of caregiving work.

 

PERKS!!!

I welcome donations at all levels!  The perks for donating include:

  • Bookmark for Caring for Red
  • Autographed copy of Caring for Red
  • Half-hour conversation with Co-Producer re caregiving issues
  • CD from Damn Tall Buildings
  • Formal Podcast sponsorship
  • and more...

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

I would love any kind of support you can offer! Here are a few options:

  • Get the word out to your friends, family, networks and colleagues.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools! 
  • Post on social media!
  • MAKE SOME NOISE about my campaign! 

MANY THANKS! 

And finally... Big thanks go out to the following people:

Photo credit:  Filmmaker, Deirdre Fishel, who generously allowed us to use photos from her  inspiring film, "Care", on this page and in the video on this campaign page.

Promotional video:  Filmmaker Jesse Epstein who produced the video for the IndieGoGo campaign on this page, and Julia Dunlavey, Assistant Editor!

Music: Damn Tall Buildings and Sasha Fried-Snoad of Lotion Princess, who are providing theme music for "Who Cares?"

Thanks to Helen Barrington, Chief Creative Officer at Whiskey Lane Productions and co-producer of “Who Cares?"

Thanks to PRX Podcast Garage, and in particular, Alex Braunstein, who provided me with the critical basic information about podcasting and inspired me to create “Who Cares?”

Thanks to Myrna Greenfield, Good Egg Marketing, who provided consultation support around marketing the podcast.

Thanks to Ann Handley, marketing guru extraordinaire, from Marketing Professionals, who encouraged me to expand the book to a podcast and offered helpful suggestions and resources early on in my planning. 

And finally, thanks to Sociologist Wendy Simonds, who suggested the name “Who Cares?” for this podcast!

story:
BS Movies want to take their show on the road!

Hey everybody!

Thanks for taking a minute to look at our campaign. We hope you'll consider helping us out.

BS Movies is a podcast from Phoenix, Arizona. Our names are Brian and Shelly and we have been co-hosting the BS Movies podcast for a little over 2 years now. We met at a screening of The Texas Chain Saw Massacre put on by a mutual friend many years ago and instantly hit it off. We stood in the lobby talking about the film for at least a half an hour afterwards. After meeting up for movies several more times we came to the conclusion that maybe we should just record thoughts on lots of different movies and share them with everyone else. And so, the BS Movies podcast was born.

After a highly successful year of recording together the BS Movies podcast took a totally unintended turn into producing live events. We began hosting movie screenings at FilmBar Phoenix followed by a live podcast taping discussing the film. Our first live event was Friday, December 23, 2016, when we hosted a raucous midnight screening of The Texas Chain Saw Massacre with a big crowd that was clearly having as much fun as we were. We were immediately hooked!

We've since hosted more than a dozen live events in Phoenix over the last two years to standing room only crowds at various different venues. It has been a totally unexpected and wonderfully fulfilling experience. Now, we'd like to start sharing this with audiences outside of the Phoenix Metro area, to do this, we need your help!

The previous live events we have done have been largely a labor of love with other parties migrating the costs. We've never had to pay out of pocket to rent a venue, pay a distributor for the rights to a movie, or make sure there is insurance in case of some unforeseen incident. Everything has been done with handshakes and good fortune. 

That isn't exactly a business plan for expansion outside your local geographic area. Most venues are going to want signed contracts, which we totally understand. Thankfully, there is another great movie city close by with a perfect venue that has all the variables we need to have another successful live event. 

We want to host a live screening at The Loft Cinema in Tucson, Arizona. The date will vary a bit depending on availability, but we are probably looking sometime in quarter 2 of 2019. We have factored in theater rental ($800), movies rights ($200-300), online and in person ticketing  ($100) and insurance ($250) in our campaign goal.  This also allows us to test the feasibility of doing this in other cities without the added expense of plane tickets and lodging. When we are done, we simply pack up our gear and drive two hours back home. 

We have no doubt that this concept will travel well. If the Tucson screening is a success, our plan is to continue to expand to other locations across the United States. We have already started to do research on other West Coast locations for our potential options for a second road event. And since we would be taking the risk this time, a successful Tucson screening would fund our endeavors going forward. This is really just step one on our conquest for worldwide domination! 

We want  to give you value for your donation. We have all sorts of perks to provide. Would you like to attend an invitation only movie screening and podcast taping with us? Would you like a rad limited edition shirt proclaiming that you helped us get out of town? Have you ever wanted to pick the topic we talk about on the BS Movies podcast? Would you like to join us as a guest on the podcast to discuss whatever topic you would like? Have you ever wanted to see your name in light over our logo as the top billed star of the show? All of these things can be yours in return for your generosity. 

What are you waiting for? Let's get this show on the road!

story:
WHO WE ARE

The Geekiary is a website started by fans, for fans. We're proud members of our fandoms.  We're Tumblr users and Twitter experts. We're con goers, photographers, cosplayers, artists, and writers.  We're consumers and analyzers of geeky media and enthusiastic fans.  Sometimes we squee. Sometimes we rant.  Sometimes we cry about our fictional character feels.  The point is, we're fans.  We have a lot of FEELINGS.  This is where we talk about them.

For three years we've been attending conventions and conducting interviews on behalf of fans around the globe.  Our most recent major interview was with Champion skater Johnny Weir about his opinions on Yuri!! On Ice, but we've interviewed dozens of people from film, television, comics, and beyond.  We always keep our coverage fan focused, touching on topics such as feminism, LGBTQ+ and POC representation, and fan culture and transformative works.

WHAT WE NEED

Our target goal for the next two (or more) years of coverage is $500.  The cost breakdown is as follows

Basics:

  • Hosting: $10.99/month x 24 months = $263.76
  • Domain: $14.99/year x 2 years = $29.98
  • Privacy Protection: $19.98
  • Security Software: $9.99/month x24 months: $239.76*

*We were hacked two years ago and security has become necessary, but if we fall short of our goal, we will renew as much as the budget allows.

NEEDED BASE COST: $313.72
DESIRED FOR SECURITY: $553.48

Additional Costs:

  • 5% transaction fee: Up to $50 for our current goal.
  • Perks cost: $150-200* 

*Includes cost of Featured Perk & production/shipping for other perks TBA

Based on these numbers, we've set our base funding goal at $500 to cover the basics to run the campaign, but hope to make more to keep the security that's kept our website safe for the past two years.  How much longer we can keep our security going depends entirely on how much we raise beyond our goal.

PERKS

MORE PERKS COMING SOON!

*FEATURED*
Beach City Con VIP Package $200 - Two Pearl level tickets which give guaranteed panel access at Beach City Con, the first ever fan run Steven Universe convention happening October 13th-15th, 2017 in Virginia Beach.

OTHER PERKS
Twitter Shout Out

We love our supporters and want to show some of that love on Twitter.  Everyone who donates $2 or more and gives us a twitter handle will receive a personal thank you tweet!

Slash Button

It's the most important button on the keyboard. Without it, fandom would be a very different place. Show your love for all that slash with this sticker.  This perk includes a Twitter shoutout! 

Website Sponsorship

We currently list our website sponsors on our right hand side bar for supporters who give monthly for our Patreon.  We are offering a special discount for 6 months of sponsorship! Already a Patreon supporter?  Choose this perk and we'll give you special recognition across social media with this perk.

Doctor Strange Funko Pop! Doll

Funko Marvel Funko POP! Marvel Doctor Strange Exclusive Vinyl Bobble Head #173

Wolverine Funko Pop!

Marvel Collector Corps Exclusive Wolverine’s Motorcycle Funko Pop #26

Character Pencil Sketch

Our admin assistant is offering commissioned art.  Here's some of his current artwork!

Somerville Mysteries

E-Book “Somerville Mysteries” Set (3 books) by A.J. Raven.  A YA/Mystery with a bisexual male lead.  Check out the first book in the series on Amazon.  

MORE PERKS TO COME

FINAL THOUGHTS

Our domain and hosting both expire in November and we are aiming to have the funds raised by June.  If you'd like to see us continue the work we do here, please help fund us or spread the word.  Every little bit helps.  Thanks for your support.

story:
Short Summary

 

When Birdie Ludlow leaves the big city to take a teaching position in a small, strange town in the Pacific Northwest, she soon finds out that the town is being tormented by a terrifying creature and she might not make it out alive. 
 

The World of Erie Oregon

Erie Oregon is strange, full of even stranger characters. It's like Twin Peaks meets Northern Exposure. But just like Birdie, you can't help but fall in love with it. No matter how creepy.
 

Who are we?

I'm the writer and creator of Erie Oregon. A former Scholastic book kid with a love of all things spooky. 

Erie consists of 16 other amazing Los Angeles based actors and voice-over actors to include:

Birdie Ludlow voiced by Myself, Laura Mayo
Narrator voiced by William Knight
Finn Campbell voiced by Matt Musgrove
Luna Flores voiced by Nicolette Sweeney
Manny Flores voiced by Christian Maltez
Zach McCormick voiced by Kahlo De Jesus Buffington
Truman Brooks voiced by Brett Johnson
Sally voiced by Julie Ann Nesbitt
Mary Haggert voiced by Joyce Sindel
Fair Announcer voiced by Joseph Lloyd Lopez
Beverly Adolfson voiced by Maureen Kedes
Coach Mac voiced by Tony Key
Police Chief McCormick voiced by John Atkins
Kelly James voiced by Sarah Noelle
Heather Liddle voiced by Alexis Long
Amos voiced by Carson Grant
Principal Bill Decker voiced by Kelly Connell

Our crew is small but mighty:
Patrick Sexton (Our Recording Mixer) and Mike DeLay (Audio Engineer) from RealVoice LA. 
 

How we are using your money

Making a narrative, fictional podcast during a pandemic is tough and expensive. But, we don't want the world to miss out on how great Erie Oregon is. So we are here asking for your financial support.

The Breakdown:

Voice Recording Costs: $1,800
This was the cost to bring in all actors separately to record their parts during the pandemic.

Post Production & Sound Design: $8,000
$800 per episode for all of Mike and Patrick's hard work. It takes time and talent to create the world of Erie Oregon. 

Music Composition: $500
Our music composer made the most perfect theme song for Erie Oregon, and we want to make sure he gets paid. 
 
Actor's Pay: $3,400
They are bringing our Erie Oregon neighbors to life and they deserve to be paid for it. 

Website and Hosting Costs: $150
This will help cover our website and RSS hosting costs.

Platform Fees: $1,000
Indiegogo charges a 5% platform fee, as well as a credit card charging fee on each payment. This is just an estimate, anything that isn't used here will go back into our hosting costs. 

That's brings us to a grand total of $14,850. Whatever we make over this amount, we would be so grateful and would use it for production costs for season 2! 
 

What do you get?

Let's talk perks, besides bringing Erie Oregon to life.

Perks dependent on donation level:

  • Eternal Gratitude: We're just very thankful for your support!
  • Social Media Shoutout 
  • Erie Oregon Pin - to put on all of your things - maybe even some Erie Oregon Swag!
  • Signed Erie Oregon art print by the creator, writer, and director of Erie Oregon
  • Custom Character Voice Memo from someone in the cast!
  • Producer Credit - limit 15
     

Risks & Challenges

If we don't raise our flexgoal amount, we will still move forward with production. Don't worry. It will just take a little longer to produce since it's out of pocket. If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, please reach out, we're happy to help!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell others about the campaign on social media! We'll be posting about the campaign on our Facebook Page and Instagram Page. 

  • Share the campaign with your friends and family, even if they're not familiar with podcasts yet. There's always room for more fans of podcasts in the world!

  • Once we finish post and Erie Oregon is available, rate and review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Google Podcasts, etc...

  • Once Erie Oregon's website is complete, you can visit us at ErieOregon.com and purchase merch! 

Thanks so much!

I'm the writer and creator of Erie Oregon. A former Scholastic book kid with a love of all things spooky. Erie consists of 16 other amazing Los Angeles based actors and voice-over actors to include:Birdie Ludlow voiced by Myself, Laura MayoNarrator voiced by William KnightFinn Campbell voiced by Matt MusgroveLuna Flores voiced by Nicolette SweeneyManny Flores voiced by Christian MaltezZach McCormick voiced by Kahlo De Jesus BuffingtonTruman Brooks voiced by Brett JohnsonSally voiced by Julie Ann NesbittMary Haggert voiced by Joyce SindelFair Announcer voiced by Joseph Lloyd LopezBeverly Adolfson voiced by Maureen KedesCoach Mac voiced by Tony KeyPolice Chief McCormick voiced by John AtkinsKelly James voiced by Sarah NoelleHeather Liddle voiced by Alexis LongAmos voiced by Carson GrantPrincipal Bill Decker voiced by Kelly Connell
Our crew is small but mighty:Patrick Sexton (Our Recording Mixer) and Mike DeLay (Audio Engineer) from RealVoice LA.  

How we are using your money
Making a narrative, fictional podcast during a pandemic is tough and expensive. But, we don't want the world to miss out on how great Erie Oregon is. So we are here asking for your financial support.The Breakdown:Voice Recording Costs: $1,800This was the cost to bring in all actors separately to record their parts during the pandemic.
Post Production & Sound Design: $8,000$800 per episode for all of Mike and Patrick's hard work. It takes time and talent to create the world of Erie Oregon. 
Music Composition: $500Our music composer made the most perfect theme song for Erie Oregon, and we want to make sure he gets paid.  Actor's Pay: $3,400They are bringing our Erie Oregon neighbors to life and they deserve to be paid for it. Website and Hosting Costs: $150This will help cover our website and RSS hosting costs.Platform Fees: $1,000Indiegogo charges a 5% platform fee, as well as a credit card charging fee on each payment. This is just an estimate, anything that isn't used here will go back into our hosting costs. That's brings us to a grand total of $14,850. Whatever we make over this amount, we would be so grateful and would use it for production costs for season 2!  

What do you get?
Let's talk perks, besides bringing Erie Oregon to life.Perks dependent on donation level:

Eternal Gratitude: We're just very thankful for your support!
Social Media Shoutout 
Erie Oregon Pin - to put on all of your things - maybe even some Erie Oregon Swag!
Signed Erie Oregon art print by the creator, writer, and director of Erie Oregon
Custom Character Voice Memo from someone in the cast!
Producer Credit - limit 15 


Risks & Challenges
If we don't raise our flexgoal amount, we will still move forward with production. Don't worry. It will just take a little longer to produce since it's out of pocket. If you have any questions, comments, or concerns, please reach out, we're happy to help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell others about the campaign on social media! We'll be posting about the campaign on our Facebook Page and Instagram Page. 
Share the campaign with your friends and family, even if they're not familiar with podcasts yet. There's always room for more fans of podcasts in the world!
Once we finish post and Erie Oregon is available, rate and review on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Google Podcasts, etc...
Once Erie Oregon's website is complete, you can visit us at ErieOregon.com and purchase merch! 

Thanks so much!

story:
(English translation below!)

Vad är Neutral Media?

Idén till Neutral Media föddes när jag dokumenterade tolvslaget under 2016 års nyårsfirande på Möllevångstorget i Malmö. Det hela slutade med en video som snabbt blev viral och spreds över hela världen. Nationell och internationell media på både höger- och vänsterkanten använde sig av filmklippet och mina uttalanden för att publicera texter i enlighet med deras politiska agendor. Dessutom inleddes en ny debatt om att förbjuda fyrverkerier i Sverige. Det fick mig att börja fundera.

Stämningen i samhället, inom politiken, och inte minst i sociala medier och forum är idag hatfull, destruktiv och kontraproduktiv. Inte bara ur ett politiskt perspektiv, men också socialt i mellanmänskliga relationer, där polarisering, utanförskap och psykisk ohälsa blivit tydligare än någonsin. En strävan efter problemlösning, kunskap, information, förståelse och dialog mellan meningsmotståndare har länge varit min huvudsakliga inspiration till detta projekt. Läs gärna varför jag tycker att Neutral Media behövs här.

Neutral Media är en mediesatsning som till skillnad från andra kanaler, tidningar och nyhetssajter inte drivs på någon politisk eller ekonomisk grund. Neutral Media drivs ideellt och är ekonomiskt beroende av donationer. Till skillnad från andra medier publicerar inte Neutral Media några nyhetsartiklar, krönikor, ledare eller debattartiklar utan fokuserar istället på att genomföra intervjuer. Målet är att ge en ärlig bild av personen som intervjuas genom att till exempel inte försöka ”sätta dit” någon eller klippa bort delar av samtalet, men också genom att vara partipolitiskt och ideologiskt oberoende.

Genom att inte ha några begränsningar i vem som intervjuas kommer Neutral Media alltid vara en opartisk kanal. Neutral Media drivs i första hand av en stark nyfikenhet och en törst efter kunskap. Det främsta målet med Neutral Media är att försvaga vi-och-dom-mentaliteten i samhället genom att uppmuntra till samtal och att låta människor bilda sig en egen uppfattning – något som i slutändan förhoppningsvis kommer föra oss närmare varandra.

Neutral Media begränsas inte heller genom att fokusera på några speciella ämnen. Några utav dem är hursomhelst inrikes- och utrikespolitik, filosofi, kultur, religion, underhållning och samhällsfrågor. Det finns egentligen inga gränser för vem som kan intervjuas. Yttrandefriheten går inte att kompromissa med. Det är till stor del du som tittare som påverkar innehållet, exempelvis genom att tipsa om vem du tycker att vi borde intervjua och varför.

Neutral Medias löften:

1) Neutral Media kommer alltid stå för att varje individ, organisation och rörelse ska ha möjligheten att uttrycka sig utan att bli nedtystad.
2) Neutral Media kommer aldrig låta politiska partier, lobbyism eller sociala normer påverka innehållet.
3) Neutral Media kommer alltid drivas av nyfikenhet och kunskap med målet att främja individens mentala och sociala utveckling.
4) Neutral Media kommer aldrig tvinga besökare att betala för att komma åt delar ur innehållet. Vill du stödja Neutral Media kan du istället anonymt donera en slant.

- Jash Doweyko-Jurkowski

 

What is Neutral Media?

The idea for Neutral Media was born when I documented the 2016 new year's celebrations on the Möllevången square in Malmö, Sweden. It ended up with a video which quickly went viral and was spread all over the world. National and international media on both the rightwing and leftwing edges used the video clip and my statements according to their political agendas. Additionally, a new debate about making fireworks illegal in Sweden was initiated. This made me start thinking.

Today's atmosphere in society, in politics, and not least in social media and forums is hateful, destructive and counterproductive. Not only from a political perspective, but also socially in human relationships, where polarization, alienation and mental illness has become more prominent than ever. An aspiration for problem solving, knowledge, information, understanding and dialogue between opponents has been my main inspiration for this project. You can read why I think that Neutral Media is necessary here (in Swedish, use Google Translate).

Neutral Media is a media project which as opposed to other channels, newspapers, and news websites is not operated on political or economic foundations. Neutral Media is driven ideally and is financially dependent on donations. As opposed to other sites, Neutral Media is not publishing any news articles, chronicles or debate articles, but is instead focusing on conducting interviews. The goal is to give an honest representation of the interviewed person, for instance by not trying to "bust" anyone or cut parts of the conversation out, but also by being politically and ideologically independent.

By not having any limitations in who will be interviewed, Neutral Media will always be an impartial channel. Neutral Media is mainly driven by a strong curiosity and a thirst for knowledge. The main goal with Neutral Media is to weaken the we-and-them mentality in the society by encouraging conversation and by letting people form their own opinion - something which in the end, hopefully, will bring us closer to eachother.

Neutral Media is not limited by focusing on any particular subjects. Some of them, however, are domestic and foreign policy, philosophy, culture, religion, entertainment and social issues. There are really no limits for who can be interviewed. Freedom of expression cannot be compromised. To a large extent it's you as a viewer who influences the content, for instance by telling us who you think we should interview and why.

Neutral Media's promises:

1) Neutral Media will always stand for every individual's, organization's and movement's possibility to express itself without being silenced.
2) Neutral Media will never let political parties, lobbyism or social norms influence the content.
3) Neutral Media will always be driven by curiosity and knowledge with the goal of promoting the individual's mental and social development.
4) Neutral Media will never force visitors to pay for reaching parts of the content. Instead, if you want to support Neutral Media, you can donate anonymously.

- Jash Doweyko-Jurkowski

story:
WHO WE ARE

Kelly Hager is just a girl from St. Louis that was as close to dead as you can get.  Seven  years ago, she was in a coma, organs shutting down with survival being the underdog.  When she woke up she could not walk, had very little cognitive function, and could barely see.  First day out of the ICU, her husband walked in and said he wanted a divorce.  Their son was 3-years old.

The tribe of people who surrounded her were beyond amazing & instrumental in her recovery - caring for both her and her son, Brady.   Kelly faced adversity & overcame. Eventually, Kelly shared her story in small groups and big groups throughout the US and Australia.  At the end of every presentation, women flocked to her wanting to share their stories.     It occurred to her that so many women have incredible stories like Kelly's. Kelly wanted to do more.

She was determined to bring these stories to life to inspire and connect women.  To show women that they can achieve beyond their current circumstances.  So, development of a docuseries began with Kelly at the helm.  That was Feb 24, 2017. Kelly reached out to Oprah's chief of staff, Libby and Libby told her that she had worked for the amazing Oprah for 11 years and she could not be Kelly's chief of staff but she would be her conduit.

Today, Kelly has a team of about 100 people.  A small and mighty group that are filming 104 women’s stories, developing a platform of tools, resources, mentors and coaches to help women achieve fulfillment and success.

Arras is a movement of positive impact for women around the world. #arraswomen

 

 

Here is How You Can Invest!

We need your help!

  • Funding is needed to produce 104 stories, establish an online network for women, provide resources like webinars, eBooks, virtual and live networking/training events, mentoring and coaching.
  • The 104 stories is where we will start.  We will be travelling around the US, London, Haiti and Australia. The initial round of funding is extremely important to invest in the right women's stories. 
  •  

 

The Impact

When you become a supporter of Arras, you are contributing to women's lives.  You are helping to equip women with the development of new skills, build confidence through engagement and connections, as well as prepare these women for their 2nd acts. There are women who want to grow, achieve more and participate differently - BUT THEY DON'T KNOW HOW or DON'T HAVE THE RESOURCES. 

 

Arras can get them there --with your help!

 

Arras also helps break down the gender divide by preparing women in a unique way.  Through our team of mentors and coaches + the development tools we provide, women will have increased skills and confidence. 

Arras is UNIQUE!  There is no organization like this with a docuseries as a platform to bring women together and then provide them with a portal for connection and resources to equip them & empower them.

 

Our project is valuable to the world in several ways

  1. Arras is a series of documentaries that inspire AND get the women to the resources that they need.
  2. Everybody has a story. When women are vulnerable and share their stories, not only does that empower that woman but it makes them relatable to others that have similar stories. This sets the table to help women overcome their existing circumstances and plug in to achieve more. 
  3. Women want to engage.  We are seeing that in demonstrations, in communication, in research of what other women are achieving.  This is the launching pad.  This is the "how-to" playbook. This is the vehicle that can help women get from where they are today to where they want to go.
  4. There are 5 pillars.  
    1. Production
    2. Digital Enterprise
    3. Events
    4. Coaching/Mentorship
    5. Foundation

We are investing in "what is next." 

  1. How we mobilize is educating ourselves. 
    • Arras will have E-books, Mentorship, Coaching, Training Webinars and Podcasts
  2. Reaching out and connecting with people, even on days when we would rather stay home
    • Arras will have events, zoom calls and a digital connection
  3.  Believing in YOU.  Taking risks & working smarter and harder than you ever thought you could.
    • Arras will have coaching and mentorship to drive you to YOUR goals.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • We are a group of survivors.  Survivor helping survivor.  This is an authentic, genuine group of women that are making a contribution.  They are working on their second act and wanting to give back and feel fulfilled in their everyday lives. They are giving up careers.  They are walking towards a movement that is greater than themselves and some days, giving up the security of what they have known as their "everyday" is challenging.
  • The sum is greater than the parts and the goals are lofty.  The right team has been assembled and the drive for success is eminent!

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love for you to contribute to Arras and help connect women across the world.  If you are not able to do that right now - no worries.  Be part of the movement anyway!

  • Share this Campaign with friends.
  • Share your email with us so we can keep in touch.
  • Do you know a women with a story of adversity who has overcome?  Send her our way.

 

Categories of Documentary Stories 

1. Women Making an IMPACT in...Science, Technology and Innovation (6 stories/year) Examples: Women working in fields such as  a) environmental sustainability, b) renewable energy projects, c) IT and futures programs.

2. Women Making an IMPACT in....Healthcare (6 stories/year) Examples: Women working in a) aged care, b) doctors and nurses working in public hospitals, c) medical professionals treating children or  trauma, d) cancer and preventable disease research.

3. Women Making an IMPACT in....Business (6 stories/year) Examples: Successful companies that have points of difference in who they employ or what they do. Companies that emphasize good values, and where profitability and good ethics can align.

4. Women Making an IMPACT in....Their community (7 stories/year). Examples could include projects and innovations around homelessness, employment, poverty and hunger, multiculturalism. Ideas that promote a sense of community, neighborhoods, and a sense of belonging, and the importance of that for all human beings to feel involved and secure.

5. Women Making an IMPACT in....Projects Abroad (7 stories/year) Examples: Women involved in projects in developing countries, and that are directed towards the UNDP Sustainable Development Goals. i.e Gender Equality, Eradicating Extreme Poverty and Hunger, Maternal and Child Health, Eliminating Preventable Disease.

6. Women Making an IMPACT in....Arts and Music (7 stories/year) Examples: Women working in fields such as community choirs, music for the deaf programs, art exhibitions, touring arts projects such as plays and musicals.

7. Women Making an IMPACT in....Education (6 stories/year) Examples such as schools in low socio-economic, or culturally diverse neighborhoods, innovations in teaching and learning, after school and community type projects around schools.

8. Women Making an IMPACT in....Overcoming poverty and hardship (7 stories) Examples: this category can be diverse. Any stories that demonstrate resilience and overcoming adversity. Particular emphasis on tragic life events, overcoming a cultural or racial disadvantage, sexual diversity - focus on the principles of overcoming challenges, and on the importance of tolerance and inclusiveness. Any stories that demonstrate overcoming poverty and hardship, and/or helping others to overcome.

Particular emphasis on Women who have overcome adversity. Examples might include   migrant women, women who have come from poor or disadvantaged areas, and/or have suffered loss, grief, or hardship.

story:
What is this all about?

I’d often watch a film and be super excited by what I learn from it. Let’s take family movies for example. The movie may teach me to be nicer to my parents, give me a warm fuzzy feeling, and make me want to call my mother. But then I don't.

Sound familiar? Generally it’s because I don’t know where to begin.

That’s why I started this blog www.AliensClickHere.com to help readers take small steps to become better humans. The cheeky title invites our alien friends to learn about us humans. But really, it’s an invitation to reflect on ourselves, one story at a time.

Why join this movement?

My stories usually come with simple actionable items that help improve as human beings. A lot of these stories focus on equality and cultural diversity. Although a proven talent, it remains difficult to demonstrate there is a sizable market for culturally diverse stories.

This is your chance to do your part. The more supporters we have for the culturally diverse stories, the stronger the community becomes. Through my experienced storytelling, I can be the voice for your stories.

How you can help

USD $600. That’s all we need to start a minimal viable website to kick this off. Nothing flash, just a bare-bones website to host blogs, videos, audio and simple gaming.

The money will go to:

  • Website design and development.
  • Hosting and domain.
  • Indiegogo fees
  • PayPal Fees
  • Misc. admin fees

For more information about me, visit:

https://www.filmink.com.au/tez-vi-truong-whistleblower/

Why not just sign up for a free blog account?

Rather than a pure blog, this is an artistic experience dedicated to (but not limited to) diversity, inclusion, and equality. The site would be separated into four sections.

  1. Blog
  2. Video
  3. Audio
  4. Game

Each piece is accompanied by a reflective message or background to provoke thought.

If the campaign happens to go beyond the initial goal, the next milestone would be to prepare for our first video content.

The Perks

$1 contribution - Every little bit counts!

A warm and fuzzy personal thank you!

Every little bit helps!

$5 contribution – Shout out

Warm and fuzzy personal thank you!

Your lovely name will be mentioned under the first blog story. 

$10 contribution – Story preview

Warm and fuzzy personal thank you!

Your lovely name will be mentioned under the first blog story. 

A PDF sneak preview of the first blog story.

$20 contribution – Full story

Warm and fuzzy personal thank you!

Your lovely name will be mentioned under the first blog story. 

A PDF full version of the first blog story.

$25 contribution – Full story going public!

Warm and fuzzy personal thank you!

Your lovely name will be mentioned under the first blog story. 

A PDF full version of the first blog story.

A public thank you on Facebook and Twitter!

$50 contribution – I will write your story

I will interview you via email and dedicate one blog surrounding your story!

Warm and fuzzy personal thank you!

Your lovely name will be mentioned under the first blog story. 

A PDF full version of the first blog story.

A public thank you on Facebook and Twitter!

$75 contribution - Video Bio

I will interview you via Skype and dedicate one blog surrounding your story!

Ask me anything during the Skype. =)

Warm and fuzzy personal thank you!

Your lovely name will be mentioned under the first blog story. 

A PDF full version of the first blog story.

A public thank you on Facebook and Twitter!

$100+ contribution – VIP Sponsor

You'll be featured on the website as a VIP Sponsor (with links to your site or business if you want)

I will interview you via skype and dedicate one blog around your story!

Ask me anything during the Skype. =)

Warm and fuzzy personal thank you!

Your lovely name will be mentioned under the first blog story. 

A PDF full version of the first blog story.

A public thank you on Facebook and Twitter!

Note: Of course, it is up to you whether you want your name mentioned. Feel free to let me know. This is a casual and safe environment. =)

Other Ways You Can Help

We’re not only looking for quantity, but quality. Do you know anyone that would be interested in this blog? Spread the word and recommend this to them personally. Lets build a strong community. =)

What is this all about?
I’d often watch a film and be super excited by what I learn from it. Let’s take family movies for example. The movie may teach me to be nicer to my parents, give me a warm fuzzy feeling, and make me want to call my mother. But then I don't.
Sound familiar? Generally it’s because I don’t know where to begin.
That’s why I started this blog www.AliensClickHere.com to help readers take small steps to become better humans. The cheeky title invites our alien friends to learn about us humans. But really, it’s an invitation to reflect on ourselves, one story at a time.
Why join this movement?

story:
Who We Are

Treble began in fall of 2003 as a way of presenting fresh and thoughtful views on music. Though it started out as a casual group of friends posting thoughts on their favorite records, it’s evolved into something much more. 

Our mission is to cover a wide spectrum of music, ranging from electronic to punk to metal to hip-hop, with a particular focus on independent and underground artists that a lot of sites never cover. We’re also dedicated to serving a diverse community, both in the subjects we cover and the people we work with, because bigotry, racism and misogyny have no place in the future of music.

Why We Need Your Help 

It's no secret that the media industry is shrinking, especially when it comes to music sites that cover smaller artists. Some sites get bought out by larger corporations, others simply shut down. We need your help to keep us going.

What You Get

First, you’ll get to feel good about supporting independent journalism! And to prove how much we value that, every contributor will get a handwritten note from our founder on a postcard from our vintage postcard collection.

If you donate $20 or more, you get a koozie! Keep that drink as cool as your record collection!

If you donate $50 or more, you'll get an extra special t-shirt designed by Ryan Patterson of Fotocrime and Cat Magic Punks! These shirts are only going to be available for a limited time, so pledge now to make sure you don’t miss out!

And, if you donate $75 or more, you 'll get a 9x12 photographic print from a selection of images shot by Treble photographer Chad Kelco! Choose from photos High on Fire, Peter Murphy, Heilung, Daughters and Converge (one print per $75 donation).

The Impact

This campaign is about one thing: building a reserve fund to help pay our contributors. Our site is able to keep going and covering independent music because of our contributors passion and love for the music community. We want to make sure they are supported.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you're interested in recurring support, you can sign up for our Patreon. (It also includes some fun benefits!)
  • Make sure you share this fundraiser with as many people as possible!

PS: Some very kind, generous record labels have donated a few surprises as part of this campaign...be sure to revisit this page to find out more on how you can snag them!

story:
What We're Creating

No Such Thing is an independent production company, dedicated to creating and sharing new works of audio drama fiction, and the development of strange new worlds through the power of storytelling. We create stories, set in the wildest corners of the universe, to explore just what it means to be human. Primordial Deep is an ongoing adventure/thriller, set in the expanded universe of No Such Thing's first series, Janus Descending. Written by Jordan Cobb, with sound design by Julia Schifini and music by Daryl Banner, the first season of Primordial Deep will be comprised of seven (7) episodes, each approximately 45 minutes in length.

“I’m building a universe,” Cobb explains, “I’m only half joking when I say I’ve got a constellation of stories moving through my head. You can take them individually, or look at them as they fit into the whole. I want to tell stories that inspire others to tell stories – to seek out the strange and wonderful things in their worlds by letting them explore mine. Primordial Deep is the next step. It’s going to handle exploration, loss, fear, and family, and hope – what it means to be alive, and what it means to be human – the things that drive us towards adventure, and the things that pull us closer to one another. I hope all my stories do that. And, I have to admit, this story, it just feels like such a natural next step because on the one hand – I FINALLY get to write about dinosaurs. And on the other hand, I have really REALLY missed writing my sea-monster babies.”

The story begins when a long extinct sea creature washes up on the shores of Coney Island. Marine biologist Dr. Marella Morgan is contacted by a secret organization to investigate the origins of the creature’s sudden and unnatural resurgence. Soon, she and a team of experts find themselves living on the research station The Tiamat, traveling along the abyssal plains as they search for answers far below the waves. But there are dangers in these ancient waters. Reawakened, prehistoric monsters are rising from the deep -- jaws wide and waiting, and in the darkness, something is stirring. 

 

Who We Are

Jordan Cobb is the creator of Primordial Deep, as well as the voice of Dr. Marella Morgan, and Official Multiple Hat Wearer of No Such Thing Productions. As both a writer and an actress, she spends the majority of her time dreaming up new worlds, and doing everything she can to bring them to life. Now, she's poking her head out of her nest of paper and ink, with yet another story to tell, and the fervent hope that you'll join her for the adventure...

Julia Schifini is our sound designer extraordinaire, lured into crafting our wild and vivid soundscapes with promises of an ancient pirate's treasure map, and a specially reserved space on the Tiamat's life boats. Her work with No Such Thing Productions' Janus Descending was her first foray into professional sound design, and she has been recognized for her incredible work on several "Best of 2018 Podcasts" lists.

Daryl Banner is our composer, and his carefully crafted scores bring depth and color into our stories, and hang the constellations our imaginary skies. Primordial Deep is the third of Jordan's projects he has helped to set to sea, and he has been professionally composing music and writing his series of adult novels, full time since college.

 

How Can I Help? (Funding Breakdown)

We at No Such Thing Productions want to be able to provide you with stories you can carry throughout a lifetime. We're aiming high with the hopes that the better we treat our cast and crew, the better our stories will be when we give them back to you -- because these stories belong to you, our friends and dear listeners, and without you they wouldn't exist. Come join us on an adventure! With your help, we're building not just a world, but a full and vibrant universe.

So if you're wondering where exactly all this money is about to go... here's the breakdown:

 

Our primary goal is to be able to pay all of our phenomenal actors. We've got a cast of about twelve people, and we want to make sure they're fairly compensated!

Main Cast: $50 x episode = $1,950

Featured Supporting Cast: $50 x episode = $300

Ensemble actors: $15 x episode = $120

42% of this campaign will be going to all of these incredible people who help to bring this story to life! To cover our actor fees, we need to raise $2,370.

 

Next, we're setting aside funds for the people who physically knit this world together, including our:

Sound Editor: $1,500

Composer: $525

Writer/Director: $575

That's 48% or $2,600 for our tireless crew of misfits and world builders!

 

And finally, we're setting aside $530 (or 10%) to cover some of our basic production costs like hosting our RSS feed, maintaining our website, and of course, the 5% that IndieGoGo charges for hosting this campaign!

 

 

All in all, that brings us to a grand total of $5,500!

 

Stretch Goals

We're hoping against hope that we hit our goal. But if we manage to exceed it, never fear! We'll use those funds to make this world even bigger and better, by sharing EVEN MORE OF IT with you!

 

$6,000 - The Holiday Special: You like us! You REALLY like us!! If we reach our first stretch goal, we'll create a Holiday Special episode for Primordial Deep!

$7,500 - The Syndicate: Whoah, you guys are pretty serious about this show, huh? Okay. If we hit our second stretch goal, we'll create a four-part mini series for Primordial Deep, set in the headquarters of our secret organization, The Syndicate of Vis, where a young new initiative is about to uncover a secret that will set into motion a mad and desperate struggle for knowledge and power that will shake the very foundations of the ancient organization to its core.

$10,000 - The Epic: Just. Wow. Okay. Give us a second to Happy-Sob! If we reach this zenith of all stretch goals, we'll not only have enough funding for Primordial Deep, but we will ALSO be able to produce our other upcoming project Descendants, the Epic sequel to Janus Descending! We were going to give this to you anyways, but now it'll happen much MUCH sooner! To celebrate, Jordan will write a Primordial Deep novella (perhaps a spoof of a certain famous very bitey shark whose name rhymes with MAWS???) and we'll get the cast to do a series of dramatic readings!

 

What We'll Give (Rewards!)

We wouldn't be able to create the stories that we do if we didn't have such a fantastic base of supporters. To say thank you for joining our crew, we've put together some rewards for your donations! And a loooooooot of terrible prehistoric sea-creature "jokes"...

 

Xiphactinus ($5) - Like a school of fish, individually you might seem small but together you are MIGHTY! You're the heart of our community! We'll be sending you a sticker, and a thank you letter! You'll also be listed on our website, and gain access to our Exclusive IGG Discord Channels!

Eurypterid ($25) - If we had as many arms as a sea scorpion (and TRUST US, that's a lot of arms), we'd hug you with all of them! At this donation level, you get all the perks listed above, PLUS access to our exclusive prologue episode, a series of mini episodes introducing you to our main characters, and a pin!

Ammonite ($50) - We probably should have saved the hug joke for the cephalopod, huh? But that's okay, because we're coming out of our shell to say we're absolute curly-q CRAZY for you! At this level of donation you get all the perks listed above, PLUS a poster, and an invitation to our advance listening party, where you can listen to the Prologue & Pilot with our cast and crew!

Dunkleosteus ($75) - We're simply im-plac(oderm)-able about how incredibly grateful we are for your King-Sized show of support! In addition to all the perks listed above, we'll send you an exclusive t-shirt, and once the season is complete, a copy of the Primordial Deep soundtrack!

Mosasaur ($100) - We WANTED to make a joke about how we couldn't be more "plesiosaur"ed (get it? "pleased"... "plesiosaur?") that you're donating... turns out, mosasaurs are pliosaurs. So we'll just say you're an apex donor! At this donation level, you'll get all the perks listed above, PLUS an exclusive full length bonus episode on a very special message in a bottle flash drive!

Megalodon ($350) - If there was a shark as big as our love for you, it would have to be the size of a jumbo-jet and have teeth the size of a human hand! Pity we can't seem to think of any creatures that fit that description... On this very special tier, you'll have access to all digital rewards, as well as a sticker, thank you note, and a t-shirt. In addition, you'll receive our Creature's Beneath package: including a custom stuffed animal, and Marella's Creature's Beneath notebook! We'll also name a character after you and give you an official Producer Credit in every episode.

Basilosaurus ($500) - We're so excited about this whopping killer whale of a donation, we have to thank you in a whole other language! (It's okay guys, we speak whale!) Ahem... THAAAAaaaaAAAaaAaAAAANK YOOOOOooooOOOOooOuuuUUUU!!! On this very special tier, you'll have access to all the rewards on the Megalodon tier, PLUS we'll give you an Executive Producer Credit in every episode, and ad space to promote a project of your own (subject to approval) on one of our episodes!

 

Other Ways to Help

If there is anything a group of incredibly broke artists understands, it's that sometimes, even when you LOVE a project, you're not always in a position to give monetary aid. If you want to help us continue telling stories like Primordial Deep and get the word out about this campaign, PLEASE give us a shout and share this page on social media! The more people that can find us, the more likely we are to reach our goal! An even more fun way you can support us is by listening to our other show Janus Descending on RadioPublic! RadioPublic is a podcasting app that provides creators with a small advertisement-based income, so every time you listen to an episode, RadioPublic pays us a few cents, which we use to tell more stories, and so the cycle goes!

If you'd like to take another step above and beyond, you can also find and support us on Patreon and Ko-Fi! Patreon is a secure third party platform that allows you to make monthly donations of any amount to artists you'd like to support! And Ko-Fi allows you to make one-time donations to creators for the price of a cup of coffee.

 

Your support in all its forms means the world to us.

Thank you for joining us in this adventure!

We can't wait to share this story with you...

On this very special tier, you'll have access to all the rewards on the Megalodon tier, PLUS we'll give you an Executive Producer Credit in every episode, and ad space to promote a project of your own (subject to approval) on one of our episodes! Other Ways to HelpIf there is anything a group of incredibly broke artists understands, it's that sometimes, even when you LOVE a project, you're not always in a position to give monetary aid. If you want to help us continue telling stories like Primordial Deep and get the word out about this campaign, PLEASE give us a shout and share this page on social media! The more people that can find us, the more likely we are to reach our goal! An even more fun way you can support us is by listening to our other show Janus Descending on RadioPublic! RadioPublic is a podcasting app that provides creators with a small advertisement-based income, so every time you listen to an episode, RadioPublic pays us a few cents, which we use to tell more stories, and so the cycle goes!If you'd like to take another step above and beyond, you can also find and support us on Patreon and Ko-Fi! Patreon is a secure third party platform that allows you to make monthly donations of any amount to artists you'd like to support! And Ko-Fi allows you to make one-time donations to creators for the price of a cup of coffee. Your support in all its forms means the world to us.Thank you for joining us in this adventure!We can't wait to share this story with you...

story:
Short Summary

I started Unashamed & Unapologetic: The Mental Un-Health Podcast 2 years ago, interviewing friends and other guests about their personal experiences. I provide a platform for people to share their stories and for listeners to relate on their experiences with mental health. Eliminating stigma and  shame over cocktails and conversation is the aim of this podcast. 

I have had so much growth within the podcast and am now in need of better quality recording and editing equipment, in order to take production to the next level. 

The Goal

My goal is to raise at least $2000

Your contributions will go toward:

  • A new laptop- I originally started this podcast with my old Mac that I used throughout college. It's definitely served me well, but it's on it's last leg.
  • New microphones- I started off with condenser mics, which are great for starting off. Dynamic microphones, provide better sound quality and give a smoother listening experience.
  • New dope graphics for podcast MERCH! T-shirt sales have been a huge success, and I plan on creating even more podcast merchandise for listeners. 

The amount of support I have had thus far is unreal, and I am so grateful for you continued support. 

PERKS

Not only are you contributing to an amazing project, but you will receive special perks ranging from a shout out on the show, to podcast merch and a 30 min. Q&A consultation. 

The Impact

Unashamed & Unapologetic Podcast has made it possible to reach individuals around the world who struggle with shame and stigma about their mental health issues. By hearing the stories of other people who may look and sound like them, and have gone through similar experiences it sheds light to the fact that we are not alone in our experiences and don't need to be ashamed of them. By discussing such widespread issues in a casual, comedic way, it normalizes them, and shows that it is "okay to not be okay" and that you can accept yourself just the way you are, flaws and all. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, you can still be a part of the movement by  listening to the podcast on any streaming platform, liking, following and subscribing to the podcast social media pages! Rating and leaving a review on Apple Podcasts will help it move up in the charts!

story:
Overview

 

One of the major complaints we’ve seen in the audio drama community is the lack of a central database of creators and shows. Artists and listeners alike want a resource where they can find new shows, starting their search with a particular genre, creator, or show.

 

This is where we come in. The Directory of Independent Audio Drama will fill that need, providing a central resource where users can easily find the information they want. Started by two librarians, the Directory is meant to be a streamlined, easy-to-utilize website where users can explore new genres, find more shows from their favorite creators, or just scratch the itch of wondering who voiced that character.

 

However, we need your help to get this site off the ground. This campaign is intended to raise the money we need in order to get the website up and running. So if you are an audio drama creator, fan, or both, your contribution will help create a wide-ranging, thorough resource for our community.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is set at $550, which will go toward the costs of launching the site. This includes hosting, Wordpress costs, and paying a professional graphic designer. If we make the goal, that will allow us to launch the site in Fall 2018. If we don’t make the goal, the funds will still go toward the launch. However, the creation of the site might take place on a longer timeline.

 

Perks

 

1 Dollar Level

Our thanks and deep appreciation

At one dollar, you’ll be the proud owner of our eternal thanks. Your name will also appear on the Directory’s Wall of Donors once the site is live.

 

5 Dollar Level

Our public thanks and a shout out

At five dollars, you’ll receive a shout out from our official Directory Twitter account. This shoutout can also include an audio drama of your choice, whether yours or someone else’s! (So make sure you give us your Twitter handle!) This level also includes all rewards from all the previous levels.

 

10 Dollar Level

Our public, handwritten thanks

Love receiving mail? Donate ten dollars and receive a handwritten thank you note from one of the creators! This level also includes all rewards from all previous levels.

(This level requires your mailing address in order to send the letter. We'll be emailing all supporters at this level before perks go out. OR you can email it to us at indieaudiodrama@gmail.com.)

 

20 Dollar Level

Our public, handwritten, and creative thanks

Love stories? Donate twenty dollars and receive a custom piece of flash fiction written by one of the directory creators! You give us the prompt, we’ll give you 1000 words. This level also includes all rewards from all previous levels.

(This level requires your mailing address in order to send the letter. We'll be emailing all supporters at this level before perks go out. OR you can email it to us at indieaudiodrama@gmail.com.)

 

100 Dollar Level (Limit 5)

1% inspiration, 99% perspiration

One of us will work with you on a small project, parameters to be agreed upon after the campaign ends. For example, Therin will run or participate in a D&D one-shot with you and your friends (for a podcast, or just for fun). One of us will collaborate with you on a short story. One of us will write you dirty (and probably terrible) fanfiction about whatever characters you want. We'll loan you our (fairly limited) voice acting abilities for an episode of your show. We'll talk about it! The power is yours! This level also includes all rewards from all previous levels.

(This level requires your mailing address in order to send the letter. We'll be emailing all supporters at this level before perks go out. OR you can email it to us at indieaudiodrama@gmail.com.)

 

Stretch Goals

 

Should we go beyond our goal, our first stretch goal is to bank enough money to cover three years of hosting.

 

Should we reach $1100, that’s where things will get interesting. Stretch goal number 2 is the big one. If we hit double our stated goal, we’ll get back behind the mic ourselves. The Directory of Independent Audio Drama podcast will invite creators on to talk about their shows and their craft. Dive deeper into the audio dramas included in the directory!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, there are other ways you can help! Get the word out! Tweet it, Snap it, Facebook it, Email it, Tumbl (?) it! Help us spread the word!

story:
Who we are and what we are doing

THE WELL WITH ANSON MOUNT AND BRANAN EDGENS is a podcast concerned with creativity and inspiration. Guests have included scientists like Dr. Douglas Vakoch of the SETI and METI institutes, actors Eva Longoria, Doug Jones, musicians Xibit and Alice Cooper amongst many others. For season three we want to celebrate our growing audience with a special episode that explores the very foundations of human creativity and inspiration. THE WELL host Branan Edgens will spend one week in a jungle on a tropical island with noted survival coach Tom McElroy to learn how to survive using only a knife. The resulting episodes will consist of in-depth interviews with Tom combined with Branan's experience surviving in the wilderness. THE WELL currently has no advertising and no operating budget and is produced entirely out of our own pockets. We do it because we value our freedom to pursue the stories that interest us in ways we find personally compelling.  

Survival coach Tom McElroy will  be a guest on a future episode of THE WELL

What We Need & What You Get

We can not make this episode without your help so we need you to be coproducers with us! The budget for this adventure is modest and covers the cost of Tom McElroy's survival class,  round trip tickets to the tropical island, local transportation on the island itself and housing on the island.  All of this comes to $2,400. For your support you will receive our eternal thanks, the finished episodes in your podcast feed and a reward of some kind commensurate with your level of support: check out the perks section for details about signed copies of HELL ON WHEELS,  thank you post cards signed by the hosts, mugs and T-shirts or engraved coconuts! All contributors will be mentioned in the credits of the finished episode. 

The Impact

The challenge of learning to survive in the wilderness touches upon THE WELL's core mission: To explore the origins of human creativity. Your contribution to this special project lets us know you are behind us and that alone puts a lot of wind in our sails to carry us into future episodes! We are committed to digging deeper and going further to bring you perspectives you can find only on THE WELL. 

Risks & Challenges

Branan is an experienced outdoorsman having hiked portions of the Appalachian trail and achieving the rank of Eagle Scout and although he has never attempted to survive on a tropical island he hopes his Wilderness Survival merit badge will give him a leg up! Besides, Tom McElroy will be looking after him and should ensure nothing too bad happens to him. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time we understand. But you can support this project by sharing this campaign with friends and family.
