Longer, more frequent, journalistic coverage of political events; better A/V.
Better quality video & lighting during Tony & Greg's rants!
*****  This campaign will remain open after we hit the "Podcast" goal.  We'd like to raise $5,000 which would fund further expansion-- travel to more MAGA events for live coverage, bringing on more personalities (more videos) and blog articles!  *****Please include your email with your donation so we can contact you to fulfill Perks.What We Need  Here's the quick rundown:
Two microphones appropriate for a quality podcast  
Two HD webcams appropriate for a quality podcast  
Portable lighting (podcast/rants/journalism) 
"Studio" setup costs  
Dual phone holder/stabilizer  (journalism & rants)  
Camera & gear appropriate for HD video journalism in all weather  
20k mAh battery pack (rants & journalism)  
Broadcast Software License
Travel costs (events in DC, Boston, etc)
The ImpactRight now, there are millions of people brainwashed by getting all their news in the form of MSM propaganda.  We're getting the truth out there and, if you're at this page, you appreciate truth in media.  Help us expand so we can get the word out to even more people, and make the quality of the broadcasts even better for you.The more people we reach, the faster they're waking up.  We all remember when we took the Red Pill...Other Ways You Can Help Maybe you can't contribute a donation, that's fine-- you can still help!  Here's how:
Share this link on social media.  Tag friends who would appreciate the MAGA Movement.
"Like" or upvote the social media post where you found this link-- more people will have a chance to see it.
Send this link and the Uncle Tony FB/Twitter link to likeminded friends.
Post the link to the comments section of relevant articles.  Don't over-post/spam, though.
We appreciate any help you're able to give.  God Bless!

story:
Three of us. One room. Plus you.

It's a well-known part of Troublesome Terps lore that even after almost three years of doing the podcast together, we have never been in the same room together. Ever.

For a long time, we’ve been wanting to make a live podcast for and with our lovely listeners - you! So in 2018, the time has finally come to make it happen.

When: 17 November 2018, 4pm.

Where: The Roebuck in South London, a wonderful and friendly pub with deep roots in the local community. Oh, and tasty food and drinks, of course!

Why a crowdfunding campaign?

We’re glad you asked! Not all of you may be able or willing to travel to London, but you might still want to support the event and participate remotely (ugh, we know, right?) through a “video recording” perk.

So while everyone will be able to listen to the audio recording in our normal podcast feed, supporters in this tier will have exclusive access to a video recording of the live event.

Also, we simply wouldn’t be where we are without a crowd - our amazing listeners!

What do you need all that money for anyway?

Another good question we’re happy to answer! The money we are raising with this campaign will go exclusively to the event and nothing else. Your contributions will help us cover the cost of live audio gear (microphones, cables, a mixer and all that jazz), travel and accommodation (none of us is based in London) and other expenses related to making this happen.

We have chosen the flexible financing format on Indiegogo, because the event will happen no matter what. But the more financial support we get from you, the less we’ll have to pay out of our own pockets (Which is what we’re already doing to keep the podcast going, but hey, no hard feelings ?).

In the unlikely case that we have any money left in our event budget, we will decide on a good interpreting-related cause to donate it to. Of course, we will involve all supporters in that decision as well, so your money won’t be going to waste one way or the other!

What do I actually get from it?

Oh my, so many great questions! As is customary, we have created a few different “levels” of contributions, starting at just 1 € and going all the way up to 20 €. Let us break it down for you a bit:

  • The 1 € contribution is for fans of the podcast who simply want to support our live event. For the 1€ contribution, we will include a shout-out to you on our podcast website or at the end of our live recording (only if you want to, of course).
     
  • The 5 € contribution is for those folks that listen to our podcast and would like to join the London event but can’t (it’s fine, we don’t judge ?). With the 5 € contribution, you will receive an exclusive link to the video recording of the live event so that you only need to pour a cold brew and it almost feels like you were there with us! Almost
     
  • The 10 € contribution is the early-bird version of the regular ticket and will get the quickest among you entry to the venue where you can join us during the live event. You know how “Early Bird” works, don’t you? Also, we only have a very limited number of tickets available here, so be quick!
     
  • The 15 € contribution is the regular ticket. Just like with the Early Bird ticket, you will get entry to the Roebuck and joins us during the live event, you just pay 5€ more than with the Early Bird ticket (so you should really just try to get one of those Early Bird tickets ASAP, right? ?)
     
  • The 20 € contribution is the deluxe package with all the bells and whistles, no expenses spared. Not only do you get to join us live in London on the 17th, you will also get the video recording for your viewing pleasure AND some super secret Troublesome Terps merchandise to top it all off!

We know, our head is spinning too from all this amazingness!

Oh, also: This is the only way to get tickets. No tickets are sold at the door!

Risks & Challenges

You know, this is actually a pretty safe bet. The date is set, the location is booked, plane tickets have been bought and hotel reservations made and quite frankly, we’re as ready as you can possibly imagine. If - worst case and God forbid! - one of us should fall ill, the event will still go ahead and we will find another entertaining all-star panelist to step in.

Other ways you can help out

  • Spread the word about the event on social media
  • Tell your booth mates! We know interpreters love to talk after all!
  • Subscribe to our podcast.
  • Visit us on Twitter or Facebook.

story:
Who are we? What are we doing?

Hopefully you got the chance to read the overview. Here's a little more info.

The Creative Masterminds* behind Starty Pants

Sharice Davids, Host and Co-Creator

Sharice is best known for being Josh's older sister. She just returned to Kansas from a year in Washington, D.C., where she was a White House Fellow. What a time to be in DC! Prior to going to DC, Sharice was living and working on the Pine Ridge Reservation in South Dakota, home of the Oglala Lakota. Sharice is Ho-Chunk, a tribe in Wisconsin. Shout out to Pine Ridge. Before moving to Pine Ridge to work on community and economic development projects, Sharice was a l*wy*r with a big law firm doing mergers and acquisitions and financing.

Josh Herriage, Producer & Co-creator

Josh has spent most of his adult life helping people be more healthy. He has been a personal trainer and has a unique virtual training business. He has lead a number of social media campaigns for fitness businesses. Josh writes for a number of blogs and has been a guest on a number of podcasts.

*masterminds might be a bit of a stretch.

The Starty Pants Show

There have been many efforts to raise up and celebrate people from a diversity of backgrounds, black and brown people, LGBTQIA folks, and differently abled people. We want to be part of the solution to the lack of representation of diversity in the entrepreneur and start up space.

Often funders and advertisers will pass over the opportunity to invest in people who are serving a market that is geared toward women, black and brown people, non-english speaking people, LGBTQIA people and differently abled people. Starty Pants will be producing a great quality show and will be seeking funders, advertisers and sponsorship dollars but to do that we will need to have a proven track record. We have already begun production and have the first two episodes recorded. The first episode airs October 25 and we will aim to air a new episode every week. The funds generated from this campaign will be used to create more content so that we can move to a once weekly schedule. There is no lack of people to feature!

Starty Pants will be available in audio and video formats, across all the key platforms airing video and audio podcasts.

What We Need & What You Get

We set our Goal at $5,000

The reason we set our goal at $5,000 is because we want to ensure that we have enough funds to create at least 6 more episodes. Right now, our production costs for each episode averages appoximately $750. This only covers our filming and editing. After our 6th episode, our production costs will increase because we have worked out a start up deal with the production facility we are using.

We also want to be able to print a run of shirts and stickers. Which is a great segue into our perks. 

THE PERKS

  • For people who contribute $15 we will send you a Starty Pants sticker. We will have vinyl die cut stickers and you will love yours!
  • Contribute $75 and you'll receive a t-shirt and a sticker.
  • $100 will get you a special shout out on an episode plus the t-shirt and sticker.
  • $500 or more will get you a posting on our Supporters page on Startypants.biz, and all previously mentioned perks.

 

If we don't meet our goal, the funds will first be spent to obtain the first run of shirts and stickers. This will ensure the people who contributed and are eligible for that perk receive it. And then all other proceeds go directly to the production costs of future episodes.

 

The Impact

We believe Starty Pants is important and needed for a number of reasons. Representation and celebration are the two most important reasons we believe Starty Pants needs to be produced. We imagine a wide variety of people will be interested in watching or listening to Starty Pants, including people who are interested in learning about being an entrepreneur, people who are curious about business and people who don't know anyone who has started a business before.

We also want the opportunity to celebrate the hard work and interesting ideas of people who are not often celebrated by mainstream outlets. Sometimes they aren't celebrated because they don't know the right people to get in front of mainstream media or because they aren't serving a market that the mainstream outlets recognize as being important.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk Starty Pants faces is the length of time it might take to gain some traction. It can take a long time for people who are interested in the topics and ideas we are covering to find us. This means that it could take a long time before we start generating enough revenue to continue to produce content.

We are convinced that there are plenty of people out there who are tired of not seeing everyone being represented that people will not only share what we are doing here but that we will also find sponsors.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help. Here are a few of the things you can do to help!

  • Watch or listen to Starty Pants and subscribe to our channels. 
  • Encourage your friends and others in your network to support the Starty Pants Indiegogo campaign.
  • Encourage your friends to listen and subscribe to our show.
  • Send us the names and contact info, if you have it, of people you believe should be featured on our show.

story:
My name is Jim and I'm the co-host of the Bald Move Game of Thrones Podcast.  After covering TV and movies for 7 years, our podcast hit #1 on the iTunes charts.  

Riding on an overwhelming swell of gratitude, I decided to do something to celebrate Game of Thrones and the amazing community that has sprung up around it by raising money for the podcasters who help make that community what it is as well as a charity that defends the rights and equality of everyone.  

To that end, I've gathered 10 of the top Game of Thrones podcasts together to produce a special episode of their show exclusively for this project.  Introducing the Game of Thrones Charity PodPack!

The Perks:

When you purchase any MiniPack or PodPack, you're getting access to episodes produced exclusively for this project!  They have not been released anywhere else.

In addition, all episodes feature a unique and interesting concept or discussion, making them slightly different from the typical episode, though each is still Game of Thrones themed.  Hear something completely different from your favorite show with a MiniPack or check out the creativity of some unfamiliar hosts with the Full PodPack!

MiniPack #1

MiniPack #1 gets you the 3 podcasts listed below delivered via RSS feed or direct download link.

Bald Move - Game of Thrones Podcast

The Gods of Tits and Wine, Jim and A.Ron, review each week’s episode of HBO’s Game of Thrones and your feedback.

Game of Thrones w Jay, Jack & Nick

Jay, Jack, and Nick discuss the latest episode of HBO's Game of Thrones.

To Be Perfectly Honest - Game of Thrones

Our weekly dose of discussion of Games of Thrones Season 7 with a perfectly honest touch.

MiniPack #2

MiniPack #2 gets you the 3 podcasts listed below delivered via RSS feed or direct download link.

Cast of Thrones

A delightful romp through Westeros. We cover the show, the books, and the ships.

Game of Microphones

Join us each week as we go in-depth and celebrate this amazing, dark, complex show. From the makers of The Walking Dead 'Cast and Under the Comic Covers.

The Cast Beyond the Wall

The Cast Beyond the Wall is a Game of Thrones podcast dedicated to a fun pop culture laced Westeros discussion that hashes out the biggest moments from each episode. Each week hosts Caleb Masters, Daniel Stull, and Austin Lucari are joined by fellow fans and critics to have an in-depth discussion and analysis on the newest White Walker invasion, dragon attack, and incestuous backstabbing. The Cast Beyond the Wall has it all covered...WITH A VENGEANCE.

MiniPack #3

MiniPack #3 gets you the 4 podcasts listed below delivered via RSS feed or direct download link.

Pod of Thrones

Jeff & Jennifer love Game of Thrones... maybe a little too much. With two different recaps of the series-so-far (long or bite-sized) and their own on-staff Loremaster (Kevin), they take a weekly dive into the show, the headlines, the books, the games, and all manner of wild speculation. Also, Westworld is a new show worthy of discussion during the oh-so-long GoT offseason!

A STORM OF SPOILERS

A podcast covering HBO’s Game of Thrones using all spoiler knowledge from A Song of Ice and Fire, plus other pop culture landscapes during the Offseason Tour!

Game of Drones

The Game of Thrones Podcast to Help You Sleep | Game of Drones is a GoT podcast that's part bedtime story and part high school class you can't stay awake for. Don't watch "Game of Thrones", don't worry this will put you to sleep anyway. Can "Game of Thrones" help you fall asleep? Tonight it will, as I analyze episodes using progressive boredom to lull you off to dreamland.

TheVerdictsIn - Game of Thrones Podcast

Each week Nicole and Gary will do a review and discussion on the current Game of Thrones episodes. We will also take listener letters and discuss what we liked or didn't like about each episode.

Full PodPack

The Full PodPack gets you all 10 of the podcasts contained in the individual MiniPacks.

You'll be given the URL for a single, convenient RSS feed containing all 10 episodes, as well as a link to download the files directly.  You can also choose to pay more than the minimum for the PodPack by selecting either the $25, $50 or $100 booster perk.

Where the money goes:

The goal of this project is to raise money for charity and a select group of Game of Thrones podcasts .  The more money we get, the more good we can do!

Charity Portion: The bulk of the proceeds (50%) will be donated to the ACLU Foundation to support their work in areas such as free speech, privacy, racial justice, women's / disability / voting rights, etc.

Podcaster Portion:  A smaller portion (30%) will be distributed among the participating podcasters as a way of saying thank you for all the time, effort, and sacrifices they have made to entertain us over the years.  To insure each podcaster gets something, the proceeds are put into a single pool regardless of whether you purchase a MiniPack of the full PodPack.

Remaining Portion: The remaining proceeds will be split between Indiegogo (5%), Stripe (the payment processor - 5%) and Bald Move (10%) to cover the costs of organizing the project, hosting / delivering the files, and supporting the backers.  Bald Move will not be taking a cut of the Podcaster Portion.

Want to do more?

Whether you're unable to contribute monetarily or just feel that you could do more, please help spread the word about the Game of Thrones Charity PodPack!

  • If you have a podcast, tell your listeners about the PodPack or recommend they check out some of the shows involved.
  • Use the Indiegogo social sharing tools to help get the word out to your followers.

Use the Indiegogo social sharing tools to help get the word out to your followers.

story:
Summary

Hi! I'm Katie, I'm 39 and I'm having a midlife crisis! Up until now I've been kind of floating through life, I've had some good adventures, but they've kind of happened to me, rather than me making them happen. Now I'm trying to create an adventure! 
My goal is to create a manual for myself and others to navigate these weird life transitions we all have to face. I'll be doing that in three ways:

1. A blog, where I reflect on what it is I'm thinking, feeling, learning and doing.

2. A YouTube channel where I can create a visual collage of what I'm learning, doing, where I'm traveling, and how I'm traveling. 

3. The most ambitious part of this project: a book, based on structured conversations with other people. My current thought on this is that it will be a way to document how others deal with life transitions, relationships, growth and change. It will likely evolve with time, but I want to know what strategies people employ in their every day lives to get along.

What We Need & What You Get

I need some help to kick this off. I can do it on my own, but with a little extra backing I could really get this up and running! This campaign is designed to help me get my first trip under my belt. Here's what I'd like to use the money I get from this for:

  • Campground fees
  • Gas
  • Activities
  • National Park Entrance Fees
  • Compensation for the hours I'm missing work

What will you get in return? Well that depends on your level of donation but here's some of what I have in mind.

  • Credit on videos and a dedicated page on my website
  • Your name read at the end of my videos
  • Photos and videos not released to the public at large
  • Your choice of a framed print of a good photo from this first trip
  • A photo book of the best images from my trip
  • My undying love

The Impact

I'll be honest, taking on this trip on my own, while doable, is going to mean a lot of Top Ramen for me, but with a little help this trip will be a lot more comfortable for Monroe and for myself. I'll be able to breathe a little easier, but also it will enable me to make the content so much better, by allowing us to do more, explore more, and meet more people. 
Beyond that your support will mean that you also think this isn't the worst idea in the world. I strongly believe it's worth talking to people about how they move in life, and how they see the world.

Risks & Challenges

Listen, there are so many risks and challenges it'll be impossible to list them all. The main challenge for me in this project is keeping my motivation and consistency high.  One thing I've learned about myself over the last year is, that I thrive on keeping myself accountable to a community. I want you to hold me accountable for making this project kick-ass.

Other Ways You Can Help

The biggest thing you can do to help me? Check in on this project periodically, check out the YouTube channel and blog www.katiefiguresitout.com. Beyond that though?

Share this campaign with your friends on social media!

story:
Help Us Educate the World About the Uses of Hemp

This summer, award-winning Hemp Podcast producer Eric Hurlock is taking the show on the road to give national attention to the hemp industry, farmers, and hemp's endless eco-friendly uses. He’s loading up the RV and embarking on a cross-country hemp fiber and grain tour of farms, processors, and manufacturers from North Carolina, Kentucky, Colorado, Montana and beyond. 

Eric will create compelling content every step of the way including videos, podcast interviews, print/digital articles, social media posts & more.

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $3000 for fuel costs, tolls and RV camp stops. Every dollar will go into this educational initiative. If we reach over our goal, the funds raised will go to a non-profit supporting the hemp industry. Depending on the amount you give when you back the tour, you can also have your name or business you represent listed each week in the Hemp Tour update section of our weekly newspaper, Lancaster Farming, a mention in a Hemp Tour podcast episode and a 1 year subscription to Lancaster Farming Newspaper!

The Many Uses of Hemp

In December of 2018, the 2018 Farm Bill was signed into law. It removed hemp from the definition of marijuana in the Controlled Substances Act (CSA) making it federally legal to grow in the U.S. Since then, farmers across America have be relying on the crop to support their families and helped to create more eco-friendly alternatives to many products you use every day.

When talking about hemp currently, the mainstream media generally focuses on the biggest boom from the 2018 Farm Bill thus far, CBD and its medicinal uses but the future of hemp is goes far beyond than that.

Here are some examples of what hemp can be used for:

  • Biofuel for vehicles
  • Building material (concrete, insulation, plaster, ropes wood, varnishes)
  • Biodegradable plastics
  • Livestock feed and bedding
  • Protein-rich food and healthy oils 
  • Paper
  • Textiles
  • Fiber

The list doesn't end here!

Is Your Business in the Hemp Industry? Become a Hemp Tour Sponsor!

If you are in the hemp industry or your company is connected to the hemp industry, you can become an official sponsor of the tour. Align yourself with our initiative while marketing your business at discounted rates! Click here to see our sponsorship packages.

story:
Why Get a Booth?

Theology of Games has brought (in our opinion) great quality content to the gaming industry for nearly 6 years, however quality content is just the beginning of finding success as a content creator:

  • Not familiar with Theology of Games? Check us out at TheologyofGames.com. We publish written articles on the boardgaming industry; news, reviews, and interviews. We also produce three (yes, THREE!) podcasts: The Theology of Games Podcast (monthly), That's How I Roll (weekly) and Boardgames FM (DAILY!). And we recently rebooted our YouTube Channel with our Take-Two Reviews!
  • Our campaign on Indiegogo is a launching point for us to go from hobby to profession. Having a physical presence at one of the largest conventions in North America not only helps us strengthen our relationship with our loyal fanbase, but an opportunity to connect with thousands of potential new fans. The funds raised here will be used to defray the costs of: booth registration fees, booth displays, hotel accommodations for booth workers, written promotional materials, onsite advertisement, new gear to help us live stream via Facebook, YouTube and more, contest prizes and more!

Suffice to say, we have big plans for Origins 2018, and we simply can't achieve these goals without you!

What We Need & What You Get

We're not only appealing to our fans, friends, and family but to our existing friends within the gaming community:

  • We're look to raise $3,000 to pull this off the way we envision it.
  • The break down of our costs goes something like this:
  • We've secured an entrepreneurial booth registration for $450
  • A room for us to stay in will be approx. $1,000
  • Booth decor (still gathering quotes) approx. $400
  • Promotional materials (Stickers, flyers, handouts, T-Shirts, etc.) approx. $500
  • If we go over our set goal we are looking into some new gear to help us live stream from the exhibit hall floor.
  • For personal backers we have some great TOG branded rewards
  • We've already registered for our booth! This is happening whether we hit our goal for funding or not, Your support helps us have a great and successful convention and produce quality content while we're there!

 

Risks & Challenges

  • As always with crowdfunding campaigns it's easy to question what your money will be used for, we hope we've been honest and upfront with you in our description and with the rewards we're offering.
  • The biggest challenge will be if we way under fund. We have to book a hotel, order booth gear, etc. While every dollar helps, if we don't hit our goal we'll have to do a bit of scrambling to make things happen at the level we aspire to.
  • As we said in our video, we aren't going anywhere, we've got our booth space, and we'll be at Origins. The level of funding we raise through our campaign will determine (to some degree) how well we are able to execute our plans for Origins!

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally get it! Not all of you can toss a coin in the cup, no pressure! But if you want to help us there are plenty of ways to do that:

  • Social media, social media, social media! Your "likes" and "shares" and posts about our campaign help us go viral, and deliver the message to folks who might be interested in helping out.
  • If you scroll up there are a ton of buttons to click to help spread the word!
  • Continue reading our blog, watching our videos, and listening to our podcasts! The more we keep our numbers up the easier we are to find, which again helps folks who might want to help out.

Thanks SO much for taking the time to review our campaign, and for any support you can offer in any form!

story:
The Sustainable Baker

The Sustainable Baker podcast is coming to Spotify and Apple Podcasts this fall to explore baking in the era of climate crisis!

The host

I’m Caroline Saunders. I'm producing this podcast because I wanted to know: will dessert survive climate change?! Baking touches esoteric dessert and daily bread alike. So through the lens of baking, we can learn a lot about climate impacts on food security and food culture. I've worked in climate news for five years, and I'm the co-author of a book called Craft Beef. This fall, I'm moving to Paris to train in pastry at Le Cordon Bleu.

The season

The Sustainable Baker will tackle the questions you didn't know you needed to ask, like...

  • Just how at-risk are the ingredients we bake with?
  • Will cake as we know it go the way of the Dodo bird and the Greenland ice sheet?
  • What adaptations are underway to help all the things we bake survive the climate crisis?

 

The Sustainable Baker is also a mini audio cookbook for the next, hotter stage of life on earth. Each episode will have accompanying recipes posted to sustainablebaker.com.

 

My work so far, and how you can help

I've been working on this podcast for a year! I've concepted, researched, interviewed 25 amazing bakers, climate experts, plant breeders, and pastry chefs. I've written. I've re-written. I've edited, I've fact-checked. I've tested recipes, and developed new ones! I've produced 4 episodes...3 to go!

My production costs are $4,500, and I've already raised $2,000 this summer. I would love your help getting the rest of the way there!

 

PERKS

  • $10 — Enter the Sustainable Baker Hall of Fame. You’ll be acknowledged as a member of the community who brought this podcast to life on sustainablebaker.com

  • $20 — Enter the Sustainable Baker Hall of Fame. You’ll be acknowledged as a member of the community who brought this podcast to life on sustainablebaker.com

  • $50 — Get early access to a sustainable baking recipe from the season from a professional baker

  • $100 — Receive an embargoed advance copy of an episode transcript and accompanying reading list

  • $250 — I’ll send you a private link to listen to an episode before it’s out

  • $500 — Receive a cookbook from my collection that’s discussed on the series!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help make some noise about my campaign! Share it on social, or email it to your friends who love to bake or care about climate change. 

  • When the show comes out, tell your friends to listen! <3 <3

story:
Short Summary

Through Objects is an online platform based on the communication of design objects. A curated selection of new products of design, their analysis and current trends identified via trendsobserver.com (digital platform of trends and innovation).

The Problem

What’re the main questions and trends underlying design objects? Why are these questions relevant to the current world and consumers? Do they reflect any reaction to current cultural and behavior trends? These are the type of questions that we want to answer with the designers’ collaboration.

Solution

We will try to tell you how society is living and which solutions product designers are thinking about in order to respond to these needs. For this, we will add top contributors from different countries creating interesting articles to our online publication while producing relevant insights to our future E-books.

Who we are

This project was created by Rita Trindade in 2016 as a final project of a post-graduation at college of Letters – University of Lisbon. Along with trendsobserver.com (Scientific Trends investigation group of University of Lisbon), this project relates the trends identified by trendsobserver.com to new projects and objects of designers at a global level. Until now, through-objects.com had more than 40,000 page views, mostly from United States, Portugal, Germany, France and Denmark.

Our objective

Our objective is now to provide more valuable content from different collaborators around the world, as well as exclusive trend reports and articles to our subscribers. To achieve this goal we'll have to be sure we can fairly pay to our talented contributors, in order to provide an exceptional quality content on our platform.

It is our ambition to keep on improving our content quality, while providing a deep storytelling experience exploring rational and emotional connections we all have with the design objects.

Our main goal would allow us to post:

- 20 online pieces of journalism about design stories from our contributors,

- 6 E-Books produced with the collaboration of different contributors, addressing specific design issues, design stories and relevant experiences from designers to our community.

Join us

With our crowdfunding our team will create more three to six months of compelling stories and E-books with exclusive interviews and professional’s opinion about the future of design. With your help we will work hard to communicate you the best of design, as well as the most meaningful stories.

story:
Summary

My name is Rein and I do voicework - most notably audiobook production.  If you're here it's probably because you're familiar with my current ongoing project, Parahuman Audio.

Over the years many people have approached me looking for ways to donate to or support me in the creation of the various works I am involved in.  Most notably is the creation of the unofficial audiobooks for the web serials Worm and Ward by J.C. McCrae.  You can listen to the former here and the latter here.  As part of the author's policy on derivative works I am unable to make money on those productions so I've always had to turn down prospective contributions and any other forms of revenue.  I have also been involved with other works such as the Metropolitan Man audiobook and Project STELLAR, a couple indie games, as well as various random things.

After some thought and deliberation I've determined an avenue for people to contribute that they can directly benefit from and will not cause problems with the original author: funding real audio equipment to improve sound quality going forward.

 

So why am I doing this? 

Well, audio equipment is expensive and my current setup (BLUE Yeti USB) works fine but has some issues both technically and with quality (watch the video to hear the difference a better mic can make!).  Better equipment would be a great boon to my work, but for something that I don't get paid for it's hard to justify the expense.

 

What I Need

With these funds I will be acquiring the following items:

  • Microphone: Shure SM7B ($399)
  • Interface/Preamp: Focusrite Scarlett 2i2 Studio (2nd Gen) with XLR cable and studio monitors ($249.99)
  • Acoustic Panels ($23.50)

Total cost: $672.49 + tax

Assuming the full $700 is funded I'll actually only end up getting $644 after Indiegogo has taken their cut, but I'm fine with handling whatever the difference is.

In the unlikely event that the project gets over-funded then the remainder will go toward hosting costs for the Worm Audiobook project and Parahuman Audio sites.

 

What You Get

What, you mean you don't just care about improving the quality of my work that you've listened to for free for years?  Well alright then - may I interest you in some bespoke recordings that vary in length depending on how much you contribute?

Each tier offers the same service with the only thing different being how much of it you get.  I will send you a fully edited recording of whatever your heart desires up to the length specified in your contribution.  Seriously, I'll record whatever you want however you want it.  Rap battles, a portion of your favorite book, the speech from Independence Day, poorly written fanfiction, etc.  I'm sure you can think of something outrageous that I could never imagine, and that's (probably) okay too!

You will also get access to the Parahuman Audio Discord server where you can chat with me and the editors.

Some things to note:

  • I reserve the right to turn down any request.  I'm incredibly difficult to offend and have practically no shame, but I won't do anything that I think might be used for harm (like recording a ransom note) or something that might get me in trouble.
  • I will work with you to make sure your recording is just what you want.  This will include a few retakes if necessary.
  • The recordings will be done on the new equipment unless you specify that you want it sooner, which means it will be on the Yeti.
  • Let me know if you have a time limit (like a birthday or something) on your recording so I can try to prioritize it.
  • You will have ownership of whatever recording I create for you.  If I really like it I may ask you to let me put it on my soundcloud or something.
  • If this campaign doesn't reach its goal then I will still be acquiring this equipment, however depending on how short we get it may take longer than I would like.

 

Risks & Challenges

The only real risk here is that we don't make it anywhere near the goal.  In that case I will still buy all the equipment, but it will likely take me longer than anticipated to buy all of it (probably not until shortly after the new year).

On the other end of the spectrum, if this somehow gets thousands of backers (doubtful) then fulfilling everyone's custom recordings will take me a while.  I'll still get to all of them, but depending on how much work goes into each it will probably take some time.  Unless you have a critical need I plan on fulfilling requests in the order they were received.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing this campaign with other people would be great, but even better would be sharing the Worm and Ward Audiobook projects with everyone you know.  At the very least I ask that you please support J.C. McCrae (Wildbow) in his efforts to create the wonderful stories that started all of this.

Thank you, and enjoy  :)

Over the years many people have approached me looking for ways to donate to or support me in the creation of the various works I am involved in.  Most notably is the creation of the unofficial audiobooks for the web serials Worm and Ward by J.C. McCrae.  You can listen to the former here and the latter here.  As part of the author's policy on derivative works I am unable to make money on those productions so I've always had to turn down prospective contributions and any other forms of revenue.  I have also been involved with other works such as the Metropolitan Man audiobook and Project STELLAR, a couple indie games, as well as various random things.
After some thought and deliberation I've determined an avenue for people to contribute that they can directly benefit from and will not cause problems with the original author: funding real audio equipment to improve sound quality going forward.
 
So why am I doing this? 
Well, audio equipment is expensive and my current setup (BLUE Yeti USB) works fine but has some issues both technically and with quality (watch the video to hear the difference a better mic can make!).  Better equipment would be a great boon to my work, but for something that I don't get paid for it's hard to justify the expense.
 
What I Need
With these funds I will be acquiring the following items:

Microphone: Shure SM7B ($399)
Interface/Preamp: Focusrite Scarlett 2i2 Studio (2nd Gen) with XLR cable and studio monitors ($249.99)
Acoustic Panels ($23.50)

Total cost: $672.49 + tax
Assuming the full $700 is funded I'll actually only end up getting $644 after Indiegogo has taken their cut, but I'm fine with handling whatever the difference is.
In the unlikely event that the project gets over-funded then the remainder will go toward hosting costs for the Worm Audiobook project and Parahuman Audio sites.
 
What You Get
What, you mean you don't just care about improving the quality of my work that you've listened to for free for years?  Well alright then - may I interest you in some bespoke recordings that vary in length depending on how much you contribute?
Each tier offers the same service with the only thing different being how much of it you get.  I will send you a fully edited recording of whatever your heart desires up to the length specified in your contribution.  Seriously, I'll record whatever you want however you want it.  Rap battles, a portion of your favorite book, the speech from Independence Day, poorly written fanfiction, etc.  I'm sure you can think of something outrageous that I could never imagine, and that's (probably) okay too!
You will also get access to the Parahuman Audio Discord server where you can chat with me and the editors.
Some things to note:

I reserve the right to turn down any request.  I'm incredibly difficult to offend and have practically no shame, but I won't do anything that I think might be used for harm (like recording a ransom note) or something that might get me in trouble.
I will work with you to make sure your recording is just what you want.  This will include a few retakes if necessary.
The recordings will be done on the new equipment unless you specify that you want it sooner, which means it will be on the Yeti.
Let me know if you have a time limit (like a birthday or something) on your recording so I can try to prioritize it.
You will have ownership of whatever recording I create for you.  If I really like it I may ask you to let me put it on my soundcloud or something.
If this campaign doesn't reach its goal then I will still be acquiring this equipment, however depending on how short we get it may take longer than I would like.

 
Risks & Challenges
The only real risk here is that we don't make it anywhere near the goal.  In that case I will still buy all the equipment, but it will likely take me longer than anticipated to buy all of it (probably not until shortly after the new year).
On the other end of the spectrum, if this somehow gets thousands of backers (doubtful) then fulfilling everyone's custom recordings will take me a while.  I'll still get to all of them, but depending on how much work goes into each it will probably take some time.  Unless you have a critical need I plan on fulfilling requests in the order they were received.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Sharing this campaign with other people would be great, but even better would be sharing the Worm and Ward Audiobook projects with everyone you know.  At the very least I ask that you please support J.C. McCrae (Wildbow) in his efforts to create the wonderful stories that started all of this.
Thank you, and enjoy  :)

story:
Short Summary

Aries Lounge started as a radio show in February 2007 with no direction or purpose. After 12 years the creator & host JS-1 Tha Supplier finally found a direction for the show that fit our style and skill set.   

New Mission:

  • Informing our viewer base about our entertainment culture.
  • Educating artists about how the entertainment business works
  • Exposing new music, films and technology to our viewers.

Aries Lounge will become a live TV show with call in number, active chatroom and much more. We are raising funds to purchase the necessary equipment & resources to execute the show.

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need:

  • 2 new commercial level Camera's for long form broadcasting.
  • 2 PC's with high processing speed to streaming & handle broadcast software.
  • New Studio Lights
  • 1 Additional Microphone
  • Rental Space for Interviews & Live Shows
  • Merch for Supporters
  • Step & Repeat and banners.
  • Cables, SD cards, storage drives and other necessary hardware.
  • Website established just for the show 

What do you get:

  • 2 Weekly Shows minimum Starting April 2020
  • New custom merch for those who donation on the appropriate levels.
  • Better visuals of hosts & guests with true Hi Definition Cameras
  • The show will be live with the ability to chat or call in.
  • More Audio Adventures regularly from our podcast channel.
  • More celebrities will be coming on for you to see & interact with live.
  • Documentaries about Baltimore entertainment history, artist doc's & more.
  • The ability to have artist music played live during the show & get live reviews.
  • Ability to have the audience experience music live as a collective and share opinions.
  • The ability to build a more cohesive community with a passion for music, art and baltimore.

 

The Impact

This fundraiser sets the tone for the entire second phase in the life of JS-1 & Aries Lounge. We have always been under funded, short on equipment and short on resources.  This fundraiser will allow us to give you the artists, businesses, family, friends and fans the opportunity to empower us to reach the goals we have set for ourselves & empower others around us to create ground breaking content. We will be able to bring more to light more of Baltimore's history, more professional shows, more professional visuals and more compelling content you want to see!! 

Jamal Smith aka JS-1 Tha Supplier has created a number of successful platforms that have reached huge groups of people and have impact 1,000's of lives! Here just a few projects we have raised money for and had great success:

1) The Media Impact Awards 2019: The awards ceremony created to celebrate local media in Baltimore both major and independent. We brought out 294 attendee's. (Impact Awards 2020 coming soon)

2) VVCRadio.com: created in 2007 with no money and grew into a major local platform in Baltimore between 2014-2018. (it is now in dormant until we can find new investment.)

3) VVCLife Magazine: created in 2014 we have released 4 magazines each distributing 1,000's of physical copies throughout Baltimore for free with the help of Advertisers & supporters.

4) Baltimore Entertainment Book: We created this resource guide to give people an easy to read book proving media platforms and their contact inform. We also highlighted local business in Baltimore. We printed over 1,000 physical books and a free digital book for people to use as a resource.

Jamal & the Aries Lounge/ VVC team have been dedicated to creating fun, informative, impactful content and products for over a decade. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The challenges we face are simple. We don't have any major corporate sponsorship, nor do we have mega stars promoting our platform. So with out the support of our friends, supporters, artists and business relationships we won't be able to provide the type of content everyone wants to see us do. We also slow down our ability to shoot the documentaries we are working on and side projects we have planned to release via our social media and youtube channel. 

Lastly Jamal has been funding everything for all these platforms since the beginning. At 40 years old, he can't afford to keep spending money on it. He has family to take care of and personal needs he must fund with his own money. So we ask for your support help take this project to the next level.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Send the link out to Artists who want album reviews or interviews
  • Subscribe to our youtube channel "vvclife" and watch our current content, share and comment on all the videos.
  • Follow us on social media, like media and help us promote our cause.
  • The biggest support you can give is citizism and ideas to help us do our best!! We always encourage our base to speak up so we can give our viewers what they want.

And that's all there is to it!! We hope we have your support!!

story:
Upgrade of Podcast Gear

How Are Ya Now?

We at the PodScure network/podcast as well as the How Are Ya Now? Letterkenny podcast are looking to provide better content.  The PodScure network has been around for a little over a year and a half now and works with other unique/obscure/independent podcasters to help get them more recognition.  The How Are Ya Now? podcast helps serve and WELL underserved fan community of the Letterkenny TV show.  We also want to have the ability to expand into different areas for underserved/needed podcast content.

We are extremely passionate about all of our projects and could really use your help to upgrade our gear as much as possible.

This allows for:

  • More efficient recording
  • Equal levels of sound by having the same microphones
  • Dynamic content while recording
  • Quicker editing and mastering of sound files
  • Convenience of connection from remote guests

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the nuts and bolts of what we're looking to do:

  • We're looking to secure at least $1500 to procure the gear that would allow us to, at a minimum, hit our needs.  Anything beyond will only make things that much better.  All the money we get will go directly into the podcasts.
  • The perks we will offer includes:
    • Show swag (stickers, t-shirts, cups, hats, etc...)
    • Coffee
    • Shout-outs on our shows
    • Personalized Q&A/chat sessions made just for/with you
    • First access to celebrity interviews (How Are Ya Now? podcast)
  • If we're unable to reach our goal, we will graciously accept whatever is given and upgrade as much as we can.

The Impact

Again, we feel that reaching out and getting recognition for these underserved areas of podcasting will bring both happiness and encouragement to the  folks who are in those groups.

  • Independent podcasters will gain a wider audience by us providing a higher quality of content.
  • In turn that will encourage them to continue their own passion podcasting projects.
  • The increase in quality will also make it easier to increase the How Are Ya Now? podcast audience who, at this point, have nowhere else to turn for the type of content we provide.

Risks & Challenges

Independent podcasts like ours have no corporate backing and are all funded by ourselves or the kindness of folks like you who are willing to give to see the community grow and flourish.

  • We are deeply tied into the independent podcasing community and have a large number of podcasts who see our show to help get their message out.  These upgrades allow this to happen more frequently by allowing a quicker turnaround of content.
  • Once we have these upgrades in place, we will have an immediate impact allowing for lots of happy and encouraged folks.  And that's what we really need.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you're unable to contribute monetarily, we totally understand.  Please share this campaign with anyone else you feel could help.  Spreading the love is always good.
  • Also, please remember:  use the Indiegogo share tools!

We thank you for your consideration and hope that you feel we can provide a value to our community by your contribution.

story:
Thanks to all of our amazing backers we've reached our initial $15,000 goal! 

But with your help there is still more that we can do!

 

 

This American Kid has big dreams of taking the show on the road. Help us reach our "stretch goal" of $20,000! With $20,000 we could invest in a mobile studio. All of the episodes are currently recorded from our kitchen table. Having a mobile studio would give us the opportunity to do more on-site interviews (both near and far from our home in Texas) and have kid co-hosts join Milo behind the Mic! 

Help Milo reach his stretch goal and take his show on the road. Donate and tell your friends and family! The campaign ends 12/31

 

This American Kid is a family-friendly podcast, hosted by six-year-old Milo Flake. Milo is an avid podcast listener and approached his parents with the idea of hosting a show of his own. The podcast was launched in August 2017 and is wrapping up its first season. Milo has been able to interview some amazing guests. Nearly every one of them is pursuing a passion that started in their childhood, and by following their dreams they are making the world a better place. 

 

What We Need

We are producing the podcast on a shoestring budget with a computer that is older than our host. We will use the funds raised in this campaign for production costs, hardware and software improvements, hosting fees, and marketing (we want to reach as many listeners as possible!) We are confident that with these resources we can produce a quality second season of This American Kid.  This is your opportunity to be a part of the journey and help bring Milo's dream to life.  

Why Your Support Counts  

Our podcast is a labor of love, brought together by a kid and parent team. We created This American Kid because we saw Milo’s passion for interviewing and learning from others. We wanted him to know that his dreams matter and that he can achieve his goals.

We believe that by sharing his interviews other children can learn and come to know that their dreams matter and that they can make a difference for good, when they work hard.

With our limited resources, we've been able to make a lot of episodes that we're really proud of - but we can do a lot more! Your support will give us the resources we need to create another season, full of quality and engaging episodes. 

 

The Impact

We hope to share a message that not only sparks curiosity, but empowers kids and helps them to believe in themselves. We strive to provide content that the entire family can (and will want to) listen to together. The next generation is full of great potential, but now more than ever, kids need some one to look up to. This American Kid is an opportunity to introduce kids to role models who inspire them to follow their dreams.  

Here is a look at some of Milo's guests: 

 

Milo has recorded nine episodes, seven of which are now available on iTunes and Stitcher radio. Season 1 will have ten episodes and will conclude by the end of 2017. 

 

 

What our listeners are saying: 

Pretty Awesome American Kid 

"Milo makes me smile. He is such a bright and curious kid and this plays to his advantage. I love that he thinks hard about the questions he asks and is genuine in his responses. I love that he is not only following his dreams, but inspiring others to do the same. Great Job Milo! You are a pretty awesome American kid!"  -adcamhan, via iTunes

Best Podcast for Kids!!!

"My kids and I loved listening to Milo's first episode! He asks such great questions during his interview and he is so fun to listen to! We can't wait to hear more!" -toriprice, via iTunes

Excellent Family Podcast

"Equally engaging for adults and the keikis, looking forward to more!" -ianpatton, via iTunes

 

 

Meet Our Team 

Milo Flake - Creator and Host of This American Kid. 

Milo is in first grade. He loves baseball, NBC's "American Ninja Warrior", reading, and LEGOs. Although he is only six, Milo is very involved with the creation of the show. With the help of his parents, he selects guests, researches their work, writes interview questions, and hosts the show. 

Jordan Flake - This American Dad 

Jordan contacts potential interviewees, produces, and edits the interviews. Jordan also works full-time in manufacturing management. 

Meagan Flake - This American Mom 

Stay-at-Home Mom by day, This American Kid Social Media Manager by night. 

Luca Flake - This American Little Brother

Luca is 3-years-old and the #1 fan ofThis American Kid. His adorable laughs and jokes are often featured in the "Funny Face Minute" segment of the show. 

 

Timeline

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How can I listen to This American Kid? 

A: The podcast is available on iTunes and Stitcher Radio. The most recent episode is also available on Milo's website www.thisamericankid.com.

Q: How can I contact you? 

A: You can e-mail us at hello@thisamericankid.com

Q: How do find your podcast guests? 

A: We had a brainstorming session and Milo created a long list of dream guests. It ranges from major celebrities to friends who are doing really cool things! For those individuals we don't know personally, we've reached out through social media. We've been blown away by the kindness of our guests. 

Q: Milo always asks his guests their favorite book, What is Milo's favorite book? 

A: Milo LOVES to read! Lately his favorites are "The William Hoy Story" and "Manjhi Moves a Mountain" both by Nancy Churnin (Interviewed on Episode 1) and the Magic Tree House series by Mary Pope Osborne. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you aren’t in a position to donate, that’s okay! -you can still help! Our #1 goal is to reach as many kids as possible. Spread the word about our campaign and podcast. You can subscribe to This American Kid on iTunes or Stitcher Radio (it’s free!) ... and if you love it, leave us a review!

 

            

Follow us on social media to stay up to date with all of our campaign and podcast news #thisamericankid

 

Milo is an "Imagine If, With Jif," Finalist!

Jif® Peanut Butter knows there is potential and optimism to be found in small things—moments and ideas that, one by one, reinforce our belief in ourselves and in the possibilities that lie ahead. That’s why this year, Jif Peanut Butter is helping spread a little more love in the world through the “Imagine If, With Jif” program to help fuel and nourish the potential of the next generation.

Jif in partnership with Indiegogo, has funded three kids’ positive and impactful entrepreneurial ideas to build a better future for all including Milo. Milo received $10K from Jif to kick start his official crowdfunding pages in November. Jif congratulates Milo on making his big dreams for a better world come true!

In January 2018, Jif will award one grand prize winner with the most successful and impactful crowdfunding project an additional $20K to help make their idea a reality. More information at Jif.com/Imagine-If.

Spread the word about our campaign and podcast. You can subscribe to This American Kid on iTunes or Stitcher Radio (it’s free!) ... and if you love it, leave us a review!             Follow us on social media to stay up to date with all of our campaign and podcast news #thisamericankid Milo is an "Imagine If, With Jif," Finalist!Jif® Peanut Butter knows there is potential and optimism to be found in small things—moments and ideas that, one by one, reinforce our belief in ourselves and in the possibilities that lie ahead. That’s why this year, Jif Peanut Butter is helping spread a little more love in the world through the “Imagine If, With Jif” program to help fuel and nourish the potential of the next generation.Jif in partnership with Indiegogo, has funded three kids’ positive and impactful entrepreneurial ideas to build a better future for all including Milo. Milo received $10K from Jif to kick start his official crowdfunding pages in November. Jif congratulates Milo on making his big dreams for a better world come true!In January 2018, Jif will award one grand prize winner with the most successful and impactful crowdfunding project an additional $20K to help make their idea a reality. More information at Jif.com/Imagine-If.

story:
UPDATE

38 hours: We've raised 100% of our goal!

40 hours: First stretch goal met!

Day 10: Second stretch goal met!

(You can see the list of our goals and stretch goals below, and get more detail in our editorial on the subject.)

 

Background

In 2016 a group of writers launched Anime Feminist as a platform for analysis of Japanese pop culture through a feminist lens. Our goals were to:

  • build a platform for underrepresented voices
  • transform the critical landscape with fresh perspectives
  • pay everyone fairly

Over the past two years, we've cultivated a pipeline of diverse writers, a dedicated editorial team, and an engaged community of fans. We have a healthy Patreon, through which we've earned a reputation for being ethical, transparent, and financially responsible. 

By any measure, we've been successful in our goals. 

So successful, in fact, that we're bursting at the seams. 

Problem

Patreon income covers all our running costs... from 8 months ago.

Our traffic has increased, which means our hosting costs have too.

Our private community has grown, so we need to pay community managers to moderate it. 

Our pipeline is so full we sometimes have to freeze pitches, even though we only publish 5 pieces a week right now. 

Just to keep pace with our own organic growth, we need more money. 

To fulfil our ambitions of becoming a hub for feminist fans of anime and manga and hiring employees (and treating them well), we need a lot more money. 

Solution

Our next step should be to actively market our work and develop new content... but we can't justify doing either until we fix two fundamental flaws in our infrastructure:

1. Our website is hard to use, not accessible, and isn't able to support our ambitions
2. Our podcast, Chatty AF, has no transcripts

These two flaws are our only obstacles to growth. Big statement, but it's indefensible to spend money on marketing an unsuitable website, or on developing new content when our existing content is inaccessible.

So we need to fix both, as soon as possible - which requires a five-figure lump sum of cash. 

Opportunity

To raise enough money through Patreon to overhaul our website and transcribe over 90 hours of audio would take months, maybe years.

Through this crowdfunding campaign, we'll be able to fund both in a matter of days. 

With those two flaws fixed, we'll finally be able to enhance what we offer, experiment with new content, and explore bolder possibilities entirely. 

We just have to meet our goal first. 

 

Goal

Our goal is $19,900. We recently broke this number down in detail, but to summarize: 

Milestone 1: At $6,410 we'll be able to cover all external campaign running costs - CLEARED!
Milestone 2: At $12,660 we can fund our website overhaul - CLEARED!
Milestone 3: At $17,910 we can pay for transcriptions for all Chatty AF episodes to date - CLEARED!

GOAL: At $19,900, we'll be able to cover all internal campaign running costs as well - CLEARED!

Every stage of meeting our goal involves paying members of our community a fair rate for their work. When you help us reach 100%, you'll be supporting a culture of fair pay for creative work in geek spaces. 

Incentives

As a thank you to our community for supporting us in this campaign, we're offering something you've been requesting for a long time: AniFem's first ever merchandise!

We're creating a limited edition range of carefully selected items, each featuring a distinct design from original illustrations we've commissioned just for this campaign. This range is exclusive to backers of this campaign, and will not be available anywhere else. 

After the campaign ends, AniFem merchandise of any kind will be unavailable until we have the funds to open an online shop, commission new designs, and set up a solid infrastructure for production, shipping, and customer service.

Depending on how successful this campaign is, this could take some time... so make sure to get hold of any items you want while you can! 

Stretch Goals

Our community has a track record of stepping up when we ask, so we fully expect to meet this goal. As a thank you, we've then crafted and costed stretch goals to meet our top 3 most popular community requests...

CLEARED! Stretch Goal 1: at $20,500 we can create a recommendations page each for:

  • general feminist-friendly series
  • positive LGBTQ+ representation
  • series that are good for children or teenagers

CLEARED! Stretch Goal 2: at $22,500 we can build a straightforward review database featuring:

  • a centralized, ordered list of every review we write
  • a basic system enabling you to tell at a glance if we recommend a series or not
  • links to full episode reviews so you can click through for more detail

Stretch Goal 3: at $25,000 we can pay to:

  • integrate an online shop into our website
  • brand it in line with the rest of our online presence 
  • design our first range of merchandise to sell through the shop

UPDATE: Stretch Goal 4 is $30,000 - see Further Goals below for details of what it will fund.

Further Goals

Beyond $25,000 things get even more interesting. Our plans here involve funding:

  • experiments to work out whether - and how - to offer our community new streams of content 
    • e.g. the production of a single video essay so we understand the budget required to produce such videos on a regular basis and can raise funds accordingly
  • behind-the-scenes projects to help us run more efficiently
    • e.g. a social media audit and overhaul to make our online presence pro-active, consistent, and data-driven
  • research into bigger ideas to understand how best to develop them 
    • e.g. attending two representative events in order to understand how best to make events part of our growth strategy

If it looks like we're heading towards $25,000, we'll cost and prioritize as many more goals as we need to ensure that you always know where your money will go next. 

UPDATE: Our final stretch goal, Stretch Goal 4, will be $30,000, bringing us $5,000 to fund all of the above in early 2019. 

 

Risks

Any project comes with risks, and we've done our best to identify and mitigate them right from the planning stages.

Under-funding

The biggest risk is of course that we don't meet our goal, which has more negative consequences for AniFem than may be obvious at first. 

However, choosing flexible funding, breaking down our goal into milestones, and prioritizing our campaign running costs means that backers can be confident of receiving the perks they've paid for - unless we fall short of our first milestone of $6,410. 

It is of course possible that we could fall that badly short. Our target market includes many marginalized fans, who are more likely in general to have less spare cash. That part of our base could well be unable to support us at this time of year, no matter how thorough or compelling our case, to the point that we fail to break even our first milestone. 

However, we can say with confidence that it's highly unlikely. 

For starters, our community has a track record here. When we ran a fundraising drive for a four-figure sum exactly this time last year, we met our goal within three days. Some even asked how they could contribute more than the $20 limit. 

We've marketed as smartly as possible so that our community feels comfortable and prepared to support us, including publishing a series of pre-launch editorials explaining:

  • why we're crowdfunding
  • what happens if we don't meet our goal
  • who gets the money we raise
  • how much we're aiming to raise

This marketing motivated almost 200 members of our community to register their intentions to contribute on our pre-launch page. Based on these numbers and our community's typical response to our fundraising activities, our chances of falling short of $6,410 are very low. 

(UPDATE: We met our first milestone in just 5 hours, and reached 100% of our goal the following day.)

Delayed perks 

After under-funding, the biggest risk is that we take longer than expected to send you your perks. We're still in the development process for the merchandise designs, and there is always a chance that incomplete work can go awry.

It's for this reason that we chosen to work with low-risk partners: an illustrator who is a member of the AniFem community, and merchandise and shipping suppliers who came recommended by personal contacts. It's highly unlikely that any of these established professionals will let us down. 

In addition, we've consistently made our financial estimates conservative, which gives us some buffer. If something were to go wrong in a way that had cost implications, we have enough leeway built into our calculations that we should be able to absorb any reasonable unexpected costs. 

 

How to Help

There are several things you can do to help, all of which are quick and either cheap or free: 

 

1. Share this campaign on social media - with your own endorsement

Click on one of the social media icons next to the pink "BACK IT" button 

Then, before you click "Tweet" or "Post to Facebook", add your own comment explaining why you support our campaign and think other people should too. 

Just sharing is helpful too, but sharing with your personal endorsement drastically increases the likelihood that people in your network will click through and look for themselves.

The best part is, you can help us out in this way whether you're able to contribute yourself or not! If you want to see us reach our goal, this is a quick and free way to help us do that. 

 

2. Sign up to support us after the campaign ends

Our Patreon is AniFem's life-blood, our sole source of recurring income - and the healthier it is the more ambitious we can become.

As little as $1 per month goes a long way, and for just $5 a month you can gain access to our private Discord server and get to know other feminist fans of anime and manga! These small amounts add up fast, and have enabled us to achieve everything we do. 

If you like what we're working to achieve, and can spare just $1 a month, become a patron and help us continue to grow after this campaign ends!

 

3. Contribute to our campaign!

The obvious choice! Whether it's Day 1 or Day 28, whether we're at 15% or 150%, whether you pay $1 or $1000, every contribution is welcome and valuable.

Each dollar we receive nudges us closer to our vision of AniFem's future as a true hub for feminist fans of anime and manga. Help us make that vision a reality by scrolling up, clicking "BACK IT", and contributing to the campaign now.

story:
Go Tell It To The Wall has been spreading the Common Sense for almost 2 years! Now is the time to grow that passion and we need YOUR help to do it…

Go Tell It To The Wall is a podcast and YouTube channel hosted by Sean O’Rourke and covering all things pop culture and current events.  In addition, we are BIG proponents of mental health awareness as Sean is very open when discussing his own struggles with mental health in hopes of reducing the stigma felt by so many.  Sean is very passionate about his craft and it comes across in all of the shows that get published.

With your help we can grow the podcast and channel, while making upgrades and increasing the amount of content across all platforms.  Your contribution (small or large) will help to grow Go Tell It To The Wall and bring more content to fans both existing and new.

What We Need

We are hoping to raise a minimum of $1000 to upgrade our studio camera, sound board, and microphone.  In addition some of the funds will be used to create new “swag” and promotional items to give away.

There are various perks for anyone who contributes to the campaign ranging from a simple shout out on the pod, all the way to being a guest in studio for an entire episode! No matter how small your contribution, you will all be helping to spread a great brand and content.

Even if we do not reach our goal, all funds will go toward upgrades and additional content.

The Impact

Go Tell It To The Wall has been entertaining people for almost 2 years now but it’s much more than that. We always have compelling content but the best thing is when fans talk about learning new things from the shows.  Whether it’s a news piece or some silly social media trend, people respond to what we do on a weekly basis and we want to increase that engagement. 

In addition to compelling content, Go Tell It To The Wall has a mission to remove the stigma around mental illness and mental health.  Sean has struggled with this all his life and makes it a personal mission to help anyone who may be suffering in silence over fear of vulnerability.  With your help we can increase that engagement and help others in need. This, along with “common sense” are at the core of what we do at Go Tell It To The Wall.

Challenges Ahead

The podcast and broadcasting world is a very large place.  We are working to stand above that crowd and continue to create compelling content across our platforms. We believe in our message and the abilities of our host to attract and retain fans as we grow

Other Ways To Help

Knowing that it is not easy for everyone to contribute financially there are other ways you can help grow this campaign. Please share this campaign on social media platforms as well as tell all your friends! By helping to get the word out you are helping grow Go Tell It To The Wall and this campaign!

story:
Short Summary

As was said in our overview, San Diego is a hot spot for new and talented artist of every influence. But we at 'Locals Only' feel that these artists don't get the publicity that they need to grow their own audience. At the same time, great artists are hard to come by unless they're already huge, right?
_________________________________________________________________________________
You know how people say "I knew about them before they were cool?" 
You could be that person!
_________________________________________________________________________________
What we want to do is sit down with local and touring talent, preview their work, and talk to them about what they're all about. We're getting you involved, too! We already have a website and a subreddit up and running where you can post your questions and thoughts for your favorite artists, and get you in the loop.

_________________________________________________________________________________

 

 

_________________________________________________________________________________

What We Need & What You Get

Currently, we have multiple artists and a couple of other compelling guests interested in sitting down with us, two venues willing to advertise us and let us use their headliner artist, art work, a website.. Basically, a lot of the work is already done. But of course, starting a broadcast is expensive, and we're ready to tackle the biggest dollar sign: Equipment.

The list includes microphones, stands, a mixer, pop filters, headphones, and other various pieces of tech. Of course, we can skip out on some things, such as peak limiters and nice condenser microphones and do just fine, but the more we can raise, the better an experience it will be for both the artist, and for you. 

Right now, our budget sits at $1,000. But don't worry, we're not relying on you for the entire bill. 

Rest assured, every dime the campaign makes will go towards the improvement of the broadcast.

_________________________________________________________________________________

___________________________________________________

The Impact

We want to help your favorite artists grow, and to help you get to know them better. Once the podcast hits the internet, you'll be able to get involved in their work, communicate with them directly, and offer insight on what you want to see next both from the artist, and from us!

If you've made it this far, I also want to make it known that we won't only be focusing on music. We plan on having local businesses, local celebrities, and anyone of interest that we can get on board! You could also help out with that. Anyone you want to see on, just let us know, and we can try to work with them to bring the audience something new and exciting. 

Risks & Challenges

Essentially what we're doing here is starting a new business, and that can be complicated. A lot of the footwork has already been done by our team, but of course, we can't see the future. It's an expensive venture to get the broadcast up and running, but we've been working tirelessly to bring San Diego something we think could make a big difference. 

Right now we're just working towards getting the funding to acquire the tools we need, and a proper space to hold interviews. Of course we could just run this out of a garage, and if that's what needs to be done, we will make it happen. But, some guests will be more enticed by air conditioning and comfy chairs, so an upgrade wouldn't hurt.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that giving your money to a project that hasn't supplied any content isn't easy, but if you like what we're doing, there's other ways you could bring us online!

Feel free to like our Facebook page @: fb.me/localsonlybroadcast
Follow our twitter at: @localsonlycast
Share what we're doing with your friends, and try to get them involved!
One of the biggest things we could use is sponsorship. In terms of sponsorship, we want to keep it localized. We want to advertise our fellow San Diegans, and get their businesses out there. Have a friend who's starting a clothing line? Send them our way! Does your neighbor own a bar downtown? We want to talk to them.

_________________________________________________________________________________

Thank you for giving us a shot, and we are beyond excited to bring you new listening experiences!

~Locals Only Broadcast
