Basically, a lot of the work is already done. But of course, starting a broadcast is expensive, and we're ready to tackle the biggest dollar sign: Equipment.The list includes microphones, stands, a mixer, pop filters, headphones, and other various pieces of tech. Of course, we can skip out on some things, such as peak limiters and nice condenser microphones and do just fine, but the more we can raise, the better an experience it will be for both the artist, and for you. Right now, our budget sits at $1,000. But don't worry, we're not relying on you for the entire bill. Rest assured, every dime the campaign makes will go towards the improvement of the broadcast.
_________________________________________________________________________________


___________________________________________________
The Impact
We want to help your favorite artists grow, and to help you get to know them better. Once the podcast hits the internet, you'll be able to get involved in their work, communicate with them directly, and offer insight on what you want to see next both from the artist, and from us!If you've made it this far, I also want to make it known that we won't only be focusing on music. We plan on having local businesses, local celebrities, and anyone of interest that we can get on board! You could also help out with that. Anyone you want to see on, just let us know, and we can try to work with them to bring the audience something new and exciting. 

Risks & Challenges
Essentially what we're doing here is starting a new business, and that can be complicated. A lot of the footwork has already been done by our team, but of course, we can't see the future. It's an expensive venture to get the broadcast up and running, but we've been working tirelessly to bring San Diego something we think could make a big difference. Right now we're just working towards getting the funding to acquire the tools we need, and a proper space to hold interviews. Of course we could just run this out of a garage, and if that's what needs to be done, we will make it happen. But, some guests will be more enticed by air conditioning and comfy chairs, so an upgrade wouldn't hurt.

Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that giving your money to a project that hasn't supplied any content isn't easy, but if you like what we're doing, there's other ways you could bring us online!Feel free to like our Facebook page @: fb.me/localsonlybroadcastFollow our twitter at: @localsonlycastShare what we're doing with your friends, and try to get them involved!One of the biggest things we could use is sponsorship. In terms of sponsorship, we want to keep it localized. We want to advertise our fellow San Diegans, and get their businesses out there. Have a friend who's starting a clothing line? Send them our way! Does your neighbor own a bar downtown? We want to talk to them._________________________________________________________________________________Thank you for giving us a shot, and we are beyond excited to bring you new listening experiences!~Locals Only Broadcast

story:
The Story

Artist to Artist, Neighbor to Neighbor. Conversations About Home, Hosted by Shani Jamila. 

Introducing Lineage- my new podcast featuring artist to artist conversations. On this show, I invite my neighbors and fellow artists to chat with me about the idea of home.

I've spent 2019 laying the foundation for this project-- booking guests, conducting extensive research on each interviewee, leading the conversations, editing audio files, commissioning original music and graphic design, producing and hosting three live shows at the Brooklyn Museum, Soho House & Ace Hotel, making photographs of each artist and personally building the website to house the project. Phew!  

Now, my labor of love is almost ready to be in your hands! When Season One launches in February 2020, you'll be able to tune into intimate, in-depth interviews about the idea of home with some of our most imaginative thinkers-- including winners of the MacArthur Genius grant, Pulitzer Prize and Bessie Awards, as well as recipients of prestigious fellowships from USArtists and the Metropolitan Museum of Art... but I need your help to build a platform for the stories and insights of Black artists. 

This is an opportunity to support artist-led, independent media that puts us at the center of our own stories. Your money will fund the final editing and post production of the show's first season, hosting services, merchandise production,  transcript generation, IT support and seed the long term sustainability of this project. There's a whole list of amazing perks to thank you for your support-- from discounts on merchandise to personally commissioned paintings, there's something for everybody.

Click the boxes to your right to choose a sponsorship level and claim your reward! 

 

Join The Founders Circle

During the launch of the Lineage podcast, we are offering a unique opportunity for sponsorship. Inaugural donors of $500 or more will be named to the esteemed Founders Circle. These trailblazing donors have the opportunity to build the foundation for this project to flourish. Founders Circle members will be featured on the website, have exclusive access to live tapings and will be recognized as an individual, business or philanthropic group in the credits of each episode of the premiere season. Join us!  


 

About the Host

My name is Shani Jamila, I'm a painter, collagist and photographer. This year I was a 2019 Artist in Residence at MASS MoCA and the Ace Hotel.  I've spoken about the arts and society at institutions including TED, Harvard, NYU, Odeon Firenze, the New York Times and the United Nations. My work has been recognized by the Aspen Institute and my beloved alma mater Spelman College, as a woman who made "A Choice to Change the World."

For approximately fifteen years I’ve collected and shared the stories of Black artists and writers, both as the host and producer of curated events in NYC and as a founding host of Washington D.C.’s Decipher Radio.  I'm currently developing this new platform, Lineage, where I talk to my New York neighbors about how our city influences their creative practices. 

Click here to check out an excerpt from my episode with curator and choreographer Rashida Bumbray.

The contributions you make today will enable me to reach my goal of $20K.  Please contribute and spread the good word. Thank you so much for your support!!

story:
OUR STORY

We need your help to keep Stereogum going...

Stereogum began in January 2002 with a goal of spotlighting exciting bands while reporting on the music world with a critical eye. Since then we have grown into a robust community of discerning listeners (music nerds) who love to exchange opinions on all genres of music and chew over the day's headlines. Over the years we have published thousands of longform interviews (with everyone from Drake to Diamanda Galás) and reviews, hosted concerts in cities around the world, and witnessed many of the word-of-mouth successes we championed first — acts like Vampire Weekend, Arcade Fire, and Billie Eilish — become icons. 

Earlier this year, we acquired Stereogum from our former parent company and became a fully independent publication with no corporate investment. We did so with a solid plan to diversify Stereogum’s business, which currently derives all of its revenue from advertising at a time when 70% of all digital ad spending goes to Google, Facebook, and Amazon. We knew building a sustainable operation would not be easy. But since March, like so many other publications big and small, we have seen our advertising revenue plummet more than 50% because of the COVID-19 pandemic. Concerts and festivals, historically our biggest advertisers, have disappeared entirely.

We risk shutting down before we even got a chance to get going as an independent entity. We have a plan to modernize and just need to survive this tough time in order to execute it.

Scott Lapatine

Founder/Editor-in-Chief

 

THE ALBUM

An exclusive release we made just for this campaign...

Save Stereogum: An ‘00s Covers Comp is an exclusive new compilation we produced just for this Indiegogo campaign. We asked over 50 of our favorite artists to record brand new, never-before-heard covers of songs from 2000-2009. (Aughts nostalgia ... it’s time!) Donors will receive a .zip download of the compilation — including MP3s, WAVs, and liner notes — and will be the envy of their friends because it will never be released again! We won’t be streaming Save Stereogum anywhere and will never reissue it. It’s only available to supporters of this campaign.

We’re not revealing in advance what songs they covered (it’ll be a surprise) but here, in alphabetical order, is who’s on the album…

  • Anna Calvi
  • Bedouine
  • Bethany Cosentino (from Best Coast)
  • Bill MacKay
  • Car Seat Headrest
  • Charly Bliss
  • Chris Farren
  • Clipping.
  • Colleen Green feat. Diarrhea Planet's Emmett Miller
  • Death Cab For Cutie
  • Dirty Projectors
  • El-P
  • Frankie Cosmos
  • Gordi
  • Greg Dulli
  • Half Waif
  • Hamilton Leithauser
  • Hand Habits
  • Illuminati Hotties
  • Jason Isbell & Amanda Shires
  • Jeff Rosenstock
  • Julien Baker
  • Kero Kero Bonito
  • Laura Jane Grace & The Devouring Mothers
  • Laura Stevenson
  • Lucy Dacus
  • Mac DeMarco
  • Mary Lattimore
  • Moses Sumney
  • Nothing feat. Lexy Morte
  • PUP
  • Pure Bathing Culture
  • Ratboys
  • Rostam
  • Ryley Walker
  • Sad13
  • Samantha Urbani
  • Shamir
  • Sharon Van Etten
  • Soccer Mommy
  • Strand Of Oaks
  • The National
  • The Natvral (Kip from The Pains Of Being Pure At Heart)
  • The New Pornographers
  • Thou
  • Titus Andronicus
  • Tomberlin feat. Harrison Whitford
  • TOPS
  • Twin Peaks & OHMME
  • Ty Segall
  • Waxahatchee
  • Wet
  • White Reaper
  • Wild Pink
  • Wye Oak

 

WHAT WE NEED

Support your favorite independent music blog...

Your donations will allow us to:

  • Keep our small staff employed and assignments flowing to our network of freelancers. If this campaign does really well, we can even hire more full-time writers.
  • Pay our hosting, SaaS, and site maintenance costs. 
  • Complete an amazing redesign/relaunch of the website we have been working on for several months — we’re about 70% there! The new Stereogum will look more modern, be easier to navigate and search, and feature a more advanced commenting platform with all the functionality you’ve been asking for over the years.
  • Reduce the number of banner ads and remove the obtrusive units we reluctantly implemented because we really need the money right now.
  • Secure the archives of videogum.com, our defunct sister site about movies, TV, and trampoline accidents.
  • Continue our popular series The Number Ones, in which we are reviewing every #1 single ever in chronological order. We don’t wanna quit in the ‘80s!

 

WHAT YOU GET

Perks for donating...

We have some great rewards for supporters of our crowdfunding campaign. Each donation level below comes with the album…

 

‣ GENERAL ADMISSION (JUST THE ALBUM)

Our GA tier gets you a download of the album with liner notes. Here's the artwork:

‣ FRONT ROW (T-SHIRTS)

Our original t-shirts (modeled below by Phoenix and Sufjan Stevens) are all gone so we've produced the first new Stereogum tees in over 10 years.

Our 2020 shirts are available in 5 snazzy styles, are 100% cotton, and come in sizes S-XXL. All of the artists who appear on the 'Save Stereogum' comp will be getting a t-shirt so you can own the same t-shirt as those very talented and generous musicians!

Here are the styles (photos below): black with gold vintage-y design, military green with grey vintage-y design, sports grey with multicolor wings design, royal blue with white fridge design, and black with white metal design.

 

‣ VIP (ZOOM ALBUM LAUNCH PARTY/MINI-FESTIVAL)

This October 23rd (note: pushed back from September) our staff will celebrate the release of the comp at New York’s hottest club, Zoom. You'll be on the virtual guest list. Stereogum writers will emcee, infamous commenters will be challenged to reveal themselves, and we'll watch dozens of exclusive new performances from our favorite artists!

The event will be broadcast one time on fans.com (which integrates with the Zoom app) and here are some of the artists you can expect along with dozens more we can't announce quite yet...

 

‣ BACKSTAGE (LIMITED EDITION MERCH BUNDLE)

We've put together a package (bundles... everyone's doing it!) of Stereogum merch available while supplies last. Along with one of our new t-shirts of your choice you'll get:

  • A pair of Stereogum sunglasses in black, white, hot pink, translucent, or translucent lime! We will choose the color for you. Grian from Fontaines D.C. models a pink pair in the photo below.
  • A pack of the Stereogum chewing gum produced for our 2019 SXSW parties! Is it still edible? Probably. Drew from Public Practice holds a pack in the photo below.
  • Three different high-quality posters from past Stereogum concerts! These delightful time capsules were printed in very limited quantities for our SXSW shows in Austin (2016 and 2017) and our Christmas shows in Brooklyn (2016, 2017, and 2018). Each features a different lineup, and measures 11”x17”. We will choose three for you.
  • Three different Stereogum stickers! Suitable for sticking on your laptop or omnichord.
  • Three Stereogum matchbooks! Keep out of reach of children.

 

 

‣ ALL ACCESS (A CUSTOM ‘THE NUMBER ONES’)

Stereogum's The Number Ones series has been reviewing, in order, every #1 single since the start of the Billboard Hot 100 chart in 1958. (We’re currently up to the mid-‘80s.) For donors at our highest tier Stereogum.com will publish a Tom Breihan-penned, 'The Number Ones'-format review of any song. OK, well, it has to have been a Hot 100 hit, so Tom can do it properly. Choose your favorite song! Or least favorite! Or "Pac-Man Fever"! We'll contact you for your pick and credit you in the article when it runs.

 

UPDATE (7/13)

Our "Backstage" merch bundles sold out immediately, so by popular demand we’ve added some new perks for donors in the final month of the campaign.

‣ VVIP (HOODIE/PINS/STICKERS MERCH BUNDLE)

This new bundle includes:

  • A midweight, zippered Independent Trading Co. hooded sweatshirt in heather gunmetal grey featuring another thrilling new design of our name. It's a 8.5 oz poly/cotton blend.
  • A set of 3 high-quality hard enamel pins. Each is 1.25" wide.
  • A set of 6 different stickers.
  • And you also get the Zoom virtual launch party from the VIP tier along with the Save Stereogum album download.

‣ PIT (A NEW SHIRT DESIGN)

This bonus shirt features a vintage-style variation of our new design (seen on the hoodie) and the shirt comes in 3 colors (heather navy, maroon, black) and 6 sizes (S-3XL).

Note: this shirt DOES NOT come with the album. You can order the Save Stereogum comp separately if you'd like. Unfortunately due to limitations with the platform, we cannot combine shipping with a previously placed order.

 

FULFILLMENT TIMELINE

Mixing is now being completed for the Save Stereogum tracks, and they'll be mastered and ready to send out in early September. We will ship all physical rewards in September too. (For all rewards shipped outside the US, taxes and duties are to be paid by the receiver upon delivery. Please contact your local customs office to confirm these costs.)

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We know there are more pressing concerns in our world right now, and we wish we were asking for money at any other time. Unfortunately we've delayed this crowdfunding campaign as long as we could without putting our existence in jeopardy. If you're not in a position to donate, we understand. You can still help us out by sharing this campaign page. (Also, subscribe to our special email for cool people.)

story:
A Fantasy Crime Podcast

Episode 0.5 and Episode 1 Available now on most podcasting apps! 

Spotify Link

Twitter: @CSARCANUM

Crime Scene Arcanum is a 30-minute audio crime drama podcast set in the fantasy city of Aldren. The Investigators Arcanum will rely on their individual skills, magic, and good old detective work to solve their criminal cases. Fans of role-playing games like D&D might recognize creative uses of spells and other abilities.

This project has so far been independently funded. Everyone who is a part of it has done amazing work from the voice acting to the editing. They really make the world come alive. With your help, we'll be able to properly fund the team, find more amazing talent, and create more and more content!

Who Are We?

We are a small team of independent writers, editors, and voice actors who are passionate about making this world come alive for you all. 

    Goal

    $600/Episode - Each episode costs around $600 to write, record, and produce. We've planned for a 6 episode season. With the Pilot episode already available, we only have 5 more to go!

    +$4000 - If we reach $4000, we will create a feature-length (90 minute) episode as a sequel to the season. More murder, more intrigue, and more drama!

    Merch - Want some merch?  We have some great ideas in mind for the future. Supporting Crime Scene Arcanum will go a long way to helping us find the right partners for the job.

    What you get

    • Every contribution - Your name on our thank you page
    • $20 - Access to exclusive content
    • $25 - Thank you letter, logo sticker
    • $30 - Shoutout on podcast
    • $75 - Personal recorded message from one of the investigators
    • $100 - Enter raffle to voice a character in an episode
    • $300 - Voice a character without a raffle. 

    Exclusive Backer Content

    • Short 1-scene episodes called Crime Scenes
    • Scripts once the script for that episode has aired
    • Scene Commentary

    Other Support

    We'd love to continue the story of these investigators on to further seasons and keep creating content. The biggest thing we could ask of you would be to share Crime Scene Arcanum with the world.
story_txt:
A Fantasy Crime Podcast
Episode 0.5 and Episode 1 Available now on most podcasting apps! 
Spotify Link
Twitter: @CSARCANUM
Crime Scene Arcanum is a 30-minute audio crime drama podcast set in the fantasy city of Aldren. The Investigators Arcanum will rely on their individual skills, magic, and good old detective work to solve their criminal cases. Fans of role-playing games like D&D might recognize creative uses of spells and other abilities.
This project has so far been independently funded. Everyone who is a part of it has done amazing work from the voice acting to the editing. They really make the world come alive. With your help, we'll be able to properly fund the team, find more amazing talent, and create more and more content!
Who Are We?
We are a small team of independent writers, editors, and voice actors who are passionate about making this world come alive for you all. 


Goal
$600/Episode - Each episode costs around $600 to write, record, and produce. We've planned for a 6 episode season. With the Pilot episode already available, we only have 5 more to go!
+$4000 - If we reach $4000, we will create a feature-length (90 minute) episode as a sequel to the season. More murder, more intrigue, and more drama!
Merch - Want some merch?  We have some great ideas in mind for the future. Supporting Crime Scene Arcanum will go a long way to helping us find the right partners for the job.

What you get


Every contribution - Your name on our thank you page

$20 - Access to exclusive content

$25 - Thank you letter, logo sticker

$30 - Shoutout on podcast

$75 - Personal recorded message from one of the investigators

$100 - Enter raffle to voice a character in an episode

$300 - Voice a character without a raffle. 

Exclusive Backer Content

Short 1-scene episodes called Crime Scenes
Scripts once the script for that episode has aired
Scene Commentary

Other Support
We'd love to continue the story of these investigators on to further seasons and keep creating content. The biggest thing we could ask of you would be to share Crime Scene Arcanum with the world.

story:
### / Now Featured On...

For all the German speakers out there, I'm beyond excited to report that The Landless has been featured on FluxFM, a Berlin-based radio station! Help me spread the word and send your German friends to the article.

 

??? / Who is Michal Wisniowski?

I am an artist, storyteller, educator, and jack of all trades. All of it thanks to my amazing mom who took on the staggering challenge of making that journey and braving refugee camps in three countries to find us a better life.

Making this podcast has been my dream for the past two years. In that time I've been learning how to use the tools and techniques of audio production. I still have a lot more to learn.

My visual art has drawn on personal narratives for many years and has been exhibited at Yerba Buena Center for the Arts, Root Division, Headlands Center for the Arts, Arc Gallery, and Aggregate Space among others.

 

??? / What is The Landless?

The Landless will be a narrative podcast in serial form, spanning 10 episodes. You will get to follow the sound of my voice as I make this journey and hear what it took to cross the iron curtain. The podcast will be released in 2018, allowing for production time and processing of all material from the journey. Here is a preview of what that sounds like:

That part of history doesn't get talked about much. The voices of all those single mothers, who sacrificed everything to give their children a better future, have gone unheard. Their sacrifice unacknowledged.

I want to change that. That's what this podcast intends to do. It begins with one woman's journey but brings many others into its fold. The news portrays refugees in such abstract terms that it's not surprising some of us can't relate, much less care about, their fates in distant lands.

Let us come together and change the narrative. Let us show that these are real people.

 

$$$ / Everyone Loves Pie Charts

$2,750 / Food & Lodging:  When creating a five-month budget for this project I quickly realized that food and lodging will be my biggest expense. While Poland and Germany are relatively affordable, it's Denmark and Norway that have the highest cost of living. Those locations comprise half of the interviews needed to tell the story and are critical in making the entire project come together.

$1,250 / Equipment:  Additional funds will allow me to upgrade my recording equipment to get professional sound quality, but also increase my security risks. That means protective measures like insurance, extra storage devices, cloud backup, and security locks will be a must. Putting all that work in would be for nothing if the recorded data were to be lost because of theft, device failure, or border security interference.

$1,050 / Air, Train, and Ferry Tickets:  To reach most of the locations on our route, and to recreate the original experience of getting there, I will be traveling by train and ferry whenever possible. The long train routes, sometimes taking days, were difficult when I was a child. Now I will board the trains again and use the time in transit in service of the project.

$450 / Indiegogo & PayPal Fees:  Like it or not, I have to pay for the privilege of accepting your contributions. Indiegogo takes 5% and PayPal an additional 3%.

 

!!! / What You Get

Postcards from the journey: Several reward levels will receive one or more postcards from stops along the journey. It's this thing people did in days of yore, but I hear the trend is coming back.

Letters from the journey:  A limited number of contributors will receive a handwritten letter from a mystery spot along the route. Each letter will be from a different location and will include a piece of ephemera such as a ticket stub, brochure, or some other mysterious object. You will probably have forgotten all about it when, one day, something that's not another credit card offer will show up in your mailbox. Try not to throw it away with the rest of your junk mail.

 

Map from the journey:  Some of the higher reward levels also include a paper map from the route. Yes, an actual paper map with lines drawn on it. It doesn't have street view or traffic predictions and it won't help you find the best coffee shops. But it does have unlimited battery life and works regardless of reception.

Limited edition prints:  Available at multiple reward levels, these signed and numbered prints are limited to editions of 50 each. Inspired by communist era posters from Poland, both are from an ongoing body of work where I look for corporate messaging, sometimes from internal company documents, and put said phrases into an alternative context. When we take a step back and look harder at these power structures it's not so clear where the difference between propaganda and advertising lies.

Photo book from the journey: Remember all those photo albums we used to collect? This book will be just like that, but different. After the journey concludes, I will create a limited edition hardcover photo book. And by create I mean I will physically make these books myself. I'll spare you going through thousands of photos and will pick only the most interesting shots.

 

Polish dinner party: Towards the end of the year mom and I will host a Polish dinner party for a small group of contributors. There will definitely be pierogi, probably some sausage, borsht, and bigos. You will have a deliciously good time and have the opportunity to meet the legend herself. Personally, I can hardly wait for this!

 

Original paintings: Only two original paintings are available for upper level rewards. These compositions are from my Eastern Block series and are painted in acrylic on canvas paper, measuring 18 by 24 inches. I grew up in a building much like one of these, where the dust and soot would streak down the exterior when it rained. Those buildings still loom large above my memories of that time.

 

Podcast advertisement: Upper level rewards feature advertising spots on the podcast when it goes live in 2018. This could be for your business or yourself as an independent professional. The best part is that I will personally sit down with you to create a narrative ad that is unique and represents your brand in a compelling way.

 

♥♥♥ / Follow The Landless

Help me by following The Landless on Facebook and Twitter, inviting your friends, and sharing this campaign with your followers. The more we spread the word the more successful this campaign will be! Here's how we're doing so far...

story:
Welcome to Cryptid Cape

My name's Victoria and I'm the creator and producer of Cryptid Cape, a fictional podcast about a young woman finding a new start in a beach town full of cryptids. We've produced two 10-episode seasons and bonus content over the past two years with an incredible cast and crew, and we need your help to make this next season better than ever! 

We want to improve our audio quality, streamline our process, and fairly compensate our cast and crew going forward, but we can't do it without some help from our friends. And the best part is that if you contribute almost any amount, you'll be invited to an online live show we're putting on just for you!

Cryptid Cape began as a passion project of mine, but in just our first two seasons, it has grown so much. We have hundreds of regular listeners and an enthusiastic team excited to keep breathing life into this story. By donating to this campaign, not only are you helping improve a podcast, but you're directly helping our team do what we love.

 

A Breakdown of Our Goal

We've done the research and crunched the numbers (and re-crunched, and re-crunched), and found that we need to raise $1000 to make this season the best it can be while still keeping a tight budget. That may seem high for a podcast, so allow me to break it down for you:

  • $600 will go towards paying all of our actors a fair hourly rate for their work.
  • $100 will go towards hiring a sound designer to create custom foley for our podcast (free SFX libraries don't really have cryptid sound effects)
  • $300 will fund an in-person recording session for the majority of our actors (COVID-willing, as discussed in a later section) 

If we don't raise enough money to match our goal, we will still use everything we have to make this season excellent.

Perks!

You want to hear about perks, don't you?? Well, we've got some pretty great ones, if I do say so myself. Here's some more detail on all of them, and keep in mind that every tier receives the perks of the less expensive tiers below it as well.

Tier 1: Your name (or pseudonym if you prefer) will be listed on the donor page of cryptidcape.net 

Tier 2: You get a ticket to our online live show! (more info in next section)

Tier 3: You get a digital download of a Cryptid Cape-inspired painting by Melody Hardegree-Ullman, perfect for a desktop background.

Tier 4: Your name (or pseudonym) will be mentioned in the thank you section of our credits at the end of every episode in season 3.

Tier 5: One of our cast members will send you a short video personally thanking you for your generous donation.

Tier 6: For your super generous donation, a minor character will be named after or by you, whichever you choose.

Tier 7: Honestly, we highly doubt anyone would be crazy enough to give us $200, but if you do, you'll get to hang out with the entire cast and crew of season 3 at a Zoom party online celebrating the premiere of season 3!

We also have a secret, special add-on perk that is available in the checkout!

 

What Did You Say About a Live Show?

We're having our very first live show of Cryptid Cape on Friday, April 30th through YouTube Live, and if you donate at least $5 to the campaign, you're invited! The show is at 9pm Eastern Standard time (6pm Pacific time) and will feature over a dozen of our recurring characters in a never-before-heard story. With a ticket, you'll get to join us live for the show and will have permanent access to the video recording so you can re-watch it any time you want. This show will never be released on our public podcast feed, so this is an exclusive event you don't want to miss! 

Tickets will be delivered to email inboxes on April 1st, the day after the campaign ends.

 

How Do I Know This'll Be Good?

Great question! If you haven't yet, you should check out the first two seasons of our podcast. There, you can see how hard we've been working on this little project for the past two years. Cryptid Cape delivers on all fronts, from our excellent voice actors to our intriguing storyline and our dedication to representing diverse voices and stories. We need more fiction in the world for those who don't see themselves in pop culture, or who get pushed to the sidelines. In Cryptid Cape, we strive to bring those characters to center stage.

 

What Are the Risks?

To be honest, we don't have that many. We've been making this podcast remotely for the last two years and, no matter how much money we make in this campaign, we will find a way to do it again.

However, our biggest potential problem is recording in person. A large part of our budget will be going towards the expenses necessary to make an in-person recording necessary, but we're living through a pandemic. We want to get the season out in July as planned, but do not know how the spring will play out. I value the safety of my cast and crew more than anything, so if it is determined that we cannot hold in-person recording sessions, we will go back to remote recording. If this happens, we would allocate the money raised for this section of the project to the resources we would need to improve our remote recording process.

 

This is Cool and All, but I Just Can't Contribute

That's okay! We totally understand that right now is a tough time financially for so many people around the globe. Please do not donate if it would put you in a difficult position.

If you still want to help us out, though, please share this campaign with friends and family or on social media! Also, listen to and share the podcast! Every new listener we get is so incredibly important, and reviews on various podcast providers will help us climb the charts as well! 

Thank you so much for reading this whole thing. If you've decided to contribute, thank you so very much. This podcast means the world to me, and your contribution is directly supporting an artist bring her art to life. Thank you.   :)

story:
About us:

I'm Christina Morrell. I'm an American actress and singer who graduated from NYU TISCH School of the Arts, with an award for Artistic and Academic Excellence. I have since performed in several First National tours, Off-Broadway and regional theatrical productions, as well as in film and TV. I am currently acting in Los Angeles.

And I'm Diana Diaz. I'm a Canadian-Hispanic actress, singer, and professional dancer. I danced with several ballet companies and was most recently an original cast member of Cirque du Soleil's Viva Elvis! in Las Vegas. I have been in Los Angeles for 5 years studying and working as an actress and managing my non-profit, Youth Yoga.

Why a podcast?

Despite our extensive experience, nothing fully prepared us for Hollywood! We are still learning the ins and outs and the tricks of the trade and we felt like we wanted to share what we know (and also what we don't know!) with other actors. 

Our goal is to build a supportive community where information is more easily accessible. A network where actors don't have to pay an arm and a leg to learn the things nobody tells you about. 

...We want to help actors become successful! 

What is Act Like a Pro:

What makes us different from other acting podcasts is that rather than being 1 to 2 hours long and interview-based, where the person being interviewed is the main focus, our episodes will focus on specific topics and will be limited to 30 minutes. We will also have memberships available for subscribers that will give listeners access to full-length interviews, webinars and live-streams.

We are launching Act Like a Pro with a ten-episode series of ''The Basics''. Throughout these first ten episodes, we will interview several entertainment professionals, from different areas of the industry, and with them, we will address each topic from various perspectives.  As the life of the podcast continues, we will address and revisit topics for all stages in an artist's career.

Why you?

Your contributions will ensure that artists not only in the USA, but also around the world, have access to information that could really transform their lives! If you are an actor or a performer, you know how indispensable this information can be.  If you are not an actor, I'm certain you have experienced receiving life-changing information. This is what we intend Act Like a Pro to be.  A resource.

WE HAVE REACHED OUR GOAL of $1080! Since we still have 4 days left of our campaign, all  additional funds that we raise from here on will go towards: 

  1. Upgraded microphones
  2. Equipment to upgrade our Podcast to include video!

If you would like to see our mugs on a weekly basis, please share this campaign with anyone who may want to become a Founding Sponsor like you!  

Our original goal of $1080 included:

  1. $480 - Blubrry fees for hosting our podcast website and podcast archives (1 year).
  2. $14 - GoDaddy website name (1 Year).
  3. $297 - 4 Samson USB Microphones and a Belkin USB Port Hub.
  4. $209 - Marketing and other costs to ensure the successful launch so that Act Like a Pro gets featured on iTunes and reaches as many people as possible.
  5. $80 (approx.) Indiegogo fundraising fees. 

Perks! Please pick a perk, it's our way of expressing our GRATITUDE for your support and generosity.  Thank you!

Risks & Challenges

Maintaining a successful podcast can be challenging.  We risk not having a big audience, or not having high quality guests, or even, not having funds to pay for a website... Well, we have a plan that we have already put in action that includes corporate sponsorship and Patreon memberships that will be available for subscribers at a very affordable price. These members will have access to a list of beneficial resources.  We also plan on advertising on our free episodes, this will ensure the survival of the podcast.  

Between the both of us, we have a wide spread network of professionals and we are committed to creating content that is valuable and relevant.

No cash? No worry!

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • If you have no cash, you can still contribute by sharing our campaign and talking about it with your friends! 
  • Once the podcast is launched in the Spring, you can go on iTunes and rate us! This will be especially crucial in the first 8 weeks of our launch!
  • Share on Social Media, use the share buttons!

$209 - Marketing and other costs to ensure the successful launch so that Act Like a Pro gets featured on iTunes and reaches as many people as possible.
$80 (approx.) Indiegogo fundraising fees. 
Perks! Please pick a perk, it's our way of expressing our GRATITUDE for your support and generosity.  Thank you!Risks & ChallengesMaintaining a successful podcast can be challenging.  We risk not having a big audience, or not having high quality guests, or even, not having funds to pay for a website... Well, we have a plan that we have already put in action that includes corporate sponsorship and Patreon memberships that will be available for subscribers at a very affordable price. These members will have access to a list of beneficial resources.  We also plan on advertising on our free episodes, this will ensure the survival of the podcast.  Between the both of us, we have a wide spread network of professionals and we are committed to creating content that is valuable and relevant.No cash? No worry!Other Ways You Can Help:
If you have no cash, you can still contribute by sharing our campaign and talking about it with your friends! 
Once the podcast is launched in the Spring, you can go on iTunes and rate us! This will be especially crucial in the first 8 weeks of our launch!
Share on Social Media, use the share buttons!

story:
The Wee Ginger Dug is one of Scotland's best known pro-independence blogs, but content creation doesn't come out of thin air.  Bloggers have to eat.  They have to read newspapers and watch the TV news, so you don't have to.  They have to think of smart arsed things to say.  They have to reach down into their souls and bare their feelings.  At least, this one does.  All of that can only be done if you have the security of knowing that you'll be able to pay your bills and keep food on the table.

Help me to keep the blog going for another year.  I'm hoping to raise £10,000 which will enable me to support myself for the next twelve months, an amount which works out at less than the minimum wage.  This money will allow me to continue to blog, to go and give talks in support of local groups all over Scotland, and to appear at pro-independence events and to support other pro-independence initiatives.

I'm very grateful to have so many loyal and regular readers, this blog would not be possible without you.  Please help me to keep it going and keep the Dug's tour of Scotland going too.  All support however small is gratefully received.

story:
Overview: Reporting that seeks to empower

The ENERGY ACTION Project (EnAct) is a multimedia project that addresses two social issues: it aims to raise awareness of high levels of energy poverty and directly tackle the challenge of low energy literacy.
The scope of these challenges is huge: at present, almost half the world’s population lacks the energy they need to sustain basic well-being and fully participate in social and economic development:

  • 2.7 billion people have no access to modern energy (Africa and Asia)
  • 100 million cannot afford today’s energy prices (Europe and North America)
  • One energy literacy test found only 12% of people could correctly answer 50% of basic questions. 

With ~20,000 followers across social media channels, EnAct has strong public reach. In parallel, we've built strong relations with energy experts, academics, policy makers, civil society organisations and social innovators. Through engaging content, we've empowered diverse people to make important decisions about how to support Sustainable Development Goal #7 -- ensuring universal access to affordable, sustainable energy. 

For an overview of the project, visit our website.

For a fully developed thematic package, visit COLD@HOME 

To see our plans for a new package on the clean cooking challenge, see: A BURNING CONCERN

This campaign: Energy journalism internships

With COVID-19 putting business ‘on hold’, many students are left with little chance to gain work experience through summer jobs. Interns – often working remotely – have played key roles in EnAct’s development. In turn, the knowledge and skills they gain attract the attention of recruiters for long-term positions. 

We’re keen to bring new people on board over the summer of 2020, and on an ongoing basis. For each $4000 raised, we will offer a three-month internship to a dedicated and exceptional student. We hope this campaign will enable us to offer internships to students in multiple countries, thereby giving them the opportunity to work with local experts and our international team.

Interns are given opportunities to write content for diverse media, collaborate with visual storytellers, develop ideas for events and fundraising, and share in the administrative responsibilities of running a non-profit media outlet. They emerge with much deeper knowledge of the energy sector, enhanced research and interviewing skills, and a portfolio of published articles/blogs. In short, they are well-prepared to move into roles that involve communication about energy.  

Other ways you can engage

EnAct's forte is creating compelling stories and making complex topics accessible to non-experts. Our journalistic team works closely actors in the energy access field to explore how creative arts – photo/video production, interactive and graphic design, writing/editing, etc. -- can boost understanding and engagement. 

We’ve become energy news junkies, following stories from around the world about supply and demand, the impacts of energy poverty, technology advances, energy policies, financing challenges, social challenges – the list goes on.

EnAct welcomes other forms of engagement that support our mission, including:  

Write a blog: Tell us how you are engaged in achieving SDG7; we'll post and promote it through social media channels (and give you editing advice along the way!). 

Become an EnAct member: EnAct members get access to exclusive webinars that cover both energy and communications. Their profiles are featured on relevant EnAct websites to promote interaction and provide an expert database for other journalists, They also have a say, through annual general meetings, in shaping the future of EnAct.    

Be an EnAct Ambassador: Typically EnAct members, our Ambassadors take their commitment up a notch by agreeing to promote EnAct in their professional activities and personal networks. We ask Ambassadors to (as appropriate) highlight EnAct when presenting at conferences, host local events (such a film screenings or photo exhibits) and identify sources of funding to help us report on energy poverty in their own areas.

story:
The Ham Radio Transmissions (About The After Disaster Broadcast)

A comedic post-apocalyptic tale, The After Disaster Broadcast is a podcast that follows former radio host Jo Prendergast at the explosive end of the world. Keep up with Jo’s ham radio transmissions as she uses humor and luck to survive:

-the effects of a supervolcano eruption

-other survivors who could murder her or help her or both

-existential dread

-death

-no longer having running water

-MREs

…. And more!

Support the story of Jo facing these apocalyptic obstacles and more as she travels with a group of female survivors to her hometown, Chicago. This story will follow Jo as she leaves the safety of her uncle’s bunker in search of other survivors, safety, and a reason to keep going.

The Broadcaster (About the creator)

I’m J.J. Ranvier, writer, producer, and creator of The After The Disaster Broadcast and the voice of Jo Prendergast. I’ve loved podcasts ever since my parents put on Wait Wait Don’t Tell Me during long car rides. I was a storyteller even before deciding to make my own narrative podcast; having written everything from sketches to screenplays to one act plays, most notably producing and directing my play, Campfire Tales are Best Told in Whispers, during my senior year of college. When I’m not working on the podcast, I can be found playing make pretend on some stage in Chicago or saying snarky things on Twitter. @SaintofSnark

The Survival Supplies (What we need)

Thankfully we already have recording equipment and space that allows us to start recording as this campaign runs. But we still have needs!

The money you so generously give to us pays for:

-hosting

-marketing

-the space and supplies for a launch party

-the editing services of the kind and helpful Colin Votier

-the time and energy any and all artists involved

The Bug-out Bag (What you get)

Every little bit helps and will be rewarded. Even a dollar will be shown appreciation but other levels get you cool stuff like…

-Your name on our website!

-A preview of the first episode!

-A survival tip dedicated to you!

-Stickers!

-An invitation to the launch event where there will be food, drinks and a special live preview of the podcast

-A postcard from Jo!

-A signed poster!

Please note that all levels $5 and above get access to the first episode preview, even if it is not listed.

Do note that all levels below $50 only include an invitation to the launch event, not a ticket. There will be tickets available after the campaign but they not include cool perks.

The Volume and Frequency (The Impact)

When I first moved to Chicago and struggled with the transition, podcasts helped me deal with the loneliness. Those of us at The After Disaster Broadcast hope the show will do the same for anyone going through a hard time where it might feel like the world is ending. ABD aims to have a diverse cast of characters in hopes that the story speaks to those in different walks of life.

Boosting the Signal (Other ways you can help)

Don’t have a dollar to spare? We understand! Help us by spreading the word through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or whispering our name to strangers on the train. Follow us on Twitter at @AfterDisasterBC for updates and the hottest survival tips. Most importantly, stay tuned for when the podcast will launch and subscribe to the podcast on iTunes, Stitcher or wherever you get your podcasts on. Thanks!

story:
UPDATE: WE REACHED OUR INITIAL GOAL IN JUST FIVE DAYS! YOU ALL ARE INCREDIBLE. NOW, WE'RE SHOOTING FOR A STRETCH GOAL OF $9,000!

The quick success of this campaign has excited, inspired, and humbled me so deeply. I honestly had no idea if Hungry's message would resonate with anyone enough for them to support its growth. I am very happy to say that I was very wrong.

We reached our goal in just five days. Five days?!? This already allows me to pay the tuition for this residency that will help to expand the show. Now, we are shooting for a stretch goal of $9,000 to pay for the housing and food costs of the residency. Every single dollar after $9,000 goes towards equipment upgrades for the show; a new computer to update from the little Surface 3 the show is made on, and a new top-notch microphone that will give justice to the stories shared on the show.

Your generosity has caught the attention of an incredible illustrator friend of mine, who has offered to make an exclusive, brand-new Hungry shirt design (coming soon)! The more we raise, the crazier perks I can bring to you. So help us blow this thing out of the water so we can produce a high-quality show full-time. Thank you all. 

--------

I'm Otis Gray, and I'm a storyteller.

I started the Hungry podcast three years ago. It's an audio show about food, the stories behind it, the people who make it, and the power of what we eat in a polarized world. The podcast was founded on the idea that the only way to successfully navigate through a batsh*t world is through sharing authentic, captivating, honest stories.

The show has always been a platform to share real human stories that shed light on ideas and issues that affect us all. From the legendary barbacoa chef Cristina Martinez dealing with complex immigration policy, to the intrepid folks of West Virginia responding to food shortages in inspiringly creative ways. The show takes you to the Muslim-owned "Trump Cafe" in rural Texas, and then to the front lines of WWI- where donuts were responsible for the first women on the front lines in U.S. history. Since its inception, Hungry has been a crusade to understand an insane, divisive world, all through the lens of food.

The Big Break!

I was recently accepted to attend Transom, a broadcasting and journalism residency program by Atlantic Public Media. It's a career launching residency where some of the best audio producers in the world, including Ira Glass of This American Life, come to train junior producers to be successful radio storytellers. Alumni from this residency have gone on to become game-changing producers on shows like RadioLab and Nancy among others.

With your support, I'll be able to attend and share stories with a world that needs them, and be given the life changing opportunity to pursue the Hungry podcast full-time. The money you give will cover tuition, housing, food, and travel costs of residency.

Since dedicating my life to finding and sharing stories, I've become an award-winning storyteller and MothSlam Champ; the show has over 50 five-star ratings on iTunes; and I recently produced a story that was broadcasted on national radio. All of this while serving tables and doing odd jobs to support though show. 

In a world that requires honest, true stories more than ever- it's time for me to take that next big step to producing audio stories full-time. This residency is the final push to make that a reality- and it can only happen with your support.

This workshop would undoubtedly change my life and career. But really, your money goes directly toward building the Hungry platform. In doing that, you are single-handedly making it possible for incredibly important stories to be heard. Stories that make you laugh, shudder, dance, cry, stories that fire you up and inspire you, stories that might even restore your faith in humanity! These are all stories from people at the heart of our national conversations. In helping to shed light on those stories, you are taking part in very real change on a grass-roots level, helping real people achieve their goals. 

I started this show because the stories I heard around food were the most brutally honest, vulnerable, tough conversations that I'd been part of. Stories that rocked my worldview and stripped me of the many biases I unknowingly had and am still upending. In 2018, these stories are the best weapon we have in the fight for truth and understanding.

Be a part in that fight, and help to tell a story.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm asking for your support in covering the tuition of the residency, which is $6,500. The total cost of the residency is $9,500. To break it down:

  • $6,950 for tuition
  • $2,300 for housing costs
  • $285 for food 
  • $100 travel costs 

You would be helping to cover that huge portion of tuition by donating. That being said- I would love to blow that goal out of the water. If we reach our goal, I'll extend the goal to $8,500 to pay for the housing fees of residency. If we reach that, we'll do another stretch goal to $9,500 to cover food and travel costs. This would entirely pay the workshop. Each benchmark we reach, the crazier new perks I'll be able to roll out in return for your generosity. 

If we reach over $9,500, this is where things get VERY cool. This will allow me to update the equipment used to make the show (I still produce the whole show off a little old Microsoft Surface 3 tablet!). Essentially, every dollar donated over $9,500 directly contributes to a higher quality show. You would single-handedly be a part in making each episode possible. From there on- the possibilities are really endless. From bringing on production help to having money for advertising the show, there are a million things I can do with any extra money to make the show even better for you.

There are some killer rewards for donating, especially if you donate in the first week to get our Early Backer Specials!

Exclusive content, never-before-heard bonus episodes and behind the scenes audio, Hungry tote bags, shirts, hoodies, personalized recordings, advertisements on the show, even limited-edition cooking aprons. I designed this logo myself and screen-printed everything by hand in the Brooklyn studio I work in.   

If we reach the goal quickly- I'll be able to do even cooler stuff like make new designs or even bring on incredible illustrators to design custom one-time only Hungry shirts!

 

Here's some more awesome stuff you can get in return for your insanely-appreciated support.

If you listen to the Hungry podcast, you may have heard that donuts were the reason for the first women on the front lines in U.S. history. Crazy right?! Well, we found an authentic WWII-era recipe concocted by the "Donut Lassies" themselves. Now, I want to pass it along to you in the form of an awesome little recipe card that includes exclusive access to a how-to video online where I do my best to channel the bravery of the lassies into fresh, hot donuts. If we reach our goal quick, I'll be able to bring more great perks like this to you as we go for the stretch goal.

 

There are great perks at every level, whether you can afford to throw in the price of a couple cups of coffee ($5) or would be gracious enough to donate $100 - which buys you a personalized recording of your choice! Put this sultry radio voice to work: I'll record your voicemail, an audio love letter to someone, one of your favorite stories, an epic "I QUIT" message for your boss, anything you want. Be creative.

A 45-second advertisement on the Hungry podcast for a cause or product of your choosing. This usually costs way more- but it's one way I can express my extreme gratitude for your support. My platform is your platform. 

 

This is one of the comfier hoodies you'll wear, and Darren up here ^ rocks it. I wear mine almost every day if my girlfriend doesn't steal it. These are hand-printed by yours truly and made with pure love. Very limited amount. Get the hoodie & more swag pack in the first week for $25 off the normal price. 

 This is a big one. I want you on the show. Got a great story related to food to tell? Vivid memories of making grandma's badass mac and cheese in the kitchen with her? Tell your story on the Hungry podcast. Or, join in and I'll tell you  a story live on the show. Be emblazoned in Hungry history. You deserve it.

Even crazier perks if you donate more, but they are limited so grab them quick. I assure you, they are worth it. Can't tell you how much I appreciate the support, from $1 donors to $2000 donors. You're allowing me to do what I love and in turn helping incredible people get their stories told. 

Let's reach our goal quick so I can roll out even more perks for you.

 

What your support really means.

Let's be real. The time we live in is absolutely insane. It's harder than ever to know what the truth is. It's easier than ever to jump to conclusions and judge people we don't know from places we've never been to. The divide of information and the values we have has never been greater- and there are many people profiting off of the trash-fire that is our national dialogue. 

However. There are many people who are fighting every day to revolutionize the media and bring honest, sincere, hard-pill-to-swallow stories to the forefront and restore a sense of authenticity that every. person. in. America. craves.

The Hungry podcast is a platform for precisely that. It is meant to be an honest conversation with good food, bad wine, and exemplary people. Whether it's a tough, civil exchange with someone on the other side of the aisle, or a raucous and radical food fight in celebration of progress- the stories on the show are intended to cut through the nonsense and the untruths to deliver dialogue that will move us all forward.

Your support builds that platform.

I've already given every spare hour I have to making this show possible, and now I want to give even more. This residency could allow me to stop doing those other jobs to support the show, and truly dedicate all I've got to fighting the fires of 2018 onward with a ferocious search for authenticity and game-changers who might otherwise go unheard.

Not only that, but when these stories about real people with small businesses are exposed on the show, they see more traffic. When we aired our "Five Loaves and Two Fishes" story about a food bank in WV on the podcast and as an article in the national publication Narratively, the food bank received sizable donations from followers of Hungry. 

While Hungry is one small piece in the greater struggle for authenticity and truth, your support helps real people achieve their goals on a grassroots level.

In asking you to support me in attending this residency, I'm asking you to join me in sharing the stories of brilliant people fighting for change, and making sure their voices resonate.

Risks & Challenges

Making audio is not as easy as NPR shows and This American Life makes it sound. Some of the stories I've produced have taken months or coordinating, research, travel, and writing- even before any editing takes place. Being self-taught, I've made many mistakes and learned the hard way at every turn. Attending this residency and being taught by the best seasoned radio professionals will help to streamline my process, all while enhancing the quality of the stories I put forward.

That being said, I've always been a self-starter and I thrive when getting my hands dirty. I graduated from Rhode Island School of Design with a BFA in Sculpture. I co-founded and built a gourmet food truck when I was 19. I went on to become a bronze artist and welder in Philadelphia. After finding podcasts while working that job, I realized that this was the best medium to tell the stories I always wanted to share. 

I bought a microphone and got to work. It was a rough start. I hated hearing my voice in the microphone and couldn't write for radio if I was at gunpoint. Today, I'm an award-winning storyteller and MothSlam Champ; the show was awarded a grant to travel in Guatemala for an upcoming series; and I've produced stories that have been broadcasted on national radio including an in-process collaboration with the fantastic Gravy podcast.

All this to say- I do not take your support lightly. Having fought upstream to make this show happen in the first place, I truly understand how far a dollar can take me, and never take support for granted. While this is what I love to do, I feel a deep sense of responsibility to others to actually do it. Part of the reason I started this show is because no one else was sharing the stories I thought were imperative to our national dialogue. In 2018, it is more clear than ever that these stories have a big role in moving our world forward.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough y'all! If you don't have a few extra bucks to spare there are lots of other ways you can help. 

  • Share, share, share!
  • Share this campaign with as many people as you can! Anyone who loves good stories and wants to support those who share them- send them my way.
  • Share our email list. Email lists are highly effective in sharing stories and getting folks onboard with crowdfunding campaigns. Getting people to sign up for the list helps out in a huge way!
  • Follow Hungry on Twitter: @HungryPodcast. This is where we'll be giving lots of campaign updates, new perks, and everything else. Retweeting and sharing those gives a huge leg up in making the campaign successful.
  • Share the Hungry podcast. Go on iTunes or the Chorus podcast sharing app and listen Hungry. Share with your people. It's the whole reason for any of this, and I want to share those stories with you and to whoever you think will enjoy them.

From the legendary barbacoa chef Cristina Martinez dealing with complex immigration policy, to the intrepid folks of West Virginia responding to food shortages in inspiringly creative ways. The show takes you to the Muslim-owned "Trump Cafe" in rural Texas, and then to the front lines of WWI- where donuts were responsible for the first women on the front lines in U.S. history. Since its inception, Hungry has been a crusade to understand an insane, divisive world, all through the lens of food.
The Big Break!
I was recently accepted to attend Transom, a broadcasting and journalism residency program by Atlantic Public Media. It's a career launching residency where some of the best audio producers in the world, including Ira Glass of This American Life, come to train junior producers to be successful radio storytellers. Alumni from this residency have gone on to become game-changing producers on shows like RadioLab and Nancy among others.
With your support, I'll be able to attend and share stories with a world that needs them, and be given the life changing opportunity to pursue the Hungry podcast full-time. The money you give will cover tuition, housing, food, and travel costs of residency.
Since dedicating my life to finding and sharing stories, I've become an award-winning storyteller and MothSlam Champ; the show has over 50 five-star ratings on iTunes; and I recently produced a story that was broadcasted on national radio. All of this while serving tables and doing odd jobs to support though show. 
In a world that requires honest, true stories more than ever- it's time for me to take that next big step to producing audio stories full-time. This residency is the final push to make that a reality- and it can only happen with your support.
This workshop would undoubtedly change my life and career. But really, your money goes directly toward building the Hungry platform. In doing that, you are single-handedly making it possible for incredibly important stories to be heard. Stories that make you laugh, shudder, dance, cry, stories that fire you up and inspire you, stories that might even restore your faith in humanity! These are all stories from people at the heart of our national conversations. In helping to shed light on those stories, you are taking part in very real change on a grass-roots level, helping real people achieve their goals. 
I started this show because the stories I heard around food were the most brutally honest, vulnerable, tough conversations that I'd been part of. Stories that rocked my worldview and stripped me of the many biases I unknowingly had and am still upending. In 2018, these stories are the best weapon we have in the fight for truth and understanding.
Be a part in that fight, and help to tell a story.
What I Need & What You Get

I'm asking for your support in covering the tuition of the residency, which is $6,500. The total cost of the residency is $9,500. To break it down:


$6,950 for tuition
$2,300 for housing costs
$285 for food 
$100 travel costs 

You would be helping to cover that huge portion of tuition by donating. That being said- I would love to blow that goal out of the water. If we reach our goal, I'll extend the goal to $8,500 to pay for the housing fees of residency. If we reach that, we'll do another stretch goal to $9,500 to cover food and travel costs. This would entirely pay the workshop. Each benchmark we reach, the crazier new perks I'll be able to roll out in return for your generosity. 
If we reach over $9,500, this is where things get VERY cool. This will allow me to update the equipment used to make the show (I still produce the whole show off a little old Microsoft Surface 3 tablet!). Essentially, every dollar donated over $9,500 directly contributes to a higher quality show. You would single-handedly be a part in making each episode possible. From there on- the possibilities are really endless. From bringing on production help to having money for advertising the show, there are a million things I can do with any extra money to make the show even better for you.
There are some killer rewards for donating, especially if you donate in the first week to get our Early Backer Specials!

Exclusive content, never-before-heard bonus episodes and behind the scenes audio, Hungry tote bags, shirts, hoodies, personalized recordings, advertisements on the show, even limited-edition cooking aprons. I designed this logo myself and screen-printed everything by hand in the Brooklyn studio I work in.   

If we reach the goal quickly- I'll be able to do even cooler stuff like make new designs or even bring on incredible illustrators to design custom one-time only Hungry shirts! Here's some more awesome stuff you can get in return for your insanely-appreciated support.

If you listen to the Hungry podcast, you may have heard that donuts were the reason for the first women on the front lines in U.S. history. Crazy right?! Well, we found an authentic WWII-era recipe concocted by the "Donut Lassies" themselves. Now, I want to pass it along to you in the form of an awesome little recipe card that includes exclusive access to a how-to video online where I do my best to channel the bravery of the lassies into fresh, hot donuts. If we reach our goal quick, I'll be able to bring more great perks like this to you as we go for the stretch goal.
 
There are great perks at every level, whether you can afford to throw in the price of a couple cups of coffee ($5) or would be gracious enough to donate $100 - which buys you a personalized recording of your choice! Put this sultry radio voice to work: I'll record your voicemail, an audio love letter to someone, one of your favorite stories, an epic "I QUIT" message for your boss, anything you want. Be creative.

A 45-second advertisement on the Hungry podcast for a cause or product of your choosing. This usually costs way more- but it's one way I can express my extreme gratitude for your support. My platform is your platform. 
 

This is one of the comfier hoodies you'll wear, and Darren up here ^ rocks it. I wear mine almost every day if my girlfriend doesn't steal it. These are hand-printed by yours truly and made with pure love. Very limited amount. Get the hoodie & more swag pack in the first week for $25 off the normal price. 

 This is a big one. I want you on the show. Got a great story related to food to tell? Vivid memories of making grandma's badass mac and cheese in the kitchen with her? Tell your story on the Hungry podcast. Or, join in and I'll tell you  a story live on the show. Be emblazoned in Hungry history. You deserve it.
Even crazier perks if you donate more, but they are limited so grab them quick. I assure you, they are worth it. Can't tell you how much I appreciate the support, from $1 donors to $2000 donors. You're allowing me to do what I love and in turn helping incredible people get their stories told. 
Let's reach our goal quick so I can roll out even more perks for you.
 

What your support really means.
Let's be real. The time we live in is absolutely insane. It's harder than ever to know what the truth is. It's easier than ever to jump to conclusions and judge people we don't know from places we've never been to. The divide of information and the values we have has never been greater- and there are many people profiting off of the trash-fire that is our national dialogue. 
However. There are many people who are fighting every day to revolutionize the media and bring honest, sincere, hard-pill-to-swallow stories to the forefront and restore a sense of authenticity that every. person. in. America. craves.
The Hungry podcast is a platform for precisely that. It is meant to be an honest conversation with good food, bad wine, and exemplary people. Whether it's a tough, civil exchange with someone on the other side of the aisle, or a raucous and radical food fight in celebration of progress- the stories on the show are intended to cut through the nonsense and the untruths to deliver dialogue that will move us all forward.
Your support builds that platform. 
I've already given every spare hour I have to making this show possible, and now I want to give even more. This residency could allow me to stop doing those other jobs to support the show, and truly dedicate all I've got to fighting the fires of 2018 onward with a ferocious search for authenticity and game-changers who might otherwise go unheard.
Not only that, but when these stories about real people with small businesses are exposed on the show, they see more traffic. When we aired our "Five Loaves and Two Fishes" story about a food bank in WV on the podcast and as an article in the national publication Narratively, the food bank received sizable donations from followers of Hungry. 
While Hungry is one small piece in the greater struggle for authenticity and truth, your support helps real people achieve their goals on a grassroots level.
In asking you to support me in attending this residency, I'm asking you to join me in sharing the stories of brilliant people fighting for change, and making sure their voices resonate.
Risks & Challenges

Making audio is not as easy as NPR shows and This American Life makes it sound. Some of the stories I've produced have taken months or coordinating, research, travel, and writing- even before any editing takes place. Being self-taught, I've made many mistakes and learned the hard way at every turn. Attending this residency and being taught by the best seasoned radio professionals will help to streamline my process, all while enhancing the quality of the stories I put forward.
That being said, I've always been a self-starter and I thrive when getting my hands dirty. I graduated from Rhode Island School of Design with a BFA in Sculpture. I co-founded and built a gourmet food truck when I was 19. I went on to become a bronze artist and welder in Philadelphia. After finding podcasts while working that job, I realized that this was the best medium to tell the stories I always wanted to share. 
I bought a microphone and got to work. It was a rough start. I hated hearing my voice in the microphone and couldn't write for radio if I was at gunpoint. Today, I'm an award-winning storyteller and MothSlam Champ; the show was awarded a grant to travel in Guatemala for an upcoming series; and I've produced stories that have been broadcasted on national radio including an in-process collaboration with the fantastic Gravy podcast.
All this to say- I do not take your support lightly. Having fought upstream to make this show happen in the first place, I truly understand how far a dollar can take me, and never take support for granted. While this is what I love to do, I feel a deep sense of responsibility to others to actually do it. Part of the reason I started this show is because no one else was sharing the stories I thought were imperative to our national dialogue. In 2018, it is more clear than ever that these stories have a big role in moving our world forward.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Times are tough y'all! If you don't have a few extra bucks to spare there are lots of other ways you can help. 

Share, share, share!
Share this campaign with as many people as you can! Anyone who loves good stories and wants to support those who share them- send them my way.
Share our email list. Email lists are highly effective in sharing stories and getting folks onboard with crowdfunding campaigns. Getting people to sign up for the list helps out in a huge way!
Follow Hungry on Twitter: @HungryPodcast. This is where we'll be giving lots of campaign updates, new perks, and everything else. Retweeting and sharing those gives a huge leg up in making the campaign successful.
Share the Hungry podcast. Go on iTunes or the Chorus podcast sharing app and listen Hungry. Share with your people. It's the whole reason for any of this, and I want to share those stories with you and to whoever you think will enjoy them.

story:
Coldbeers and Curveballs

 

Howdy baseball fans,

 

Chase Almy and Corey Stephens started this podcast 2 years ago with a minimal understanding of podcasting and a "We'll do it live!" mentality. In our first months, we had to work hard to improve our sound quality and to reach more than just 5 or 6 people. We slowly did that and honed our craft, creating a funny and off the cuff baseball show that would appeal to the beer drinking folks that love the game. Over time we've interviewed people like Jessica Kleinschmidt and Rangers broadcaster Eric Nadel, and have entertained thousands of people just like you.

 

As we begin the third year of our podcast, we want to start it off with a bang and continue to rapidly expand our reach. We have thought up and planned a Spring Training 2019 Road Trip to Surprise, Arizona from Dallas, Texas, where we will stream audio and video of our crazy cross country trek. We'll be talking baseball news and cracking jokes for hours in the car, interviewing people and watching baseball games when we get to the Phoenix area, and pumping out content the whole time.

 

But, an effort and undertaking like this will be costly, and in order for us to do it on a really high level, we need your help. Without your contributions, our Road Trip won't be the kind of success that we envision, and our efforts in the following months will be less effective.

We're asking for your support, and promise that in return you'll find it entertaining to ride along with us virtually and experience the atmosphere of Spring Training.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our main expenses on this trip are for travel and lodging and some different microphones more suited for travel. We expect that those expenses will run us about $2400 in total. Obviously we'll need to create and buy some awesome T-shirts and hats as perks for our supporters, and there will be costs for the technology and software to create and promote the videos and share them with you and the rest of the world. We expect that those expenses, as well as the cost for marketing the campaign, will be around $900. The remaining money raised will all be put into making this trip even more awesome and into maintaining momentum and growth of our show in the coming months.

 

In the event that we don't reach our goal, we feel that we will still be able to create a budget friendly experience that will still entertain our followers and supporters. Our reach might be diminished but we still feel that we can work hard and create good content going forward.

Perks

We feel like we've got some really valuable perks lined up for our supporters.

 

At the more accessible end, we'll be shipping high quality die-cut stickers and / or custom baseball cards to our backers, as well as giving on air shout outs and thanks.

 

At the medium tier, we'll be designing and shipping T-shirts, hats, and beer koozies for our supporters with custom logos commemorating  our road trip. Rest assured that these products will only be made of high quality materials and will look amazing.

 

At the upper end of the perks offered, we will plan a trip to the ballpark with our biggest fans. For those who live in North Texas, we'll go out with you to events like Party at the Yard in Frisco (Party at the Yard is held during Thursday night home games of the Frisco Rough Riders) and have an amazing time. We'll be offering trips with us to Globe Life Park in Arlington, where we spend hours with you having a blast at the ballpark.

 

If you want to have a fun filled evening with Chase and Corey, be sure to claim one of the limited perks at the upper end of our perk spectrum. If you do claim one of these high end perks, remember that you AND a friend can both join us at Party at the Yard in any of the 3 highest priced perks.

 

 

Over the years, we've always been able to come up with solutions to the challenges we faced, whether it was opportunities that we had to improve our sound quality, learn and master new software, or create more effective ways to reach our fans. Because of this, we feel that no obstacle, whether it be in order fulfillment or logistics and planning, will be too great.

 

We're very accessible on social media if you search for Coldbeers and Curveballs, and can answer any questions you might have at any time.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For some, supporting our campaign financially is not feasible, and we understand that because we've had times of financial stress in our past as well.

 

One of the best ways that you can help us though is by telling your friends about us and our campaign or by sharing our story to your social media networks. We'd be so thankful to everyone who was able to help us in those ways.

 

We can't wait to make this campaign a success!
